Name: Sudha
Title: Mesmerising
Review: One of the cleanest templesSystematic and organisedMahakal corridor and plastic free surroundingsWas a pleasant surprise

Name: uday13867
Title: Underwhelming experience. W
Review: The vip Darshan should be coordinated. The place may have its historical significance but in terms of Darshan,  it iwas a very poor experience. Felt cheated to watch the shiv linga from second floor.

Name: Siddharth Raj dengre
Title: Amazing Vibe and Great Experience - Jai Shri Mahakaal üî±
Review: Amazing Vibe and Great Experience!- Went for Darshan at 8pm and it was really quick - BHASMA AARTI : Its the main highlight of the place and one must pre register for it on the temple‚Äôs official website, it starts at 4am and goes on till 6.15am- Dhoti for males and Saree for Females is mandatory if you intend to visit and offer prayers in the Garbh Grah and also for the Bhasm Aarti- The newly inaugurated Mahakal Lok Corridor is mesmerizing and has an amazing vibe (crowd is an issue but you really can‚Äôt help it until you are the CM)- The energy of Mahakaal is something different and too powerful, would recommend to meditate there for 5-10mins to feel it

Name: Ankit Kapoor
Title: Mahakaleshwar Temple
Review: We visited Shree Mahakaleshwar Temple during late evening, thus avoiding the crowd. The temple access is very streamlined. One must also visit the adjacent Mahakal Lok.

Name: Arun Mani Kanta Gunda
Title: Basma aarti-goosebumps
Review: Started from Hyderabad by train reached ujjain and had a early morning basma aarti darshan and also went for normal darshan really awesome and memorable

Name: moloybora
Title: Divine experience of Lord Shiva
Review: This is one of the foremost Shrine of Lord Shiva in India . Many thousands of devotees flock to the Temple every day . The early morning Darshan at 4 AM is a elaborate ritual here one feels the Divine Presence of the Lord Shiva .

Name: DrValliappan
Title: Maha Kaleshwar the Celestial form of Shiv Lingam. Basma Aarathi in midnight is special.
Review: Midnight Pooja wiith Sacred Ash from Burial Grounds earlier and now, Ash made within the temple is the special occasion that takes one to a trance feel. Visiting in other hours is also special, especially when one can get near the Shivallinga and pour water, get to touch the lingam and pray right then and there. It was so thrilling and a the experience is not definable. One should experience it. It was a once in a life time opportunity.

Name: Kanthi J
Title: Jai mahakal
Review: Very good safe and good city to visit with family .. Big mahakal temple and many people come and visit this temple

Name: dimpoo1971
Title: JAI SHREE MAHAKAL
Review: One of the 12 jyotirlingas and less than 1.5 kms from ujjain railway station. You need to be lucky to get a chance to attend BHASHMA AARTI.  Its very crowded during  Shrawan Month. Temple is sacred with lots of positivity which you will feel at MAHAKALESHWAR premises.

Name: Chalo Travellers
Title: Mahakaleshwar temple
Review: It's very beautiful place and in temple morning worship of bhasm aarti of mahakal.The temple was not crowded The location is amazing.Mahakal is the place to visit one's in a lifetime.

Name: Vijay M
Title: If planning to visit Indore, it must  visit place. It is 55 kms from Indore where you can visit by air, train and road.
Review: Mahakaleshwar temple in Ujjain. It was a wonderful trip. The positive vibes in the temple which will fill your life with positive energies.

Name: Abhishek
Title: Do Read If one has zero Idea of going to Ujjain Mahakaleswar...
Review: 1) In any Trip, one of the most important thing required is stay. I would recommend people to use clock rooms at railway station to deposit luggage. The railway station is near to temple. Even in worst traffic one can reach by max 30min. Hotels like Satyug may charge 6K and above but are good in facility. Hotels like Dayal guest house may charge 3K and above but room is very much compact. Once the stay is fixed then one needs food2) Food facility is very high. Even near Sandipni Ashram one can go to restaurant...The entire thali buffet may cost around 200rs per person.3) After coming to ujjain i would suggest one to go to Ramghat and take bath in river. Be cautious as the river flow rises drastically...Within hours of my stay the river arose by 2-3 steps4)  After the bath, i would suggest to visit temple. But i would say visit in night. At-least one may see bhasm aarti around 22:30. During my visit some big person came to temple and hence the crowd was pushed outside the temple. Collector, joint collector, SP all vehicles were parked...5) By 23:00hrs you will be coming out of temple so do visit, bada ganapti...6) Sleep in night and next day one can go to places all over ujjain like harsidhi, nag-chandreswar temple, mangalnath, chintamani ganesh, gad kaali, kaal bhariva (one of the cutest god I have seen in my life)....Do feel the ambience of gad kaali and kaal bhairava...7) In the overall trip the only discouraging factor may be the long intentional queues/barricades created by govt..... which may lead in blocking of route to temple ( like we could not go to harsidhi as routes were blocked)....But over come this thinking as the only king of the the entire time is watching everything....

Name: BharathiMani
Title: Divine temple
Review: On Namah Shivay üôè What a blessed temple! This is one of the Jyothirlingas. The temple is very clean and well maintained.The temple has great vibrations.There is a huge crowd in the month of Saawan.

Name: Murali N
Title: Bhasmarthi at Mahakaleshwar temple is a soul stirring experience
Review: The Bhasmarthi at 3 am in the Mahakal temple is a life changing experience. It is the most soul stirring experience that one can have.

Name: KeshavChakraborty
Title: Jai Baba Mahakal
Review: It is the place where 'AASTHA' is always on peak for Hindus and more lively than any other Jyotirlingas.Darshan timing is also much convenient and you can have Darshan of Lord Shiva for long duration as compared to other Shrines.

Name: Swiggy Wala #swiggywala
Title: Shree mahakaleshwar jyotirlinga
Review: Mahakaleshwar is the only jyotirlinga that faces south, and hence the name dakshinamukhi. This is because the direction of death is believed to be south. As Lord Shiva faces south, it symbolizes that he is master of death. People worship Mahakaleshwar to prevent untimely death.

Name: sandeepk3362015
Title: Jai Mahakal
Review: I visited with my family during June, 2022. I had a wonderful experience there. A few tips for pilgrims:Regarding JAL Abhishek:1. Rules of temple change on daily basis. We visited on Saturday around 6:30 pm but temple authorities told us that JAL ABHISHEK timings are from 6 am to 4 pm. Then we visited next day (i.e. Sunday) around 12 (noon). Then we were told that JAL ABHISHEK will be allowed till 1 pm only. So rules change on daily basis. Be prepared for the same.2. You need to pay Rs 1500 for 2 persons but for single person, you need to pay Rs 1000. Children above 10 years are treated as Adult and they need a Ticket for JAL ABHISHEK. Till 10 years, children need not buy any ticket.3. All males (including small children) need to wear Dhoti for entering Garb Grah. Similarly, all females (incl small kids) need to wear saree for entering Garb Grah.4. Water and lota will be provided to you free-of-cost inside Garb Grah. Some people will try to cheat you by charging money for that. Do not fall pray to them.5. Earlier Tickets were sold outside Bada Ganesh ji's temple. But now, tickets are being sold outside Bharat Mata temple.6. You cannot carry anything like prasad or flowers to Garb Grah. Security personals will snatch the same from you.7. It is better to buy old dhoti and chola set from shops outside the temple. Else you will have to wait for other devotees to share dhoti with you after their puja. One set of dhoti/chola will cost you Rs 250. Shopkeepers will help you in wearing dhoti if you require.8. Always visit mandir of Sakshi Gopal ji after visiting Shree Mahakal ji to register your attendance.9. Visit Kal Bhairav temple after visiting this temple.Regarding VIP tickets:1. Each VIP ticket costs Rs 250 per person. 2. Benefit of VIP ticket is that you reduce time in waiting in queues. Also, you get an  opportunity to see Shri Mahakal ji from first 2 rows instead of rows from 3rd number and onwards.

Name: Raman_4
Title: "SHIVA SHIVA SHIVA "
Review: Mahakal is the place to visit one's in a lifetime .This place is scared it only have huge amount of positivity you gonna feel as soon as you enter the primises.Must visit place for the devotees of lord Shiva .Highly recommended in Ujjain.

Name: SudarshanKS
Title: Blissful, Must visit
Review: A must visit Jyotirling temple. Visited on 26 and 27 April. Very blissful temple, extremely powerful.Very well maintained and managed. Very clean, extremely peaceful process of darshanHad a very blissful bhasmarati darshan. Very well organised. Extremely good puja..Very magnetic and Powerful jyotirling. A must visit...

Name: Paritosh V
Title: Jai Mahakaal
Review: Real Experience for those who believe in Lord Mahakal and have prayers on the lips and faith in their hearts. Early morning bhasma aarti is a must but for that you need to book online and you have to wear the required dresses which are provided in the temple.

Name: Traveldna
Title: Temple
Review: There is good system and flow of the people. there is paid ticket of Rs 250/- per person for quick darshan line. the cleanliness was very good. I had visited earlier in 2011, but overall systems and cleanliness has been better at least 100 times better.large bags, etc are not allowed. Mobiles are allowed but photos & videos not allowed. drinking water facility is available inside the premises at suitable distances.normally between 11 am to 2 pm rush is high and crowded. i would recommend to carry cap for aged people. the walkway is carpeted throughout and that is very good thing that the administration has done

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Mahakaleshwar is known as Lord of Time
Review: Shri Mahakaleshwar of Ujjain is 3rd Jyothirlinga of Dwadasha Jyothirlingas which is located on the bank of the Kshipra river. This Jyoothirlinga in Madya Pradesh is an Important pilgrimage site in Central India. The Idol of Mahakaleshwar is known to be Dakshinamurthy as he is facing South. This temple constrcution details are not clear as on date, but Puranas narrate that this temple was first established by Prajapitha Brahma. The Mahakaleshwar Jyothirlingam is said to be the largest among Dwadasha /jyothirlingams.Temple Architecture:This temple is three storeyed. In the lowest floor Mahakaleshwar jyothirling is installed. In the middle floor Omkaleshwar Lingam is installed and devotees come out from main Mahakaleshwar temple and just infront of exit to the Mahakaleshwar temple this Omkaleshwar temple is there on the middle floor and on top of Omkaleshwar temple the uppermost floor Nagachandreshwara temple is there, which will open only once in year on Naga Panchami.Bhasma Aarti:Bhasma aarti is the unique rituals happened only here in this temple and which is must attend rituals. Visiting Mahakaleshwar without attending Basma aarti is not a good idea. Basma aarti takes place everyday morning at 04:00 am and one has to book online ticket to attend this aarti as there are limited tickets available for the same. Worshipping the idol with holy ash obtained from the ghats and applied with scared chants is part of the divine rite.Temple TimingsIin this temple different rituals are performed. Devotees can participate in different rituals and please follow below timings for the same.Darshan: Morning     04:00 to Evening 23:00.Bhashma Aarthi         04:00 to 06:00Morning Aarthi           07:00 to 07:30Evening Aarthi            17:00 to 17:30Shri Mahakal Aarthi 19:00 to 19:30

Name: AmulAwasthy
Title: Jai Mahakaal
Review: Its always a great experience to visit this place. However there is huge amount of construction is going on here and due to this Route is Diverted and became very long. Upon Inquiring we came to know that Kashi like Corridor is on the way here... Eagerly waiting to see this temple in a new Avataar... Har har Mahadev

Name: Aum C
Title: Long queue
Review: One of the jyotirlings, this temple is in Ujjain. There is quite a bit of walk after getting down from your car, so if you have anyone who is mobility limited with you, then please think. The temple premise is also quite busy and.big. You get darshan of the shivling from a distance. The priests tend to ask you for money it, so be extra careful.

Name: FarAway581346
Title: Great experience for visiting Mahakaleswar temple and other temples in and around Ujjain. We feel blessed. Jai Mahakal
Review: At 7 AM in the morning we entered to Mahakaleswar jyotirlinga temple with vip darshan ticket and everything is well managed. We could stand for sometime In the Sanctum and no rush was there in vip Line. The temple premises are clean and temple staff are cooperative.Jai Mahakal

Name: abkush
Title: Jai Shri Mahakal
Review: One of the twelve jyotirlingas.We had darshan on a Monday afternoon and then again next morning (within 30 minutes), it was great and quite quick considering the crowd.Darshan were great as they allow you to enter garbhagriha itself.Complex was big (further construction work was going on possibly extending it even further).The complex houses multiple temples, we could find the temples with same name outside in the city, so possibly the plan is to relocate and reestablish all old temples within the complex itself.Complex was clean and well managed.Expect more crowd on Mondays resulting in longer queues and more time for darshan.Had great darshan, it was a good experience. Would like to come back again.

Name: windpace
Title: A bit difficult when travelling with people with mobility issues
Review: There is a lot of construction happening due to which the car could not drop my mother in law close to the temple.  Also, we forgot to hire a wheel chair though it is still a challenge with wheel chair.  You may be prepared for some difficulties when travelling with elderly.  Else,  people just follow the queve and have the darshan in an orderly manner.

Name: Nitin Kaushik
Title: Jai Mahakal
Review: 1 of the 12 Jyotirlinga in India. One of the holiest places on earth. which are supposed to be the most sacred Temples of Shiva. Located in Ujjain. Its also famous for its Bhasm Aarti..

Name: skdel2016
Title: Jai Mahkaal
Review: No words to say in front of aastha people have on Shri Mahakaleshwar. Temple complex is well managed . Crowd management may have better. There is construction work also in progress currently. Bhasm aarti and other bookings  is  disturbed due to server issue some times as told by some people. I  was fortunate enough to do darshan as well as attending Bhasm aarti . As demand is more with respect to supply these type of issue may arise. Go and have darshan. Jai Mahakaal.

Name: Gnyaneshwar Jha
Title: Visited in the auspicious month of Srawan
Review: Very well managed crowd inspite of covid worries. Huge and powerful shivalinga and the visit is only for few seconds but its worth it.

Name: rajesh s
Title: bed
Review: Ab managment me dhanda bna diya hai na to in logo ki koi complaint kar sakta kyoki side hi nhi chalti complaint wali, aur nahi online darshan ticket bhi nhi milte, paid wale mil jaynge aapko,managment is very poor behaviaer and managment,kam bhi thik nhi karte ab

Name: AnshumanMaini
Title: Har Har Mahadev
Review: I believe only the blessed can reach here and have darshan of Shri Mahakaaleshwar Jyotirling. I was awe struck and became speechless at the first sight of Jyotirling itself. It was something only my soul experienced and can never be defined by words. As the temple was very empty due to covid times we went again in evening and then again next morning. In evening the shringaar was mesmerising. Feeling blessed. Thankyou. Thankyou. Thankyou Lord Shiva.

Name: gpradeepshenoy
Title: Divine
Review: This temple is located about 2 Kms from Ujjain railway station and 4 kms from Nanakheda bus stand. Buses coming from Indore terminates at Nanakheda bus stand. Autos charge Rs 50 from Ujjain railway station to this temple and Rs 80 is the auto charge from Nanakheda bus stand to this temple.                  From the place where autos stop this temple entry is about five minutes walk. At present after covid temple administration has made a new rule where people visiting temple must enter names in a temple app and the SMS received after entering details of devotees must be shown to the security guards who are there at entry of the temple.If one person downloads the app he can enter other visitors details too. The details to be entered in app are name,address and any one number of government issued identity card. There is no need to show original identity card at the entrance.                   We went to temple at about 5 Pm on a Wednesday and the there were no crowds at all,we could pray in front of the lord for as much time as we wanted. There are many small temples within the temple compound . We did not go for basmarti . The laddu prasadam which is sold inside temple compound is tasty and should not be missed. There is a place to keep footwear near entrance of the temple so do not keep footwear's at shops which are near the temple.                 Near the exit/entry of temple there is a place where free herbal tea is given . Do have it , its very good. At the same place they sell herbal tea powder .                 Maa harishidhi temple is about 15 minutes walk from this temple.

Name: Gaurav Verma
Title: One of India's oldest temple.
Review: This is one of 12 jyotirlinga temple in India, u r fortunate if u get a darshan of bhole baba. Its very big and lot of crowd comes to this lace everyday.

Name: MUKHARITRA
Title: One of 12 Jyotirlinga
Review: This is a wonderful experience in Shree Mahakaleshwar Temple, Ujjain, Madhyapradesh, India. So neet and clean temple is heardly seen in any corner of India. Puja can be started from Rs. 100/- only. Prasad is available from Rs. 60/- only. No pressure from Pandas. Though the best attraction of this temple is Bhasmaarati is now unavailable for the common viewers due to covid19 alert. Before enter the temple one has to register his and all her group memebers name with I-card details in Temple website in free of cost. This is actual land of peace.

Name: sunil s
Title: Good temple
Review: Mahakal temple is very attractive.there are Around 80temple of lord shiva in ujjain. Must visit devi temple nearby mahakal mandir.

Name: Kapil G
Title: Amazing Experience
Review: One must visit Mahakaal temple atleast once in Life time, this is just not a temple , prayer here will ascend you to next level, you will surely have different experience when you visit here. energies are very high here.. come with family , friends or solo too.. and you will get Mahakaal blessings surely..

Name: Neeraj K
Title: The Beautiful Temple in the Ujjain. Jai Mahakal
Review: Attending Bhasma Arti in Mahakaleshwar is desire for every Hindu devotee. Mahakal and Bhasma Arti are synonymous with each other. Bhasma means ash. Mahakaleshwar is the only Jyotirling temple,where the Bhasma Arti is performed. I really enjoyed a lot this Bhasma aarti. Temple is very big and jyotirling is very beautiful. Must visit. Go there before a day and enjoy the Bhasma Aarti.

Name: Jaspal_Singh
Title: Nice Darshan
Review: Revised temple after 8 years. Most of temple has been very nicely renovated. Very pleasent and energetic experience. Proper checks during COVID times and good mgmt. Prasad of Laddo is very pious and delicious. Overall surroundings of temple have also been spruced up. Excellent experience!!

Name: smitra
Title: Lord Shiva the Supreme
Review: Reasonably clean environment. Well maintained buildings and pathways. Could not see the famous 'Bhasma Arati'.

Name: WriterTrouvailleWorld
Title: Tips for the first timers
Review: We visited this temple after a very long time. Things have quite changed here & for the good. The queue management system has improved a lot. Few tips for the first timers :1. Do not try to take your own 4-wheelers for visit. The temple lanes are pretty narrow & crowdy as well.2. Indian auto rickshaws are the best way to reach the temple. Walking is the fastest way if once you get stuck in the traffic near the temple.3. Be prepared to walk a lot. Parking is far away from temple. Even rented vehicle pick-up & drop point near the temple premises is a bit far & you have to walk a lot inside as well before reaching the main temple.4. Once you are inside, nobody is allowed to go near the shivlinga. You have to submit your offerings to the temple priest only.5. The behavior of the police/guards was pretty strict & rough. Duration of visit depends upon the crowd. You might not get more than a few seconds for darshan. Be mentally prepared for it.6. No electronics, leather items, etc. are allowed inside. Read the details at temple website.7. Try to take the left-side queue inside temple because when you reach the main area, that queue will give you a closer view of the shivlinga. Right-side queue get a good top view but they wont be able to submit offerings directly to the priest.

Name: Jayanti
Title: Thank you Lord
Review: Thanks bholenaath I had your darshan on March20 second week itself. I feel blessed. Divine experienceBefore the lock down sealed you called me to have yr darshanüôè

Name: Gdj
Title: Mahakaleshwar temple in ujjain
Review: Most famous temple world wide.one of the jyotirling in among 12 jyortilings in india.sweet laddu prasad is most famous at there.

Name: mmmmlp
Title: One of the 12 jothirlingam
Review: This is one of the twelve jothirlingam popularly called mahakaleshwar temple is dedicated to lord shiva worshipped as mahakaleshwar in the former of lingam. The morning bhasma aarathi is a famous pujai that is unique to this temple and is attained by all devotees visiting the temple and the tickets can be brought online. Theread are many small shrines in the middle floor of the temple including the omkareswar shrine and the famous avantika matador shrine. Mahakaleshwar sanctum is in the lower floor. The upper floor has the sanctum of nags.

Name: John
Title: Nice temple
Review: Temple is so nice and beautiful,morning bhashma aarti is nice and real,temple is cleane and attractive place.

Name: Rahul Johri
Title: Memorable experience (Must Read)
Review: Hello guys, me and my family members decided to visit mahakaleshwar temple on Sunday. We were 4 members and worried about transportation as sunday is a rush day. So after a little google search, i found a cab service named "goto cabs", i called them just like a professional mnc they picked up my call and greeted me. They assisted me with all my ujjain tour plan and not just limited to cab. Cab and driver was same as they promised, neat, clean well dressed and gentlemen. Our driver "Sudarshan" was just like a guide for us. He made our ujjain tour memorable. Never felt like out of our family member. I and my family became a regular user of gotocabs. Ya gotocabs also has a mobile app to book the cabs in local city and outstation.

Name: Ankush Sharma
Title: Speechless
Review: Do I have to share what I felt because it is understood and experience cannot be defined in words...Jai Mahakal

Name: Prasad Puranam
Title: Bhasmarti at Ujjain  a real waste
Review: The Shree Mahakaleshwar Temple was neat and clean , but during Bhasmarti , it was very badly managed, they have issued three times the capacity, the whole night we are awake , but we couldnot get a chance to sit and watch the Bhasmarti, why they issue more tickets and make the people suffer whole night , with no darshan also .

Name: Pramod1953
Title: One of the twelve jyotirling
Review: It is very famous Jytirling of Lord Shiva. we enjoyed the visit in the evening and again in morning for Bhsm Aarti. Very popular religious place. Thousands of people visit everyday.

Name: DR. KIRTI PATEL
Title: King of Jyotirlings
Review: Amazingly divine place. The entire township vibrates with positivity.The 'Bhasm Aarati' is a must must. The experience of this aarati will linger in your system for a long time.

Name: Tripathi_12
Title: Best managed Temple by Trust
Review: This temple is one of 12 Jyotirlinga in India its huge and excellently managed by Trust, after visiting the temple one can feel the presence of Lord Shiva in this holy city

Name: sangeeta68
Title: must visit
Review: i had booked my visit on the spot on luckily got the darshan. Otherwise the linesare huge and darshan takes alot of time. i just loved the tikka the pandits were putting on all the devotees. the darshan took less than half hour but the whole thing took more time becsuse the out gate is very far away from the shoes gate etc.

Name: Sailesh
Title: Nice üòä
Review: Very good vibrations.. there was not much crowd. VIP tickets are available at Rs 250 INR. Powerfully charged. Access for wheelchair available. Clean.

Name: Adityasaraswat1801
Title: Mahakaleshwar Temple Ujjain - True abode of Lord Shiva
Review: The Mahakaleshwar temple at Ujjain is a very famous and revered shrine of the lord Shiva, It is one the important jyotirlingas for Hindus and amongst the most important temples of Lord Shiva, It is considered no less then a pilgrimage to visit the temple once in your life, The temple complex is huge and allows devotees to see the Shiva Linga from the outside for most of the time and entry in the main Jyotirlinga area is restricted most of the time, In case u want to get a Darshan or the main linga then u can ask any of the umpteen Panditji around and they will help u do an Abhishek for a  price, this darshan is given till 15:00 hours only. Anyone who goes in the main Jyotirling area needs to wear a dhoti and go there, the pandits arrange for that too, The temple complex is like a very well run machinery as it has lockers for mobile phones which are not allowed in the temple area, There is also a VIP darshan counter which charges you Rs. 250 for a fast Darshan, people in hurry should opt for this. The entire feel of the temple is of course divine, it‚Äôs calming too and after u are through with the Darshan u are happy and calm for a lot of time. For a true lord shiva devotee this is a must do. I have also included a pic of the importance of the temple for everyone‚Äôs benefit - do read it .

Name: hipiyush007
Title: Peacful and Divine
Review: I visited this place in january, very well managed by trsutee , very clean and peacful place.1. We did garbhajune darshan on same day when we reached ujjain from delhi via train. No ticket require for garbhajuna for normal entry. Purchase VIP entry only if you are in hurry or their are lots of crowd.2. For bhasmarti you need to book ticket one month advance online, if you want to do jalabhishek then you must join the queue at 10-11 PM and wait till 4:30 AM atleast, else you will only be able to see from mandaps.3. you need not to worry about mandap while booking ticket as they enter on first come first enter basis.no need to wear dhoti if you are not doing jalabhishek.

Name: JaySN12
Title: Blessed to visit
Review: It was a blessing to be back here after many years. You can book tickets online and visit as per the slot mentioned.

Name: AnandG1982
Title: Divine
Review: My visit to 7th Jyotrilinga. Very clean and properly maintained temple like Somnath. Efficient management of crowd, help everyone to have very good darshan.

Name: RAKESH B
Title: Spiritual must see
Review: This place is one of the most sacred places in 12 ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ó Though the ancient original structure was destroyed (as usual) by some foreign invaders, some part is intact. Must experience ‡§Ö‡§¶‡•ç‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§ ‡§≠‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä which is done every morning at 4 am with new ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™ to ‡§¨‡§æ‡§¨‡§æ ‡§≠‡•ã‡§≤‡•á‡§®‡§æ‡§• ‡•§‡•§ Omkaareshwar is another ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ó,about 2 hours from Indore which can also be included in your divine trip.

Name: Anirudh Baheti
Title: Ujjain omkareshwar splended 2 jyotirling tour in 2 days in december by road.
Review: We were 3 family with total 5 young kids with us.We had travelled by road from Ahmedabad to omkareshwar in night and reached omkareshwar first in early morning .We took temporary room in maharastra dharmshala (dont exactly remember the name,its in front of public toiletry) for freshen up .,then we had darshan of shiva in mangleshwar temple which is at walkable distance and less crowded and then we took boat (20 rs /person)for omkareshwar temple The queue are not well maintained ,you will feel huge rush in the temple even if their is small no of people.thats why its better have darshan in omkareshwar early in the morning .after darshan we went straight to ujjain ...road is too busy till Indore so plan according .we reached ujjain by evening and did loats of bargaining for 3 room in hotel near the mahakal temple ..finally we got nice room on main road backside of temple..in evening we went to temple .in temple queues are well maintained you wont even feel rush ..we had aarti darshan of 11 pm .then we stroll around the street and went back to hotel.next morning we went to harsiddhi mandir ..Kal bhairav mandir and then straight back to Ahmedabad..note- if any one want  bhasma aarti darshan then book your slots in advances online 1 month back also you can book on spot for next day but chances are less as no of seats are few ..you have to be in queues early 2 am to see the aarti at 4 am.

Name: nilesh_nagar
Title: Om namah shivay
Review: Sacred place, one of the jyotirling in India. Very well maintained by administration. Crowded if u go on special days. In the heart of the city so easily reachable. Lot of people come from around the world to visit here. U will definitely get peace of mind visiting here.

Name: Piyush Prabhakar
Title: Jai Mahakal!!!
Review: No words to describe the religiousness spread in the entire environment. So very well managed by the Trust, Prasad shops and Flowers shop etc are reasonable and they don't cheat you just bcoz u r a Bhakt/Tourist. There is predefined price for the kind of puja one want to offer to Lord Shiva. However this is as per individual's faith to hire a priest for puja or do darshan on his own. Female family members need to wear sari and male to wear dhoti for visiting the garbh grah for close darshan of Lord Mahakal, u can buy these or even rent them just outside the temple.Jai Mahakal!!!

Name: Surjit T
Title: Mahakal
Review: Clean temple premises & orderly. Easy accessibility. A must visit for every Shiv Bhakta. Can be planned as a day visit from Indore covering Shree Kaal Bhairav & Mangal temple as well.

Name: Ajay S
Title: Jay Mahakal
Review: It is a very beautiful, clean and spiritual place. We went for the Bhasma Arti. Make sure you purchase the vip tickets and be in the line as early as 1 am. Also talk to the pandas for doing shiva abhkekam. Give them some generous Dakshina and it will be arranged. Make sure to spend an hour in the mandir court yard before leaving.

Name: Ranga C
Title: Pilgrimage trip
Review: It took around 1 hour to visit when I entered at 9:30 am. Mobile phones not allowed. Separate locker is there with locker key they will provide. No dress code is there. We can't see god nearby around 20 feet from queue we were supposed to see. Tv Display is there to see the god

Name: HWPKG
Title: Really good experience
Review: They move the line really fast and you have a really good viewing area to take a few minutes and get direct eye contact with the Jyotirlinga. Once again the pandit mafia and VIP darshan nonsense exists but other than that, it was a wonderful experience.

Name: Sourav B
Title: Shree Mahakaleshwar Temple
Review: 1. For Normal Darshana) Entries are : Free / Paid (Rs 250/person)b) Entries at normal timings 8 am - 8 pm are cumbersome. The grabhagriha might be closed in the afternoon and in the evening.c) For entering the garbhagriha try visiting post 8 pm upto 10 pm. Its open and void of people.2. For Bhasmartia) Entries have to be booked. (Rs 250 / person)b) You need to get in wearing dhoti and shawl (available at the shops outside)c) Stitched dhotis are not allowed/ should not be worn.d) Dhotis are available on rent (Rs 100 / pair) or Rs 300 + per pair alongside the jal-patra which is separately chargeable and returnable.e) Entries start at 2:30 am midnight and puja may continue till 6 am.f) Women be any should only wear saree.

Name: RangaiahManchikanti
Title: UJJAIN MAHA KALESWAR JYOTHIRLINGA
Review: One of the 12 Jyotirlingas. Very cleanly maintained temple premises. VIP darshan facility available.

Name: Mahesh N
Title: one of the joyotirlinga temple to visit
Review: this is one of the joyotirlinga temple to visit. the temple is well maintained. the organization for darshan is very good.

Name: Abhi62001
Title: Jyothirlingam
Review: With great enthu we visited this temple. We had tickets for Bhasmarati but disappointed very much. we were told to stand in the queue at 1 am and we did so. at 4 am all devotees standing the queue were allowed to enter the temple. No facility of washrooms or food inside. The website instructs not to carry plastic or mobiles but so many people had phones with them. We became fools for not having carried mobiles. At  4.30 we entered the main temple where all the galleries were full and no place to sit. We couldn't perform abhisheka though we carried cups with us. Couldn't see bhasmarathi directly but we had satisfy ourselves by seeing relay in the TV. Some VIP along with shirts and pants entered the sanctum sanctorum did Abhishekam also. Though the temple is very good and worth visiting, we were dissatisfied because of the working style of the temple authority. Decoration done after all Bhasmathi was eye arresting. Wonderful decoration where lingam was looking so bright and devotees felt blessed. It is better to go for normal dharshan or special dharshan of Rs 250 instead of Bhasmarathi. Generally religious sites will be visited by aged people so washrooms and food and water facilities should be provided in the temple complex.

Name: Mili Dutta
Title: Divine
Review: Ujjain is know for Mahakaal temple. Divinity at its best. Must visit incase you are Ujjain. Blessed!!We had taken online VIP passes, though the temple was not crowded that day.

Name: Mayank S
Title: Nirvana
Review: One visiting Mahakal temple should attend bhasm aarati. One need to reach temple by 3 in the morning. Thus hotel nearest to the temple is best suited.

Name: Ravirkd
Title: Amazing
Review: We attended Bhasma aarti and were deeply amazed to see the way it is performed, a life time experience.  If you are in Ujjain please do not miss this event.

Name: Pavan
Title: Poorly managed Jalabhishek
Review: First of all, I would like to make it clear that the context of this review is about our experience  of Jalabhishek. While Bhasmarathi and the overall temple atmosphere is amazing, we had a terrible experience of Jalabhishek.The pujaris and the temple volunteers managing Jalabhishek handle the crowd extremely poorly that leaves a bad taste. In the sanctoram, the pujaris literally pull and push people, including the elderly and kids. This can have safety issues given that the place also gets slippery during this time. My 5 year old was handled poorly as she apparently did not completely meet their dressing standards. While I get that temples may have their rules, here they take it to the extent of forcefully physically handling even kids that can hurt, physically and mentally. My kid was terrified as multiple volunteers pulled her out of the queue. Elderly people were also getting pulled and pushed while entering the sanctoram.The folks were perhaps doing this due to the large crowd to manag and limited time to complete the jalabhishek. However, it is unacceptable how this pathetic treatment can literally hurt people.The temple authorities should seriously think of managing the jalabhishek better and treat people visiting here with respect.The bhasmarathi, on the other hand, was amazing.My recommendation is that if you are visiting with elderly folks or kids, skip jalabhishek and instead directly head to bhasmarathi.

Name: Abhijay Hire
Title: A HISTORICAL VISIT
Review: Our group had to see this temple as this is one of the jyotirling of Shankar. There is a great mythological story behind it and the building's architectural design is also fabulous.Leather items are not allowed in this temple.There might be people who try to scam you stay away from them.

Name: Debasish Das
Title: One-time go
Review: If you want to go Mahakaleswar. Don't go for vasma arti.the complte night will waste to stand in queue. But we will see the arrati in TV screen.

Name: skumsar
Title: skumsar@ Shri Mahakaleshwar Temple
Review: Superb Experience of early morning Bhasma Aarti !Lord Shiva as Mahakaleshwar, do visit and get Dharshan of Sri Mahakaleshwar Jyotirling.

Name: Rulz4rusty
Title: Sharing itinerary from Pune-Indore-Mahakaleshwar- Omkareshwar-Trimbakeshwar-Grishneshwar-Pune
Review: Full itinerary is been shown with proper cost, time, route.I have not attached any food and hotel expenses.

Name: Sgupta104
Title: Ujjain Mahakaal
Review: Excellent Temple must visit the place long queue Mahakaaleshwar jyotirlinga take time for Darshan . .

Name: varadarajan
Title: A Lifetime experience and must visit...
Review: Very well organised clean temple. Basma Arti and Darshan of Jyotirlinga, a must lifetime experience...plan in advance...

Name: Prasanna S
Title: A spiritual sojourn!!!
Review: One of the most amazing temples of India, this heavenly abode houses one of the prominent jyotirlingas among the 12 revered. The place oozes with peace, tranquility and satisfaction. Witnessing the lord taking bath in milk is a sight to watch and an event that will be etched in your memories forever. When you are in Madhya Pradesh, do visit this abode and realise the benevolence of Lord Shiva. Har har Mahadev, Har ek Mahadev!!!

Name: Gauri R
Title: BLESSED by Mahakaleshwar!
Review: This is the 3rd of the 12 jyotirlingas and every Hindu must visit in their lifetime. The temple is one of the best maintained temples in India. The entry is very well organized. There are lockers to keep your valuables. A designated area for footwear. Once inside the temple premises, again it is very well organized and extremely clean. We reached the temple at the time of the Aarti and it was an unbelievable spiritual experience to watch the Aarti of Shri Mahakaaleshwar. Outside the main temple, there are many smaller temples which are also very nice. Definitely a once in a lifetime visit!

Name: Mithuncotha
Title: Only few people are blessed to visit
Review: Amazing, clean and organized inside. Keep going and you will be getting a darshan. Dont bother to speak to any purohit until you need any spl assistance and have money to give them.

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: Beautiful Jyotirlinga
Review: One of the great Jyotirlinga of India, this temple is very well organised and is wonderful to have darasanas of the Lord . Best time is in winters . Lots of historically important temples all around the holy city of Ujjain

Name: Sanjay12101981
Title: Weekend Trip - Indore + Ujjain + Omkareshware
Review: Strongly recommended. Pls don‚Äôt miss Bhasma Aarti , Kalbhairav temple, Harsiddhi temple, Mangalnath temple, Ramghat Aarti.

Name: vinay760
Title: Mahakal Darshan
Review: One of the most historic temple and must visit for all people. Please read history before visiting to understand its importance and impact etc.  It is normally crowded and take VIP darshan for small line and visit during working days and avoid holidays.  it is challenging to visit near idol because another ticket is required and Pandit takes you inside for Puja etc.   overall organization and quality or cleanliness can improve for such historic place and one of the biggest pilgrimage for Hindus.

Name: Flyer784404
Title: Religious Tour to touch upon one of the 12 Jyitirling (devoted to Lord Shiva)
Review: If you have faith, & value Hinduism teachings then thus is one of the place to be to feel truly mesmerised in Shiv-Bhakti. By deeply involving in humming sounds of the temple‚Äôs AARTI & the DHOL-NAGADE one virtually gets united with the supreme ONE. Visiting MAHAKALESHWR means that you are offering water to HIM with devotion, which require devotees to enter the sanctum sanctorum with only Dhoti (undergarment can also be wore), tying of which is an art (one may see videos on YouTube, as you will require to be in Dhoti for at-least 4 hours) and reach temple by 4am for BHASHM AARTI.Otherwise also, one may plan to visit any other time. However, BHASHM AARTI is considered to be most suitable, particularly in light of the presentation of Lord Shiva in Hindu PURAN & other religious texts. .

Name: Sanjay12101981
Title: Strongly recommended
Review: Must visit place and please don‚Äôt miss the Bhasma Aarti. Mahakal jyotirlinga is the most powerful avatar

Name: vroy29
Title: Mahakaleshwar temple visit
Review: To visit the sanctum - ladies need to wear saree and men in dhoti . Dress code applicable to children also

Name: Karthik R
Title: Great experience
Review: We reached Indore by 19:15 and took a taxi to Ujjain for Rs.1200 from Indore airport. We reached Ujjain by 8:45 and visited the Mahakal temple. Surprisingly, we had darshan directly with absolutely no crowd and absolutely no waiting time. We came out by 21:15 after a great dharshan. We used public queue and no entry tickets bought.

Name: rajeshagarwal2016
Title: maha kaal
Review: temple is full of serenity and you can get darshan of lord maha kal in approx. 1 hour as there may not be much queue if you are not on any festive day

Name: Natarajan S
Title: Great temple for devoteees of Lord Shiva!
Review: This temple, one of the 12 Jyotirlingas in India, is well-maintained and the dharshans are very satisfying  though the neighbourhood is quite congested, the temple itself is clean!

Name: sanjib1971
Title: Its So Serene ... Beautiful
Review: Very very Spiritual, Serene. Love to Visit Many More Times and Spend the entire day there. Did Puja with Very Nicely, Purahit was very helpful too

Name: Nithin M Agarwal
Title: A must visit for better insight into Hinduism
Review: This place is one of the 12 Jyotirlingams in India. (Light - Jyoti). Easily accessible by Road/ Rail from Bhopal and other major parts of the country, this is a must-visit-site on any religious traveler's list.The temple has nearby hotels, which are available on all sorts of budgets for  different traveler types. Reach in the evening. Sleep overnight. Next morning, get the Aarti and Darshan scheduled around the dawn.If visiting with deep faith in your conscience, the effects and experiences can be mesmerizing. The Mahamrityunjaya Mantra keep playing in the temple and the market surroundings. So, it elevates your positive energy within, knowingly or unknowingly.There is enough security, cleanliness, eatery and washroom facility to take care of your needs.Date of Experience - March 2008.

Name: Rohit banyal
Title: Devine visit
Review: A must visit for anyone coming to Ujjain. The approach roads a narrow & you can not carry wallet, belt, mobile etc in the temple

Name: Sivakumar V
Title: A Jothirlinga Temple- one among the 12 sacred places of Lord Shiva
Review: One of the 12 Jothirlingas of Lord Shiva. Dates 5th BC or even earlier. The Lingam is a Swayumbu.The silver domed sanctum sanctorium has within the idols of Parvathi, Ganesha and Subramanya too.  A big temple reasonably maintained  despite the huge pilgrim rush. The one thing we admire about the temple is the meticulous way the rituals are conducted. The bhasma aarthi in the early morning is a must to be seen here. This Bhasma Aarhti dharshan is  paid one at a nominal rate. The devotees sit in long queues from midnight outside the temple. They are allowed into the temple by 4 AM and are allowed to take holy water in a vessel which they have to bring- a small copper vessel or a tumbler. They are allowed to do the abhishek themselves on Mahakaleshwar. A thrilling experience. Then the devotees are led to a big auditorium in front of the Main deity. By 6AM Mahakaeshwar ( the Lingam) is showerd with copious amount of Bhasmam. This and other harthis take place for about one hour. One has to experience this spectacle.The Bhasma Prasad relieves you from all sins.But note that, all the gents , including boy-kids have to wear dhoti as kachcham - a traditional way. Nobody is exempted.The holy water is from the holy tank in the temple.The Nav graha in the rear side of the temple is a wonderful place. Near the same, cultural activities are also conducted on occasions.

Name: 1Jayanthi
Title: Jyotirling on the banks of river Shipra.
Review: This famous and powerful Jyotirling is in a beautiful temple on the banks of river Shipra. It is advisable to go for the Rs300 VIP ticket ... other wise it will take long especially during Sharavan month

Name: soumendra kumar M
Title: Mahalaeswar jyotirling
Review: Mahakaleshwar Temple is one of the 12 jyotirlings situated in Ujjain. Ujjain is one of the very ancient cities of India with rich cultural heritage.Bhasmaarti performed at 4 a.m.is very unique & auspicious and one must attend to get blessings and to feel powers of Lord Shiva.The followings points should keep in mind while preparing to darshan Bhasamaarti .1.Must book online the entry pass to attend the Aarti.The online bookings open 30 days advance.2.The male should wear gents dhoti and no cloth on upper part of body.The women should wear Indian saree

Name: ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§ø ‡§ï
Title: Divine
Review: No words to describe the feelings, It is one of the bestest place i had been to. Would love to travel again and again and again.

Name: 1Jayanthi
Title: Powerful Jyotirling
Review: We went to Ujjain ( the road from Indore is very good) and had darshan of Lord Mahabaleshwar in this Sharavan month... the crowd was large but we took special darshan called VIP tickets at Rs.300 and had quick access. We were fortunate to be there at 10.30 am and hence could witness the Maha Aarti.Blessed

Name: Jasraj pardeshi
Title: Jai Maha Kaal
Review: This temple is one of the 12 Jyotirlings in India and its worth visiting when you visit Ujjain. The other temples near by are Har Siddhi Mata Temple which is one of 51 Shakti Peeths of Sati Dev. It is said that the elbow part of the devi's body had fallen here. Further you can visit Kal Bhairav Temple which is famous in India as it is the only temple in India where the deity is offered ALCOHOL

Name: Hitesh K
Title: Spiritual Experience of Devi Maa
Review: Take Aarti of morning or evening and experience presence of Harshad Mataji there. Leave your stress aside and focus medicate on Mataji only. Location is very nice , Avantika nagari is now Ujjain and feel religious . If you don't believe in Hindu religion , then don't go.

Name: pmmathur
Title: Nice clean temple
Review: Must visit if you are visiting Mahakaleshwar Temple. The deep towers (oil lamps decorated on a tower) is peculiar feature of this temple. It is said that King Vikramaditya was devotee of the Godess who fulfills all your wishes. It is close to Mahakaleshwar temple.

Name: Prashant
Title: Must to visit Bhasma Arti
Review: Classic feeling once you visit Mahakal..you will definitely get satisfaction. Kindly plan for Bhasma Arti which is very important.

Name: williamsamaddar
Title: "Divine"
Review: The Goddess in all her benevolence and divinity is housed in this temple, one of the 51 Shaktipeeths of Devi Ma. Here is  where the elbow of the Devi is said to have fallen. Harsiddhi Mata Temple is one of the key shrine of Goddess, worshiped from pre Vedic period. She was also the cherished Goddess of the geat emperor Vikramaditya. This holy Peeth whose premise hosts three other temples including one of Karkateshwar Mahadev is located close to Ram Ghat in a north easterly direction from Shri Mahakal. One attractive feature of temple is two towering Deep Stambhas built by the Marathas. The evening Arati held here is simply breathtaking.

Name: Ankit Kapoor
Title: Maa Harsiddhi Shakti Peeth
Review: Maa Harsiddhi Temple is located near Mahakaleshwar Temple. It is a Shakti peeth, one must visit the Temple while visiting Ujjain.

Name: Manujkhurana
Title: Very peaceful and divine!
Review: Must visit!Very peaceful and divine.No queue as such and you can have darshan in peace.It‚Äôs near to Mahakaal temple only / walkable distance

Name: dimpoo1971
Title: lighting of diyas on the pillars
Review: Walking distance from Ram Ghat and is one of the Shaktipeeth. Best time to visit the temple is in evening during Aarti time around 7pm.Lighting of diyas on the pillars during Aarti is the main attraction of this temple.

Name: KeshavChakraborty
Title: Classic Sandhya Arti
Review: Though many consider this temple as one of the Shaktipeethas but that doesn't matter because of the lively environment during Sandhya Aarati.If you are in Ujjain, don't miss the Arti.

Name: SudarshanKS
Title: Shaktipeeth
Review: one of the 18 shakthipeeths, a must visit temple. Just close to Mahakal temple. the devi is very divine, blesses instantly.A very well maintained temple... one must visit at least once in lifetime.

Name: Murari Lal Biyala
Title: A place for Tantric worship
Review: A must visit place while visiting Ujjain for a pilgrimage tour.The place dedicated to goddess siddhidatri,

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Kuldevi of Emperor Vikramaditya
Review: Harsiddhi Temple is located just walkable distance (400 meters) from Ujjain Mahakaleshwar temple, when you are coming out from Mahakaleshwar temple it will be on the right side of the Junction. This temple is constructed during Maratha period and have four entrances one in each direction. Main entrance is on the East side. This is one of the 51 Shaktipeeths of India. Sati mata's elbow fallen here when Lord vishnu cut Godess Sati's Body in 51 pieces. This temple stands 13th in the list of 51 shakti peetas.There are two temples for Harsiddhi matha, one is located in Dwarka, Gujarat and otherone is this temple. It is believed that Maharaja Vikramaditya has pleased maa harsiddhi and took her to Ujjain. with this beliefs morning prayer will be done at Gujarat Dwarka and Evening Aarthi will happen here in Ujjain.Special Attraction of this temple:1. Godess idol is in the Red color in nice decoration2. Thist temple has Upalayams (other small temples) inside primises. Chinta Haran Ganesh, Bala Hanuman are famous out of those upalayams3. Shiv ji temple is located left side of the main temple when you are coming out of the main temple, Lord shiva here is called as Karkateshwar Mahadev.4. Shree Yantra is there on roof of the temple which represents the 9 forms of the goddess Durga5. Godess is located inside the closed small temple with the other two godess Mahalakshmi and Mahasaraswati6. There are two big deep stambas located otherside of the temple, that are lit up on the eve of every festival. There are 726 lamps in each tower, These lighted stambas will give special attraction to this temple.Temple timings:Morning 05:00 to Evening 07:00Aarti timings:Morning 07:00 and Evening 06:30

Name: abkush
Title: One of the shaktipeeths
Review: It is walking distance from Mahakal temple. Very easy and quick darshan.It is one of the shaktipeeths and is built by Raja Vikramaditya.Overall good expirence.

Name: windpace
Title: Easy and quick darshan
Review: You can complete the Darshan within half an hour.  It is quick and easy.  Not much of walking to do except there are a few steps that you need to climb and that may be kept in mind in case traveling with people with mobility issues.  We had our elderly parents with us.  We didn't stay for the lamp lighting in the evening due to our itinerary.  If you can you should plan in such a way that you see it. It is a beautiful site is what we were told.

Name: skdel2016
Title: One must go place if your are travelling ujjain
Review: This is considered as shaktipeetha and kuldevi of then maharaja vikramaditya. Very calm place. Main attraction is at evening when deep stands re being lightened . One should go earlier to have sitting space.The face of goddess is smiley and attractive. Temple is well managed.   Jai mata di.

Name: AnshumanMaini
Title: Splendid evening aarti
Review: We went during the evening aarti only when all the diyas are lit up and the atmosphere becomes charged up and mesmerising with Arti and dhol nagada sounds and the view of diya is such a treat for the senses and the soul ofcourse. Do yourself a favour by going during the sunset only. Yes this is Shaktipeeth of Godess Sati so has significance for Shiva devotees visiting Mahakaaleshwar Jyotirlinga. Jai Mahakaal!

Name: gpradeepshenoy
Title: Must visit place for seeing evening g aarti
Review: This temple is located about 10-15 minutes walk from mahakaleeshwar temple, Ujjain. when we walk from Mahakaleeshwar temple to this temple we can also find the Vikramaditya statue en-route.                       Went to this temple during the evening aarti time at about 6:45 pm. I think this is the best time to visit the temple. During the evening aarti time the diya lights are lighted on pillars and its a beautiful scene to watch. Immediately After this aarti samosa/kachori is distributed among devotees. Do not miss that. Samosa/Kachori is given at left side of the temple compund. For seeing this aarti there was a huge crowd and by 7:30 - 7:45 the temple was almost empty .Even though there is crowd during evening aarti time darshan of goddess can be had with ease as most devotees will be sitting in the temple compound to watch the lighting of diyas on the pillars .                  A must visit temple in evening for seeing the aarti and lighting up of diyas.

Name: MUKHARITRA
Title: Temple made by Vikramaditya
Review: This temple is made by Raja Vikramaditya, one of the major attraction of Ujjain. Every wishes will come true is the main moto of this temple. Well maintained and calm climate will heal your mind.

Name: Jaspal_Singh
Title: Very Nice Darshan
Review: Ancient temple, huge pillars for lighting lamps. Powerful and energetic experience. Temple nicely maintained and proper entry checks during COVID times.Must visit.

Name: Gdj
Title: Mata harsiddhi temple in ujjain
Review: Most famous mata harsiddhi temple in ujjain.there is one shakti peetha of lord mataji.a lot of devotees present there in navratries.

Name: Sktangriin
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: The temple belongs to Harsiddhi Mata, worshipped by Raja Vikramaditya. There are two towers of diyas in the temple which look very beautiful in the evening at the time of Aarti. The people whose wishes are fulfilled, contribute for adorning Diyas.

Name: Pramod1953
Title: Visit to Harsidhi Templ
Review: it is very famous Devi temple in Ujjain. it is said that when Lord Shiva was taking the grbat sati from the ygya of Dakshya Prajapati the elbow of Sati fell here. Harsiddhi is thw worshiping Godess of King VIKRMADIYA.

Name: Tripathi_12
Title: Divine and sacred place
Review: This temple is beautifully managed and of Harsdhi Devi, who is goddess of Durga,  you can sit and offer prayer in calm and quite atmosphere

Name: Sailesh
Title: Awesome
Review: Loved it.. one of the Shakti Peeth where there is not so much crowd and also Pandits do not harass you. The Mandir is very powerfully charged and the drawings on the inside walls are lovely.  The different forms of Maa are depicted very beautifully.

Name: hipiyush007
Title: Shakti Peeth -Harsiddhi mata
Review: Its a shakti peeth of Mata Sati, a must visit place in Ujjain, When you book an auto\taxi for mandir darshan they will take you to 9 temples in which this one is also included.A tata magic will charge you Rs.1200 for entire mandir darshan. Try to do mahakal darshan separatley from this as it will save lots of time. its on a waling distance from mahakaal.

Name: AnandG1982
Title: Harsiddhi
Review: Visited this temple after visiting Mahakal temple. It is around 500-600 meters from Mahakal temple. Could be maintained properly.

Name: Ajay S
Title: Beautiful Arti with more than thousand Deepak.
Review: Visiting this temple for the evening Arti was my best experience at Ujjain. Besides Harsidhi, there are Ganesh and Mahadev temples that are very beautiful. The temple is clean and provides very calm environment for the visitors.

Name: Luv to Travel
Title: Witnessed a Divine Harthi !
Review: The vibration when entering the temple is great. We were on time for the evening Harthi. Never seen one such before. the experience was divine. If anyone is planning to visit the temple, please do not miss this Harthi.

Name: Gdj
Title: Harsiddhi temple.
Review: Most famous temple near to mahakal temple. Easily reach by local public transport.in navtatri a lot of devi devotee visited there.

Name: Abhi62001
Title: Shaktipeeth darshan with deepa stambha
Review: Our first visit to this temple gave us a great blessings fr0m Harsiddhi mata. This is one of the shaktipeetha, where the lips of  sati fell in this place. At 7 pm we entered the temple, had darshan and sat out side the temple to watch sitting the stone lamp post. There are two stone lamp post with 1011 lamps in each on ether side of the temple. Everyday they will be cleaned and kept ready for letting in the evening. when the drum beats start, three persons climb the the post and less then 3 minutes they lit all the lamps which is really amazing. This temple is near to Mahakaleshwar temple. Best time to visit is evening. Must visit in Ujjain.

Name: Mili Dutta
Title: Divine
Review: This is one of our Shakti Peeths.A must visit at Ujjain. Divinity at its best. Must visit incase you are Ujjain. Blessed!!Caution - Slippery due to the leakage of oil from the lamps. Watch your steps.

Name: Chirayu
Title: Beautiful Temple
Review: This is the temple dedicated to Goddess Harsiddhi mataji. There are two big Lamp(diya) towers where lamps are lit in the evening.It is nearby Shri Mahakaleshwar Temple.

Name: Mohan
Title: Worth a visit after Mahakaleshwar Temple
Review: 1. This Shaktipeeeth located 600 metres from the Mahakaleshwar Temple is a must visit after the main darshan.2. Clean with parking available on the road in front.3. Evening Pooja is quite impressive when the Diyas are lit on the two columns.

Name: varadarajan
Title: HARSIDDHI TEMPLE - MAA DURGA SHAKTIPEETH
Review: A must visit Temple, very nearer and walkable distance from Sri Mahakaleswar temple -  vibrating,clean well maintained. Evening Aarti(by 6.30 pm), a value addition and enjoyable experience. Enjoy and get blessed.

Name: Gauri R
Title: Must visit in Ujjain!
Review: We visited during the pious Navratri days and were blessed! This is one of Mata Sati's shaktipeeths. When in Ujjain this is a must visit. Even with the enormous crowd this temple felt extremely well organized. The queue kept moving at a good pace and we were blessed with the Darshan within a few minutes. The temple premises are very well organized.Inside the temple, please look up to the ceiling where there is an exquisite SriYantra. Beautiful! Stay blessed!

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: One of the Siddhapeethas of Goddess Sati , the consort of Lord Siva , this is a must visit temple in Ujjain . Very powerful and strong vibes . Specially worthwhile to visit during Navratri . Very near the Mahakaleshwar temple.

Name: Sanjay12101981
Title: Evening Aarti - not to be missed
Review: A shaktipeeth of Maa Durga and walking distance from Mahabaleshwar temple. Evening Aarti is splendid when all divas are lit up..Try to be in temple by around 6pm else it‚Äôs too crowded to go in

Name: rajeshagarwal2016
Title: shakti peeth
Review: this is one of the 52 shakti pith of our country . temple is very ornamental during evening aarti when all oil lamps of  deep stambh are lit .

Name: Nithin M Agarwal
Title: A must visit for better insight into Hinduism.
Review: A must visit for better insight into Hinduism.As you have Lord Shiva residing in Mahakal form in Ujjain, the presence of Shakti also nearby has to be there! This is it.The temple is built by King Vikramaditya and around it there are many places to be visited within about 2-5 kms radius. The temple has an aura of its own and tends to clean off your mind of all the unnecessary burden that you have been carrying, giving your inner strength and clarity of mind.Peace. Tranquility.Date of Actual Experience - August 2009

Name: Rohit banyal
Title: Quite & religiously full filling
Review: The temple is really good..it can be easily clubbed with Mahakaleshwar mandir & you would definitely have a religiously full filling feeling

Name: soumendra kumar M
Title: Harsidhhi mata
Review: It is a very famous temple. Also known as a Shakti peeth. A must visit place in ujjain. Visitors must visit this place after shri mahakaal darshan.

Name: Gdj
Title: Mata harsiddhi temple
Review: Deepmalikae in harsiddhi temple is most atttactive.two to three pwople rimb op piller to flow deepmaikae in temple in most genuine manner.

Name: 1Jayanthi
Title: Deep towers
Review: This Shakti Peeth has got two deep towers at the enternce. This towers have many oil lamps. The Devi is powerful and had Her blessings

Name: Jasraj pardeshi
Title: Shakti Peeth
Review: This Temple is worth a visit in Ujjain. It is one of the 51 Shakti Peeth of Devi Sati. It is said that the elbow part of devi's body had fallen here after it was divided into parts by Sudarshan Chakra by Lord Vishnu.

Name: plpalani
Title: Sakhthi peeth
Review: When Devi Sati was cut by Lord Shiva, her body parts fell in 51 places which are called Sakthi Peeth.Here the elbow of the Devi supposed to have fallen here.The two Lamp towers in the enterence are majestic

Name: Shael
Title: Aarti is spectacular
Review: The evening Aarthi is worth watching. The lighting of the lamps on the tall lamp posts by skilled climbers is a spectacular event. This temple is one of the 52 shaktipeeth of Goddess .

Name: skagarwal74
Title: Good temple near Mahakaleshwar temple
Review: Maa Harsiddhi temple is very near and walk-able distance from Mahakaleshwar jyotirlinga temple. Its located on the main road. The temple is good. There is parking available nearby. From here, Normally the road is a barricaded towards Mahakaleshwar temple and one has to go from here by walk about half a km away.

Name: Giri S
Title: Visit to Harsiddhi Temple
Review: Was lucky to attend evening harathi followed by glowing of deepas on two pillars. It was wonder full experience. Had wonderful darshan of Maa Harsiddhi who is one of the asta dasha shakthi peethas.

Name: Sanjaykumar P V
Title: Pleasant experience
Review: City of temples and one can get a pleasant experience.  Nearby Mahakaleshwar temple and also several small shops outside the temple selling local made items

Name: trivediar
Title: Divine & Holy Place
Review: Very nice temple of Harsiddhi Mata. It is just 150 meters walking distance from Shri Mahakaal Temple. One must visit the temple and attend evening aarti. Jai Harsiddhi Mata.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Divine Lights..At harsiddhi temple
Review: Evening diya lighting ceremony is the main attraction of this place. two big diya towers are situated at the campus of the temple and  during evening time 1000s of diya's are illuminated which create a amazing ambiance and simply admirable.. the event is so beautiful as you even forgot to blink your eyes...

Name: Gdj
Title: Harsiddhi temple ujjain
Review: One of the famous temple near shipra river ujjain.there are very attractive deepmalika in every navratri days

Name: travel l
Title: Beautiful
Review: We watched the two gentleman climbing up the towers and lighting the individual wicks. The evenings here are stunning beautiful and all the people are quiet, a great atmosphere

Name: Bharat P
Title: Awesome Lighting of Diyas
Review: The lighting of Diyas in the evening is awesome and very unique. Deep Jyoti Stambh or Deepa Stambha is a unique piece of Hindu architectural structure, usually found in many Hindu Temples. As the name indicates Deep means Diya, Jyoti means Light and Stambh means a column. Two such columns are erected outside this Temple compound to be illuminated with Diyas. The lighting takes place in the evening ans is worth watching how the lamps are lit. Everyone are seated in an organised manner and watch the lamps being lit one by one, wonderful experience which we will chreish always and forever.

Name: Dipteshrao
Title: Great experience
Review: This is a religious and attractive place to see where at the time of Aarti those two stupa have been flame with lamps which looks beautiful It has been said that at the time of Arti mata Harsiddhi remains present Must visit this place

Name: rathod2017
Title: Harsiddhi Temple
Review: The Harsiddhi Temple boasts of an idol of Annapurna painted in dark red colour between the idols of Mahasaraswati and Mahalaxmi. this is is must see place in Ujjain city.

Name: narathar
Title: Sakthi peedam....powerful deity
Review: The temple  is one among the sakthi peedam and is considered to be a powerful deity.  The temple is cleanly maintained.  You have ample space for parking in front of the temple.

Name: ramnita16
Title: Visit to Mother on trip to Mahakaleshwar
Review: Visited on Friday evening. There was no rush. Had a blissful Darshan to our heart content. I could say all my prayers without anybody pushing me out from the front of the idol

Name: Satish Kumar Singh
Title: Totally soul engrossing place
Review: Harsiddhi mata temple is one of the places where one gets the overwhelming feel of the presence of the Divine Mother-Her feminine shakti in its totality..The temple is pious,clean and wellmanaged.

Name: ashish saxena
Title: very attractive temple. Nice piece of ancient Architecture.
Review: Close to Mahakaal Temple, It is one of the ancient temple of Maa HARSIDHHI. It's a treat to witness evening "AARTI" .At that time they illuminate all DEEPAK on Both Pillars. I swear, you will never forgot that mesmerizing scene.If you are in Ujjain ,just don't miss it.

Name: CHETANsurat
Title: Jay Mata Di
Review: Beautifull holi Maa Harsiddhi temple.Mataji temple is in big area.Clean area.Near Mahakal Mahadev temple.Vist this temple.

Name: Leena N
Title: Harsiddhi temple
Review: Temple is so clean & tidy. you will feel relax. ambiance is also very good. very close to Mahakaleshwar Jyotirling.

Name: RanjithKumarPrabhu
Title: Ancient shakti peeth
Review: This Shakti peeth was worshipped well before the time of Raja Vikramaditya 2000 years ago. Located on the banks of Kshipra river, this temple is a major attraction of Ujjain. The lighting of the two huge diya (lamp posts) in the front of the temple is a major attraction in the evening, at around 06.30pm. The lamps are lit top to bottom fast in a minute's time, that too by old men.

Name: Neelamraju
Title: Harsidhi Maa
Review: Harsidhi Maa Temple is a Shakthi Peeth. This temple is another important land mark of Ujjain. It is one of the 51 major Shaktipeeths of India. Goddess Parvati took the form of Harsiddhi to kill two demons at the behest of Lord Shiva. The main deity, Harsiddhi Mata, is painted in dark vermillion color with idols of Mahasaraswati and Mahalakshmi on either side.Harsiddhi Shaktipeeth is considered as a big source of energy and power. .The festival of Navratri is celebrated here with great splendour and belief. Many lamps and candles (Diyas) are flamed which create a tremendous and divine scene.We witnessed the lights at night and it was a pleasure to watch

Name: Sushant Kumar
Title: Divine
Review: One of temple which is must visit in Ujjain.It's one of the Shakti Peeths. Less Crowded. Preferred time to visit is in the Evening.

Name: Abhishek Mittal
Title: Evening aarti is must to watch
Review: It is one of shakti peeth of lord durga. Walking distance from mahakaal temple.. Enjoy the place in evening with darshan of lord and aarti of lord with a lighting of large no of diya..

Name: verbartic
Title: Serene and divine
Review: Beautiful and blissful darshan Would recommend to visit for sureConsidered as part of the shaktipeeth, one of the 52 places where Devi Sati body parts fell. Do visit. No restrictions on leather, mobile etc

Name: Sivakumar V
Title: Temple to be visited in the evening
Review: Tha famous temple in Ujjain has Harsidhi Mata as the main deity. It is one of the Sakthi Peetams ( place where the right arm is said to have fallen) in India. There is also a shrine  for big Ganesha. A small beautiful temple. The temple has two Deepa Sthupas ( pillars about 30 feet tall,on each of which , around 500 diyas could be lighted . They are called Shasra Deepa Sthambhas. In the evening some designated persons climb on the pillars first to put oil and wicks in each. Then at the harathi time they light each diya from the top to the bottom very quickly, a sight which no one could miss. It is something like the changing of flags atop Jagannath temple in Puri ,

Name: Vishnu Pendyala
Title: A powerful Shakti-peeth to complement Shiva Jyotirlinga
Review: It is not as ritual intensive as Mahakaleshwar, but I presume it is equally significant and complementary.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Near mahakaleswar
Review: This is one of the sakti peedams, and is near mahakaleswar temple. the morning aarati at 7am is tronged by the locals especially the ladies. they have a well organised queue and so will be able to see the harsiddhi mata quiet good.

Name: Hitesh Rathore
Title: Another devi temple
Review: This is another devi temple located in n ujjain. Noting very special and you can skip it if you are not religious.

Name: Ashish Gupta
Title: Situated at Bank of Shipra
Review: Ujjain has hundreds of Temples, and it's not possible to visit each and everyone of them if you are not local.Some temples are main attractions and have unique value. This temple is also one of them

Name: meenakshimuthusamy
Title: Neat and well maintained
Review: The place is very beautifull.It is a beautifull temple.It is a famous temple in the state of madhya pradesh in the city of ujjain.

Name: babita13
Title: Harsiddhi Mandir
Review: The temple is at walking distance to Mahkal Temple.It is a peaceful place and interesting to see in evenin after aarti .

Name: Namjoshi
Title: Harsiddhi Mandir
Review: Originally this was Annapurna Temple. This was rebuilt during Maratha Kingdom. There are two Deepmalas in the temple.

Name: shaileshjpai
Title: Temple
Review: It is a  divine experience to see lightings of 2 deepmalas. Real treat to eyes.very near to Mahakaleshwar Mandir

Name: poojathakur13
Title: Must visit
Review: The temple is ancient and one of the shaktipeeth. It's quite peaceful in the temple too. Not much rush when we went. It has two beautiful deep malas on the enterance which gives a beautiful look to the temple.

Name: Jayashree G
Title: The Kuldevatha of Raja Vikramadithya and a Sakthi Peeth
Review: The Hara Siddhi Mata temple is a must visit in Ujjain.  This temple is where the ELBOW of Maa Sati fell and is a Shakthi Peeth.  The sanctum of Chintaman Ganpathy is also there in the premises with a sanctum devoted to Lord Shiva.The highlight of this temple is the daily evening ritual of lighting of lamps on the 2 pillars near the entrance.  People assemble by 6 pm and the lighting starts around 6.30 onwards.  It is indeed a spectacle worth viewing.It is believed that one‚Äôs wishes are grantedby the Hara Siddhi Devi.  It is also believed that one must visit Maa first before going to the Maha Kaleshwar temple.

Name: Ajay KMehta
Title: Small bur quiet and ancient
Review: Very nice and quiet and relates to very ancient history of indian culture.Very small but powerful.Sad to see river Shipra being dirty and not looked after.

Name: haren_kgp
Title: Amazing display of lighting of diya tower
Review: Harsiddhi temple located near mahakaleshwar temple and near Ram Ghat of ujjain.At the time of evening Aarti there fantastic display of lighting of more than 1000 diyas in two towers by 5-6 very skilled person.You must attand the evening aarti at 7 PM.

Name: Pree B
Title: Powerful
Review: Blissful experience..especially during navratri. It was a quick visit though during our journey in Ujjain

Name: Atul Shah
Title: a shakti peeth
Review: has the biggest lamps of india , a set of 2 pillars with 1008 diyas on each. nice idol and a very religious feeling

Name: Ravi D
Title: Shaktipeeth in Ujjain
Review: Har Siddhi Temple is one of the Shakti peeths. Located very close (~0.5km) to the Mahakal temple on the way to the Shipra river. Place is generally not crowded and has oil lamp twin towers (see pic) with earthen lamps, in which oil is filled up every day and lighted up. Caretakers climb up the tower every day multiple times during this to fill up oil in each earthen pot. There is a provision to sponsor everyday lamp lighting by paying Rs 2100. Must visit when in Ujjain

Name: Dilip123
Title: Shaktipeetha in Ujjain
Review: Harasiddhi mata temple is one of the 52 shaktipeethas. It is a must visit if you are travelling to Ujjain. The face of the goddess is orange and is beautiful. A divine and mesmerizing place. There are two lamp posts out side the shrine . We visited the place in the evening during aarati to witness the lamps being lit. We had read about this event earlier.However, we go to know that the towers are lit only during navaratri and deepavali.

Name: meghashyam
Title: Maa
Review: Maa is splendid , very close to mahakaleshwar temple . Small stairs lead to her shrine . Maa is swayamboo .

Name: Narendra Gupta
Title: One of the Shaktipeeth
Review: Please do visit this place if you worship Shakti. This is located approx 1 km from Mahakal temple. I have visited this place during Navratri and not crowded in morning time

Name: Mahesh Kulkarni
Title: Harsiddhi Maa Temple - fulfilling demands
Review: ‡§ú‡§æ‡§ó‡•É‡§§ ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•ÄExcellent premisesWell maintainedToo much crowdGood securityDrinking water Must visit

Name: Sunnilbgautam
Title: Beautiful Devi Shaktipeeth
Review: This is a very beautiful temple. It is a Shaktipeeth. With lots of spiritual energy. Evening Aarati with litted oil lamp twin tower.

Name: Dr K K S
Title: Vibrant spiritual energy at this Shakti Peeth
Review: Visited twice, once during the day time, when the rush was minimum. The Diety smile is spellbinding. The Shreeyantra on the dome is intriguing. AT night witnessed the lighting of the lamps ceremony, which is one of its kind experience.

Name: mathurshradha19
Title: Brilliant diya lighting and energy place
Review: Do not miss the evening aarti and reach the temple at 7 pm to enjoy the two towers being lit brilliantly by men who will climb vertically and light each and every diya. Must visit if you want to complete Mahakal darshan.

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: Beautiful goddess temple
Review: This is one of the shaktipeethas (or power centres) rendered rather energy filled place of Goddess . Legend has it that Goddess Sati ,the other half of Lord Siva , faced insult at her Father Daksha Prajapati's place because he intentionally didn't invite Lord Siva to a yagya or holy ritual . She took her life by immolating herself through her power. Siva was angry with this and sent his powerful soldier Virbhadra to destroy the place . All commotion broke lose . The people requested Vishnu to stop the carnage and he cut Sati's body into 52 parts which fell at different places and called Shakti peeths. Harsidhi Mata is one such pious place . Nice ambience with temples of Lord Siva and Ganesha in the vicinity

Name: Krishnaveni S
Title: Mersemerising evening lighting of lamps
Review: This is believed to be a Shakti peeth of maa Sati's elbow. There are two tall pillars(tower) of Diya which is lighted during evening. It is a mersmerising sight to watch. You will never forget this

Name: AasthaD
Title: Diwali!
Review: Must visit for the evening deepmala. Men climbing up two floors of diya (oil lamps) tower, filling up with oil and wicks and then with music of Dhols and mantras by pundits lightening of the tower is a sight not to be missed.

Name: Omkar P
Title: VISIT TO HARSIDHDHI TEMPLE
Review: The temple is very good and neat and clean and there is not too much devotee when I visited the temple. Arrangement for devotee is really excellent.

Name: arunbvkumar
Title: shaktipeeth of elbow of godess sati.
Review: Seated between the idols of Mahalaxmi and Mahasaraswati, the idol of Annapurna is painted in dark vermilion colour. The Sri Yantra, the symbol of power or shakti, is also enshrined in the temple and the temple is built in the shape of Sri Yantra. The 52 alphabets of sanskrit depciting 52 shakti devis is shown on the temple ceiling. Divine place to visit

Name: Niten M
Title: Mesmerising
Review: Just the energy and the quickness in the lighting of the lamps is an adrenaline rush. A must see sight in Ujjain for both the religious and the non-religious peeps.

Name: rameshtiwari03
Title: Mata ke Darshan
Review: This is also one of the very auspicious place and Shakti Pith  known as Harsiddhi Mata. You get lot of rush during Navratri. But in comparison to Mahakal Mandir , darshan possible in less time very comfortably.

Name: The Golden Age f
Title: Shaktipeeth
Review: It was raining profusely the time we went to the temple. We were very keen to see the lightning of huge lamp stands in front of the temple and Harsiddhi mata aarti. As it was raining lightning of lamps got cancelled we could only attend the aarti. The room of Harsiddhi mata is very small. During aarti time it is divided into two parts one side ladies and other side gents leaving place in between for the devotees to enter. Hardly 20 members can sit on one side. Few young boys in very loud voice recited the  shlokas of aarti it took nearly 45 mins, though I  was comfortable but for few elderly people the loud sound and standing for long was tiring. Don't know whether these rituals takes place every day or not but had a very nice darshan of Harsiddhi mata. I felt blessed after visiting.

Name: Amit S
Title: Shaktipeeth "Nice darshan and good place for medidation"
Review: I visited this place with my friends and it is a very good place. It is located near Mahakaleshwar temple in Ujjain. I would recomend you visit this place in the Navratris so that you can see the giant oil lamps lit. That is a fabulous view.

Name: premal18
Title: UJJAIN TOUR
Review: very peaceful temple. we attend sandhya aarti,there are so many divas on pillar. looks like stars on sky..

Name: ToothForTaste
Title: its a Shakti peeth
Review: this temple is also a big one...there are pillars of diyas at the entrance which are said to all being lighted with oil, its situated on the banks of river Shipra.

Name: Sudha
Title: Can be avoided
Review: Very unhygienic surroundingsSurprise element was the alcohol offering to the deityThe socalled devotees were only speaking about the alcohol prasad

Name: S M
Title: Very good darshan
Review: Huge line, but managed a good darshan. üôèüôèTemple clean and neat.  Lots of monkeys around. There's a temple dedicated to Sri Dattatreya God, single face.

Name: pmmathur
Title: Very open spacious Temple
Review: Belief is that Kal Bhairav was the lords defence incharge and therefore kal bhairav should be also worshiped with the lord. Here wine/alcohol is offered as prasad to the lord. This temple is far from Mahakaleshwar temple.

Name: williamsamaddar
Title: Powerful place
