Review: A trip to Ujjain is incomplete without offering a puja to Kaal Bhairav, the fearsome form of Lord Shiva who is believed to be the guardian deity of the city. Located a little over 5 kilometers to the north

Name: moloybora
Title: Best place to for Rahu Dosha elimination
Review: This is an unique temple in Tantrik Tradition and supplements Darshan of Maha Bhairav Temple  in Ujjain. The uniqueness is that the devotees offer liqueur in this Temple to the Shrine

Name: DrValliappan
Title: A rare temple of Kaala Bhairavar (Kal Bhairav) in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, Central India
Review: The vaahan (accompanying animal form; a statue of which faces the deity here is dog). There is also an unique tree of lamps just outside the temple. Small temple but, a lot of barricades make long, winding path for queues and combing the steps. Small shrine and on permission, photos / videos are allowed. If one goes through a shop keeper by buying archana items, short cuts to enter and exit temple are provided. No entry fee or charges. Kal Bhairav here is offered with bottles of liquor (as coconut, garland, banana, betel leaves etc are offered in many temples) and there are Pooja items shops with liquor shops outside. An unusual experience.

Name: dimpoo1971
Title: UNIQUE TEMPLE
Review: It is said that this must be visited to complete the Mahakaleshwar Darshan.The Prasad is Liquor, but it is not mandatory to offer it. Flowers can also be offered.First time in life I saw liquor being offered to God as Prasad in the temple.Temple is surrounded by shops selling liquor bottle along with flower, sweets etc.

Name: BharathiMani
Title: Unique
Review: A very unique and interesting temple. Kaal  Bhairav ji likes alcohol so that's offered to him. There are liquor shops outside.The temple entrance can be better maintained.

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Unique Place where liquor offered to please God
Review: Shri Kal Bhairav temple is one of the famous and most visited temple of Ujjain situated close to Shipra river, which is located @ 6 km distance from Ujjain Mahakal Mandir.Ujjain Kal Bhairav temple is as much famous as Varanasi Kal Bhairav temple and there are some similarities between these two temple's formalities, one of that is visiting Kal Bhairav temple before visiting the Main Mahakal temple. It is believed that Kal Bhairav temple is located here since 6000 years and also details are mentioned in the Skanda Puranam. Present visible temple is built by King Bhadrasen in 9th century and then renovated during Maratha rulers, and there are suppose to be some good paintings in the Malwa style inside  but they are not visible today. Secondly no one has attention towards them as all eyes are on the deity, into whose mouth liquor is poured. This temple is Known for:1. This Kal Bhairav is regarded as the guardian of Avanthikapuram, which is called as Ujjain today. Due to this reason Ujjain Kal Bhairav lord is also called as Kotwal of the city.2. Liquor is offered here to Devotee as Prasad through out the year, witch is strange but true. The Priest offers Liquor in saucer and takes the saucer near the mouth of the Kal Bhairav idol, When he starts tilting the saucer, with in Minutes the wine will get empty and no one knows where it is going. Devotees believes that lord is having this Liquor.3. As per the standard rule Devotees first has to visit this temple and then only visit Mahakal Mandir. It is believed that without visiting Kal Bhairav temple, Ujjain trip will not fulfill and also if you are not visiting Kal Bhairav before Mahakal Mandir Visit, your wishes will not fulfill and will not get blessings of Mahakal. So most of the visitors first Visit's Kal Bhairav and then visits Mahakal Temple.Temple Timings:Morning 06:00 to Evening 08:00

Name: KeshavChakraborty
Title: Offering of liquor to God
Review: Very popular among pilgrims and tourists and also believed to be Live, that's why you will find much more crowd in this temple.

Name: SudarshanKS
Title: unique Kaalbhairav temple
Review: A nice temple dedicated to Lord Kalbhairav. The key offering to the Lord here is liquor sold in shops outside.Very nice kalbhairav moorthy and a blissful darshan

Name: abkush
Title: Nice temple
Review: We visited the temple during evening. It's a small temple with people offering liquor to Kal Bhairav ji.There is one huge deepmalika here, which is lighted in evening, we waited another 45 minutes for it to be lighted up, and it was very much worth the wait.The whole process of preparing deepmalika (towers of oil lamps) and lighting it up is quite unique and should not be missed.Darshan are quick and easy.

Name: windpace
Title: Check if the construction is over if travelling with elderly
Review: We visited the Kal Bhairav Temple in December 2021 along with my in-laws.  There is a lot of construction happening in front of the temple which meant my mother in law who has problems in walking had to take a round about (uneven) road to reach the temple.  So, if you are planning to visit with elderly or with divaang then you may want to check the status before making plans.  It is not that it is impossible to visit with them but it will likely be inconvenient.  Rest is all like what is said in other reviews.

Name: skdel2016
Title: Unbelievable but True
Review: Its an old temple complex . The main prashad is wine which is being offered to  Shri Kal Bhairav. The offered wine is drunk by Shri Kal Bhairav statue. Normally there is rush which can be managed better but administration is lacking here . In case of heavy rush Purohit put your offering of wine in container near Shri Kal Bhairav  which later being offered to Shri Kal Bhairav. It's unbelievable but true that statue drink the wine. There might be different science angle in this phenomenon but aastha and believes  are above all logics. Shi Kaal Bhairav is supposed to Senapati ( Head of Army) of Shri Mahkaal Raja.  Beware of Monkeys as well. Jai ho..

Name: AnshumanMaini
Title: Kal Bhairav
Review: Good place for a short visit. 5- 10 mins. We went during covid times and nowadays liquor is not being offered. So can't say much but one has to visit it after visiting Shri Mahakaaleshwar Jyotirling and that's about it. Jai Mahakaal!

Name: gpradeepshenoy
Title: A good temple to visit in ujjain
Review: Took an auto to this temple. Autos charge Rs 300 for visiting three places, Kal Bhairav mandir, Mangalnath temple & Sandipani ashram. We took an auto at about 6:00 Am so the charge was Rs 300 else the charge would have been Rs 350 as per the Auto driver.                We reached this temple at about 6:20 Am and this temple was completely free of other devotees. No shops which sell liquor/flowers were opened in this time.We had a good darshan of the lord.                Will suggest to visit this temple in early morning to beat heat of the day and also crowds.

Name: Ankush Sharma
Title: Nice Temple
Review: Very nice place and adorable. You can see lord drinking alcohol in front of you and people tried everything to find out the reason but failed. Must visit the temple. Avoid going on Sunday as you will be surprised to see long queues.

Name: Prasad Puranam
Title: good place
Review: Nice place by taxi / auto , it is there belief and faith in the GOD , It is about 20 minutes by auto for visit , if you hire a electric vehicle for Rs 300 for three hours drive

Name: Sktangriin
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: The place is well maintained and is thronged by people. The temple comprises statue of Kal Bhairav. The people offer liquor and other things to the deity. The temple is a must visit for people visiting Ujjain.

Name: Pramod1953
Title: very famous temple.
Review: we visited the temple on 10th Feb.'2020. it is one of the famous temple in Ujjain. The diety is Kal Bhairav.

Name: sangeeta68
Title: interesting place
Review: we had gone here after visiting the main temple of ujjain.here they worship god and give offering of spirits!

Name: Rudra Sharma
Title: Mahakaal and Kaal bhairav unique duo.......
Review: Ujjain is famous for its Jyotirlinga of Lord Shiva, i.e. Mahakaal; but it is equally famous for the temple of Kaal Bhairav. Situated in the outskirts of the city area, this temple is famous for its unique offering of liquor as prasadam for the deity. Visitors to this temple offer liquor besides usual offerings like coconut and flowers etc to the deity. The priest takes a small quantity of liquor in a plate and takes it near the lips of the deity. Within few seconds the liquor goes inside the mouth of the deity. Throughout the day this system continues and nobody knows as to where this liquor has gone. Obviously, for the followers, it is a miracle of the Lord; and one cannot deny it too as the miracle happens just in front of our eyes, so there is no doubt about rethinking or doubting.

Name: hipiyush007
Title: Old temple of Bhairo baba
Review: Its an old and ancint temple of Bharion baba. here devotee offer alcohal to Bhairon baba.Alcohal is easliy avaialble on all parshad shop outside temple but prices are on a bit higher side.Main temple entrance is very narrow so you need to wait for on hour in queue on normal days. Its also included in your mandir darshan package of auto.

Name: Sourav B
Title: Kal Bhairav Temple
Review: 1. Its towards the outside of the city, should cost around Rs 350 inclusive of 6 destination spots (inclusive of this one)2. Legend has it that you offer some sort of alcohol to the deity. You shall easily get it in the stalls outside.3. Though only a bit is allowed to pour in, the rest you can take away as offering prasad.

Name: Abhi62001
Title: Unique experience
Review: First time in my life I saw liquor being offered to God in the temple. Long queue for the dharshan. Beautiful entrance, surrounded by shops selling liquor bottle along wit flower and agarbathi. Cleanly maintained temple with lots of youngsters visiting the temple.

Name: Mili Dutta
Title: Divine
Review: Kal Bhairav temple is a must visit at Ujjain. Divinity at its best. Must visit incase you are Ujjain. Blessed!!The world famous Bhairav statue consuming alcohol can be witnessed here.

Name: Gdj
Title: Kal bhairav temple ujjain
Review: Most famous lord bhairav temple in ujjain.i visited on bhairav astami tithi.a lot of devotee there on bhairav astami.

Name: Debasish Das
Title: Wine god
Review: Once in my life ,I saw these god. Take wine as Prasad.there is long queue. So just visit the temple.

Name: Mohan
Title: Must visit to complete the Mahakaleswar Darshan
Review: 1. It is said that this must be visited to cmplete the Mahakaleshwar Darshan.2. The Prasad is Liquor, but it is not mandatory to offer it. Flowers can also be offered.3. Pooja in the anctum Santorum can be done by requesting the security staff .

Name: varadarajan
Title: Sri Kal Bhairav Temple - unique experience
Review: This temple is famous and unique - wine offering to God is primarily focussed. A clean, well maintained, spacious temple. A must visit temple in Ujjain. Enjoy and get blessed.

Name: Satya B
Title: Kal bhairav temple
Review: This is place of kaal bhairav where alcohol is offered as parshad. There seems to be no excise rules and regulations... Every prashad shop outside temple sells alcohol alonwith flowers and sweets.. If you visit Ujjain, this is a must visit place...

Name: Rohit Nanda
Title: Bhairo baba Temple
Review: I visited the place with family. The temple is big with a lot Monkeys. Wine shop is easily available opposite to the temple.To many beggars so ready for that.

Name: vinay760
Title: Ujjain Darshan
Review: this is one the very old and historic temple and must visit if visiting Ujjain,  This is also very crowded and suggest to go on working day.  please read history to understand importance and go with faith and do darshan. there is enough space out side for parking etc and can be managed better along with upkeep and cleanness for such historic temple.

Name: raj_Indb
Title: Nice Temple,
Review: This is nice temple, their are many wine shop near this temple, kal bherav is also take wine, I have go to many times in this temple

Name: Nithin M Agarwal
Title: A must visit for a better analysis on Hinduism.
Review: This temple is located near Ujjain and is worth visiting during your tour here. The temple is of Kaal Bhairava, an avataar of Lord Shiva. In Shaivism, he is a fierce manifestation of Shiva associated with annihilation.With faith and proper seeking of resolution, one gets peace of mind and courage do go through different situations in life. There is liquor being served as PRASADI to the Deity here. But, as HINDUISM says -- to connect with Him, you first need to be pure of heart. It is a re-built temple and holds the old MALWA type of architecture for one to visualize and understand.Date of Experience - March 2008.

Name: Sivakumar V
Title: An Ancient one with peculiar Prasadam
Review: This Kal Bairav Temple is dated back about 6000 years. The legend of this tmple centres arund Brhma  and Shiva. It is said that Brhma wanted to compose a fifth Veda in spite of Shiva not encouraging. Enraged Shiva sent a child Bhutak Bairav who pinched off Brahma,s fifth head. And to absolve of the sin of hurting Brahma, Shiva asked the Bairav to do penance on the banks of river Shipra. The hence the temple here for Bairav.This purnic episode is said to be in Skanda Purana.The peculiar and strange practice in this temple is that Bairav is offerd Wine as offereing and it is said that when the cup of wine is kept near the mouth of Bairav , the wine disappear! It is a - must see temple in Ujjain

Name: soumendra kumar M
Title: JAI KAL BHAIRAV
Review: A temple dedicated to the Kala Bairava - Yama (God of Death) an incarnation of Lord Shiva.One may offer wine to the Lord here. Lord however, takes very little and returns the maximum part to the devotee as His Prasad. Wine is sold at the gate of the temple. The priests are very cooperative.

Name: H. N. Pandey
Title: Kal Bhairav senapati of mahakal
Review: Kal Bhairav, A unique temple in india...Where you get wine as a prasada. can offer liquor as Prasad to Lord at any day in India. One can offer any brand of liquor which is available.Also there is unique part is , when liquor is pour , it is getting sucked and never leaked. There is discussion that even scientists have done the experiment to check where the liquor is going and not found the answer yet!

Name: 1Jayanthi
Title: Different practice
Review: In this temple apart from flowers, most of the devotees offer alcoholic drinks too. These are sold in most of the shops selling the flowers and located across the road from the temple.

Name: Jasraj pardeshi
Title: Mysterious Temple
Review: Once you reach the temple the most abstract thing will happen to you. The people there who sell flowers and haar  for the deity also sell you alcohol. Yes..! and that alcohol you have to offer it to the deity. When you enter the temple just give the bottle of alcohol to the guru there and watch. They offer it to the god in a plate like utensil and the deity literally sucks the alcohol in the plate and where does it go is an unsolved mystery.

Name: plpalani
Title: Temple dedicated to Lord Bhairav
Review: In this temple liquor  is taken as offering to the Lord.The temple is majestic with quite a few steps.

Name: Akhil Singal
Title: Kal Bhairav ka prasad hai Daaru (Alcohol)
Review: Great Place to visit. Travelled from Ujjain by cab and the 8kms run was just fantabulous. Surrounded by Shipra river and the mountains. When I reached,  it was drizzling which made the weather more enjoyable. I was surprised to see the  shops outside the temple were selling only alcohol  as it was the main offering to the God. I used my mobile camera to capture the precious moments. But the stay at this place is good enough for only an hour.Overall the visit was cool but the main thing which excited me was the offering to the God.

Name: Luv to Travel
Title: Jai Kaal Bhairva !!
Review: Had the opportunity to visit the temple on a Kalashtami day. Surprised to see what was offered to the deity.  Liquor was the main offering and it was really poured into the mouth of the deity and disappeared in a few seconds.  Blessed to be there.

Name: Binay Kumar P
Title: Pricing of offerings
Review: Always try to purchase the bottle of liquor for offering to the Kal vairab from the city, since the local vendors charge a heafty some, don't purchase from there and they ask for price more than the amount printed on it.

Name: Shael
Title: Alcohol offered by devotees
Review: Place is good and one of a kind where alcohols are offered by devotees. But this is not mandatory. Once offered you have to take it with you or you can give them to people waiting in temple premises. Do remember due to these offerings, an alcoholic smell will be in garbhagrih.

Name: Mitesh P
Title: Kal Bhairav - Unique place of Worship and faith
Review: Kal bhairav is unique place. At Kal Bhairav, devotee can offer liquor as Prasad to Lord at any day in India. One can offer any brand of liquor which is available.Also there is unique part is , when liquor is pour , it is getting sucked and never leaked. There is discussion that even scientists have done the experiment to check where the liquor is going and not found the answer yet !!!

Name: skagarwal74
Title: Unusual temple
Review: Shri Kaal Bhairav temple is at the outskirts of Ujjain about 6KM from Mahakaal temple. The temple is unique as liquor is offered here.

Name: Giri S
Title: Visit to kal bharav temple
Review: Different experience, not much rush. One can have peaceful and pleasant darshan. A must visit place in Ujjain.

Name: trivediar
Title: Amazing & Beautiful Place
Review: It is said that visit to Kal Bhairav Temple is necessary after visiting Shri Mahakaal Temple if you would like to accomplish your pilgrimage tour successful. Very nice and well managed temple.

Name: Sanjaykumar P V
Title: Unique temple
Review: A unique temple where whiskey bottles and any other form of liquor is offered as prasad.  Must visit just for the uniqueness

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: A unique temple in india...Where you get wine as a prasada.
Review: kal bhairav is one of the unique temple in india.  Lots of prasad shops outside the temple and liquor/wine is served to god as a prasad.  you can buy the wine bottles from outside shops and give it to pujari , he will put the wine on plate and touch this plate to the god's mouth and within a minute the wine disappeared from plate.. you can experience the live magic by visiting there.

Name: Gdj
Title: Kal bhairav temple
Review: One of the most famous temple in ujjain. Prasad of bhairav baba is wine.very crowded and attractive temple.

Name: Dipteshrao
Title: Good place to see
Review: It is a religious place to see once where Kal Bhairav used to drink liquor Nice place to see visit and experience

Name: rathod2017
Title: Kal Bhairav Temple
Review: Kal Bhairav Temple this is one of the famous temple in Ujjain. There is a Shivalinga in this temple which during Mahashivratri attracts thousands of visitors to this religious site. Kal Bhairav temple is said to be related with black Magic.

Name: ramnita16
Title: Non-rushed visit
Review: Visited on Friday evening about 8 PM. There was absolutely no crowd and was able to stand in front of God for sufficient time. Awesome feeling.

Name: Dipen Shah
Title: Must Visit once
Review: A must visit temple in india, where we offer wine to God.Worth watching process how they give wine as prasad to god.Amazing to watch it and blessed by darshanTry to avoid visit on sunday to avoid long que

Name: CHETANsurat
Title: JAY KAL BHAIRAV BABA
Review: Near Mahakal temple. Going in Auto.Auto fare is 140 to 170. Liquor is served to the Kal Bhairav BaBa and it is believed that Kal Bhairav BaBa consumes it. Liquor is sold in almost all shops in the premises.

Name: Yogesh L
Title: Very Serene
Review: A nice clean temple that has shivling almost 50 ft below the main entrance. In old time it must have been at river bank and now away by about 500 Mts. Must visit for Aarti that takes place at 4am.

Name: Leena N
Title: Kal bhairav Temple
Review: Its 15 minute away from mahakaleshwar temple. in rickshaw. approx rickshaw driver took 150/- rs per return journey  from mahakaleshwar temple. Temple is good. We visited during the holiday season so we got little rush, otherwise there is no rush you can easily take darshan in less than 10 minute.

Name: RanjithKumarPrabhu
Title: The devata who consumes liquor
Review: This is another famous temple at Ujjain. The temple is relatively smaller in area, and is located in the outskirts of the town. Liquor is served to the deity and it is believed that deity consumes it. Liquor is sold in almost all shops in the premises. There is also a pratishta of Dattatreya in the temple compound.

Name: Shankar I
Title: Senapati of Shiva
Review: The temple of Kala Bhairav is a must see, say the locals of Ujjain . They call him the senapati of Shiva and the head of Ashta Bhairavas. Liquor is the offering here.It is situated on the banks of the Kshipra river. One should watch your step while entering the shrine through the staircase. Some people's liquor bottle fall off their hands shattering the bottles and a threat to barefeeted devotees who follow.

Name: Neelamraju
Title: Interesting Offering - Liquor
Review: Ujjain City has a lot of Temples. The saying goes that if you carry a ton of rice and offer 4 grains to each temple, you will still run short of the grains..The Kal Bhairav temple is dedicated to Kal Bhairav, the guardian Deity  of Mahakal . It is located on the banks of the Shipra River. It is one of the most active temples in the city, visited by hundreds of devotees daily.Liquor is offered to the temple deity as one of the five tantric ritual offerings known as panchamakara  - Madya (alcohol), Maansa (meat), Meena or Matsya fish), Mudra (gesture or parched grain) and Maithuna (sexual intercourse). In older times, all five offerings were made to the deity, but now only alcohol is offered.We were amazed to see Indian as well as imported liquor was being offered. The priest takes the bottle from the devotee, opens it and pours some liquor in the saucer and keep near the lips of the deity and the liquor disappears. The remaining bottle is handed over to the devotee as Prasad..

Name: Sushant Kumar
Title: GOD who is fond of Alcohol
Review: Temple is unique in itself, where alcohol is served to idol and you can watch him drinking. You will find licensed wine shops outside temple premises. People offer variety of alcohol to GOD starting from Desi Daru to Scotch. Recommended visit to this temple if you are inn Ujjain specially if you want to see an idol drinking alcohol live.

Name: aalpaad
Title: Wonderful place
Review: It‚Äôs a powerful temple and it‚Äôs amazing to see how liquor is offered to Kaal Bhairav...a must visiting when ur visiting maha kaleshwar temple

Name: RAJIV1954
Title: Unique
Review: The temple is located around 10 kms from the city centre. The temple is unique in the sense that devotees offer hard liquor as the offering to the God Bhairav. There are lot Langgors in & around the temple.One should plan to go there only during the day because of it's far away location

Name: VivekPriyadarshi
Title: Whiskey offered to the Lord
Review: Yes.. The temple is around 8 kms from the Mahakaleshwar temple.. Autos ply from there regularly to Kal Bhairav temple.. Was amazed to see people carrying whiskey bottles in the Prasad basket as an offering.. Was told that the deity drinks the offered alcohol.. But you cannot see this.. People pour a few drops in a bowl kept in front and carry the rest home.. Must visit to see this unique thing..

Name: Vishnu Pendyala
Title: Does the presidiing diety really need hot liquor?
Review: Watched a number of devotees offering whiskey and what not to the Presiding Diety. Strange practice!

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: The guardian of ujjain
Review: He is the guardian of the ujjain city and the gadkalika mata, one of the shakti peedam in the city. the sayana aarati is from 830pm and is  so divine.

Name: Hitesh Rathore
Title: Kaal bhairav ALCOHOLIC
Review: Had only heard about it, but for the first time seen here people carrying alcohol to the temple. Strange but true liquor bottles were sold outside shops and pandit ji in the temple was opening the bottles and offering it to the God...... Great

Name: Ashish Gupta
Title: Bhagwaan Drinks Whiskey
Review: visited this place on dry day on 26th Jan. didn't had a chance to see the magical event, this place is far from Mahakaal Temple if you don't have car then you can book auto from Temple.

Name: meenakshimuthusamy
Title: Well Divine
Review: The temple is very divine.The place is very nice to visit and good feel is felt on the inclusion of the temple in the tour.

Name: babita13
Title: Amazing
Review: The statue of deity is very attractive. Kal Bharaw is said to be Senapati of Lord Shiva. This is the place which is visited most commonly after Mahakal so there is rush but they manage it. the statue sucks alcohol and it is interesting factor.

Name: Shubham Karwa
Title: Know before you go
Review: Famous for its suspense regarding how bharu baba drink and its vanishes.Anyways take your hard drink as prasad from outside as shops in the premises doesnt keep all brands and keep just local vodka, etc that to with high margin !!So do take it from outside. !!Visit if u visit mahakal so that your wishes come true soon..

Name: Namjoshi
Title: Kal Bhairav Temple, Ujjain
Review: It is said that Kalbhairav was militory head of God Shankar. In temple you can see some paintings made during King Parmar fro Malawa. While chanting some mantras you can see he sucks the alcohol given for him near mouth.

Name: shaileshjpai
Title: Temple
Review: In this temple liquor is given to kalbhairav deity. You have to purchase a bottle  of liquor from liquor shops around the temple. They pour some in a saucer and pour in the mouth of the  deity.

Name: poojathakur13
Title: Must visit to see the unique prasad
Review: The uniqueness of this temple is the Prasad offered to the diety bhirava is alhohol. The temple is easy to go to and no longer queues.

Name: Vineet_Tuli
Title: Amazing !!!
Review: We visited Kaal Bhairav & it is one of the main temples of Ujjain. The aura of god is awesome & there is quite a rush in the morning thus plan accordingly.

Name: Yash
Title: A unique temple
Review: This is a unique temple of the God of Death. The deity is given alcohol as a prasad, and you can find liquor shops outside the temple. The rock, where the prasad is offered, absorbs the alcohol, and no other liquid. This is what makes the temple extremely unique in its own way

Name: Ajay KMehta
Title: Small but loving and powerful
Review: Very powerful but small and quiet.You could feel the presence of God.Did Aarti and was touched by the simple beauty within.

Name: Pree B
Title: Peaceful..
Review: We heard so much about this temple that it was a must see on our bucket list... it was the first time that we went to a hindu temple where alcohol was being offered...

Name: Atul Shah
Title: the diety that drinks wine
Review: a relatively clean hindu temple with daru as the offering and the prasad as well. a novelty to see and experience

Name: Ravi D
Title: Lord Kal Bhairav drinks liquor here
Review: Lord Kal Bhairav is offered liquor, which is put in a plate, put at the lord's lips and liquor vanishes somewhere (supposedly Kal bhairav drinks the same).If you want to offer liquor, it is available (both country made and English) in the market surrounding the temple. Worth a visit

Name: Dilip123
Title: Deity who drinks liquor!
Review: The ancient temple of kaal bhairav is a must visit in Ujjain. There are shops outside the temple that sell offerings that include liquor. We did not buy any of those offerings but witnessed the miracle of the deity drinking liquor.Liquor is poured into a silver saucer and  then poured into the open mouth of the idol. The remaining liquor in the saucer is retained in a silver pot in front of the idol and half the unused liquor in the bottle is returned to the devotees as prasad!

Name: meghashyam
Title: Kaal bhairav
Review: One of three kaal temples other two being Mahakaleshwar and Gadkalika maa temple . Kaal bhairav emanates power n protection . Lord is swamboo .

Name: Payal G
Title: Foreign liquor = Wishes on fast track
Review: A unique temple in Ujjain where alcohol is the primary offering made to the diety. Kal Bhairav is considered to be the Senapati (Commander-in-Chief) or the guardian deity of Ujjain. It is an important shaivaite temple where thousands come to pray daily. The local shops surrounding the main entrance sell a variety of alcohol which is the primary offering (they claim that offering foreign brands makes the Lord fulfill wishes faster). A jatra or festival day while crowded is very colorful (crowd can get unruly). One has to be wary of pickpockets in the crowd.

Name: ANAND V
Title: Baba Saheb ki Jai
Review: Kal Bhairav also known as Senapati of lord Shiva. This is one of the very ancient temple of Ujjain. Its believed and also can be observed that Baba saheb (Lord Kal Bhairav) himself have the alcohol in this temple. You will definitely feel relaxed and one can feel a mental peace in temple campus.

Name: Sunnilbgautam
Title: Guardian of Ujjain
Review: I visited it around 9am Aarti. In spite of the loud music played, it was sirene & peaceful. Could feel a strong presence at the Alter. It was wonderful. There is also a Dutta Temple here. The backyard garden has a few monkeys (Langoors) swinging up the tree branches. It was quite a watch for my Son.

Name: Mahesh Kulkarni
Title: Tirth of Alcohol to Lord Shiva at Kalbhairav Temple Ujjain
Review: Offer in of Alcohol to the Lord Shiva is the differentiator of this temple from other Shiva Temple.Devotees bring alcohol and the  Statue of Lord Shiva is fed with this unique offer ing and it goes down inside mouth if the statue.A must visit Shiva Temple at Ujjain.

Name: Arvind S
Title: Lord Shiva's bodyguard temple
Review: Kal Bhairava is as per Indian mythology known as guard to lord Shiva. This temple is situated bit far from main mahakal temple,on the bank of holy river.Devotees used to offer liquor as prasadam. Not much fascinating tourist spot but holy place for Hindus..means a lot..So visit to feel serenity and positive spritual vibes.Must visit along with Mahakal.

Name: Swarg tours & travels
Title: Best & surprising Kalbhairav
Review: This Temple is approximately 4 kilo meter from main Temple. Kalbhairav is a body guard of Shivji. Kalbhairav takes only wine. Opposite side so many wine Shop here  A surprising things, Still nobody can find where wine is going after giving him too much wine everyday. Don't Miss this place.

Name: rohit s
Title: Mahakaal visit
Review: Positive devotional place in ujjain. Kaalbhairav is the senapati of Mahakaal.. Very nicely managed devasthan

Name: Krishnaveni S
Title: Unique temple where liquor is offered to god
Review: This temple is dedicated to god Kalabhairava who is told as senapati of Lord Mahakaleahwar. Here liquor is offered to god and when the poojari keeps the plate with liquor near the slit of mouth of the idol, the liquor disappears. Outside the temple there are state government authorised liquor shops. Small gudis dedicated to other gods are inside the temple. It is a custom to visit this temple before visiting Mahakaleahwar Jyotirlinga.

Name: anubhavmpm
Title: Blessings of God
Review: This is a temple where everyone offers alcohol to God Kaal Bhairav. The temple is well kept and maintained and the rituals are soothing.

Name: Omkar P
Title: VISIT TO KAL BHAIRAV TEMPLE
Review: The temple is very old but there are lot of devotee and here the peoples are giving wine as a Prasada to God Kal Bhaiav. Arrangement is not so bad.

Name: arunbvkumar
Title: God being offered Liquor.
Review: Lord Kaala Bhairav is offered Liquor and the mystery is the idol sips some. it is one of the unique places in our mythology and a must place to visit. Hair Raising experience.

Name: Vacation815975
Title: Jai Kaam Bhairav
Review: This palace is very mysterious, kaal bhairav temple is very ancient temple, lord kaal bhairav consume liquor as offering from devotees. Very very special palace.

Name: rameshtiwari03
Title: Darshan
Review: We have visited many times to Ujjain and went to Kal Bhairav Temple for Darshan. Their apart from other Prasad Liquor is also one item normally serve to God.

Name: The Golden Age f
Title: Mystery God
Review: The mystery of this temple is Alcohol is offered to God and the complete  alcohol  disappears from the plate when offered. Outside the temple small bottles of alcohol are available. As it was saawan month lot of rush in the temple. Another surprising act I found was people throw flowers at diya stand if it gets stuck to it they say there wishes will be fulfilled.    Outside the temple is beautiful you can see Kshipra river from top. Overall a very nice temple can't be missed if you are in Ujjain.

Name: piyushkachchhava
Title: one of the best temple to visit in ujjain
Review: in june,we almost visited more than 10 places.where thousands of temples are present.and in all of them kaal bhairav temple is too peaceful where whiskey is the prasad.and the brahmins who do all the care of temple like pooja,aarti and bhajan.a very peaceful environment around this temple,at that temple there is one holy pillar where people throw a flowers and if sticks that means your wish will be fufill.

Name: Viral Arya
Title: Jai Kal Bhairav
Review: This is a Hindu Temple, located around 5kms from Mahakal Jyotirlinga and a must visit to complete darshan of Mahakal. This temple is dedicated to Kal Bhairav, the guardian god of the city. The strangest thing of this temple is that Liquor offering to Kaal Bahirav during worship

Name: williamsamaddar
Title: Shri Krishna's Gurukul.
Review: Not far from the Mangalnath Temple lies this Ashram where the great sage and scholar Maharishi Sandipani imparted sixty-four arts [Kalas] and fourteen sciences [Vidyas] to Shri Krishna, Shri Balaram and Shri Sudama in Dwapar Yuga. The skills learned by the three are elaborately depicted through exquisite paintings on the inner walls of the Gurukul. Within the Ashram premises stands a Shiv Mandir whose Shivling is said to be 6000 years old.

Name: dimpoo1971
Title: Peaceful
Review: This place is very peaceful.This is the place where Lord Krishna, Balram and Sudama studied under the guidance of sage Sandipani and hence the name of Ashram.64 forms of the art learned by Sri Krishna is depicted beautifully frame by frame.One should have atleast 1 hour to see entire ashram.

Name: Discover822314
Title: Krishna ki Pathshala
Review: 'Krishna Ki Pathshala' , the place where Rishi Sandipani imparted wordly education in the form of 64 Arts to Krishna and Balrama. Cool, Calm atmosphere and Aura of Ancient Vedic culture strikes you. Staircased water pond (Gomati pond) and its legendary tale ( Krishna bought holiest waters of this land unto the said pond fir his Guru) gives you sense of sacredness. They say they have skilled Sanskrit teachers who carry the rich legacy. Place is well maintained with beautiful forest like tree cover. While visiting the place, one must have little patience to go through beautiful 64 paintings depicting Guru Samdipani teaching 64 Arts to Krishna and Balrama. 64 Arts covers(which were taught around 5000 years back), Skill of Cooking, Dancing, Painting, prducing different colours from plants, Art of sensible dressing, Agriculure, Architecture, creating Mosaic on floor, enhancing word vocabulary, Mantra, Creating Secret code words for communcation, Art of Communication, Playing different games, Solving Riddles/ puzzles, war strategy, cretaing illusions, awarness & conservation of Biodiversity & Nature etc etc..5000 years back, when biodiversity/nature was rich, they thought of preserving Environment!!  And today we say, Environment is new subject!!!Must visit place...

Name: KeshavChakraborty
Title: Good environment
Review: It is said that Maharishi Sandeepani's Gurukul was here and Krishna and Balram learned the art of life under His teaching.

Name: SudarshanKS
Title: Lord Krishna's gurukul
Review: A very well maintained, preserved and explained place. Nice to learn about Lord Krishna's education here, his gurus, the Lord Shivling. The 14 vidyas Lord Krishna learnt. Overall, a good learning and experiene

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Ashram where Maharshi Sandipani used to teach Shri Krishna
Review: Sandipani Ashram is a holy shrine which is built in remembrance of the Rishi Sandipani. According to mythology, it is believed that this is the Ashram where Maharshi Sandipani used to teach Shri Krishna, his friend Sudama and Krishna's brother Balram. This Ashram Known for:1. The Vidyarambh ceremony of lord Krishna took place in this Ashram. In this Ashram Shri Krishna took 64 days of education. during this period he has learned 14 Vidya's and 64 arts.2. Even today on Guru Purnima, more than two hundred people come here for Vidyarambh ceremony3. Gomti Khund, a stepped water tank is located inside this Ashram. Legend has it that this is where Shri Krishna summoned  all the holy waters from various centers so that his elderly Guru, Sandipani Muni would not have to travel other holy places.4. Inside Ashram there is 6000 years old shivalinga called Sarveshwar Mahadev, that was worshipped by Guru Sandipani and his disciples. If one looks closely at the Sarveshwara linga, images of Lord Shiva, Parvati, Ganesha and Kartikeyan can be seen on it.Ashram timings:Morning 09:00 to Evening 07:00Entry is free (No Entry fee)

Name: abkush
Title: Nice and calm ashram, as it should be
Review: Sandipani ashram where Shree Krishna and Shree Balram completed their education.Ashram is beautiful and calm.It has 3 temples as well, which are great.Should not be missed, if you are travelling with family and are interested in such places.

Name: skdel2016
Title: A place for recharge yourself
Review: It's a very calm place named as Sandipani Ashram which is said to be Gurukul of Lord Krushna where he learned many Vidyyas and acquired skill and knowledge. Complex is containing three temples , Pond and a Gallery showing activities of that era. One may spend some time to recharge him/herself. Good place to visit.

Name: AnshumanMaini
Title: Good one
Review: Good place for a short 5 - 10 minute visit. There are 2 ancient Shiva temples inside and also an exhibit on learnings by Krishna, Balram and Sudama. Good for children and first timers to Ujjain.

Name: gpradeepshenoy
Title: Good place to visit in Ujjain
Review: Took an auto to this temple. Autos charge Rs 300 for visiting three places, Kal Bhairav mandir, Mangalnath temple & Sandipani ashram. We took an auto at about 6:00 Am so the charge was Rs 300 else the charge would have been Rs 350 as per the Auto driver.                This is the place where Lord Krishna studied under his guru Sandipani.  We can see via painting what all Krishna studied as a student. about 10 -15 minutes is sufficient to be spent here. We reached this place at about 7:30 Am and except us no other visitor was there. This place opens at 7:00 Am.                  A good place to visit while in Ujjain and i will suggest to visit early morning to beat the heat of the day and crowds.

Name: MUKHARITRA
Title: Vaidik Pathsala
Review: This place will describe the ancient school structure of India. How a child got education both theoretical as well as practical is shown in the pentings. Very calm and quiet place as well as well maintained.

Name: Neeraj K
Title: Holy and cool place on the earth. Must visit.
Review: This place is very silent and cool. All the Pandits are very highly skilled in Sanskrit. This ashram is popular for the Krishna-Sudama education. This ashram is running from 16th century as per Archeological department. I will also share some pics of there. In fact, Maharishi Sandipani was the tutor of Krishna and Balaram too. The brothers, along with their friend Sudama, went to study at Guru Sandipani's ashram. Near the ashram is located the Gomti Kund, a staircased water tank where Krishna supposedly summoned all the holy waters from various centres so that his old Guru, Sandipani Muni, need not travel to far off holy places. I will also share the pics of all the places. Really, It is a holy and cool place on the earth.

Name: Gdj
Title: Ssndipani ashram ujjain
Review: Most famous visiting place in ujjain.lord krishna studied there in guidence of guru sandipani.temple is near to mangalnath temple.

Name: Pramod1953
Title: Sandipalni Ashram
Review: This said to be place of Rishi Sandipani. it is here the lord Krishna, his elder Brother Balram and friend Sudama received education. the detail of subjects 64 illustrate how vast knowledge was imparted in those days to make pupil a perfact human being.

Name: Tripathi_12
Title: Lord Krishna and Sudama's teaching place
Review: This temple /Ashram is devoted as Sandipani Ashram, where Lord Krishna and his friend Sudama has completed their  primary education, beautiful and clean area

Name: sangeeta68
Title: quaint place
Review: very nice ashram to be seen ! so much history is there, very beautiful place also.it was very close to the place where we had lunch too

Name: Sailesh
Title: Awesome totally love
Review: Awesome .. totally loved it .. takes you to another era.. the 64 forms of the art learned by Sri Krishna is depicted beautifully. The temple where there the the murthi of Guru Sandipani and his disciples Sri Krishna, Balarama and Sudama (sitting and writing ) is just lovely and very charged.

Name: hipiyush007
Title: Hare krishna
Review: Ots the place where Krishna along with his friends took his shiksha of 64 kala (arts). Here you can see and understand what are actually 64 arts meanings. Very peaceful place. Must visit place but be ready for heat if you visiting in summer.

Name: Sourav B
Title: Sandipani Ashram
Review: Good place to visit with family. Those teachings that Lord Krishna received here, shows how god like he is. Perhaps the gurukul education should be brought back and English styled education should be ditched.

Name: Abhi62001
Title: ancient system of education centre
Review: This is the place where Lord Krishna, Balram and Sudhama studied under the guidance of sage Sandipani. Very peaceful atmosphere which is worth visiting. This ashram depicts the 64 vidhya or knowledge one is supposed to learn. This is on the bank of river shipra. This gurukul gives us very clear picture of all the topics covered during the course of education like singing, use of weapons, making tools, furniture and so on. tourist can spend 1 hour happily in the place going round . This ashram has one pond and also a small garden which is maintained well.

Name: Chirayu
Title: Cool Place
Review: This place is very cool and silent.There are pictures of Lord Krishna and his friends depicting how they studied at this ashram. There are statues,pictures which shows how Lord Krishna and his friends learned different lessons. There is a small garden. One small pond is also there in this ashram.

Name: Gdj
Title: God shree krishna education place
Review: Guru sandipani ashram is located in ujjain mangalnath area.in This place lord krishna with his brother balram take education.

Name: raj_Indb
Title: Nice place
Review: This is very nice place, their are may picture available here, all arts picture related to lard Krishna ji... available in this place.

Name: Nithin M Agarwal
Title: A must visit for better insight into Hinduism.
Review: This place is the Ashram/ Gurukul (School) of Guru Sandipani who taught Lord Krishna during his adolescence about various aspects of life/ martial arts/ knowledge/ spiritualism.The Ashram, is simple in its layout with the main ground/ premises located at one place and other lawns at the other place.Standing example of showing respect to Guru. Even Lord Krishna had a Guru (Teacher). And this is His abode. It can't get simpler than this to understand Hinduism. Can it?Peace. Tranquility.Date of Actual Experience - March 2008

Name: 1Jayanthi
Title: Ashram of Lord Krishna‚Äôs Gurudev.
Review: Sandipani ,the Guruji of Lord Krishna, Lord Balaram and Kuchelar, supposed to have had his ashram and Gurukkal here. The three of them supposed to have stayed and learnt various arts from guru at this place.

Name: Sivakumar V
Title: The School of the Gods
Review: Maharishi Sandipani Ashram is where Lord Krishna and His brother Balaram & their friend Sudama went for enriching their knowledge as students. A beautiful serene ashram ideal for the gurukul way of learning. Well maintained and a divine atmosphere is peaceful to mind and heart. A beautiful Kund is there in the ashram where Lord Krishna said to have Blessed with the waters of holy rivers.About 2 Km from the Ujjain town is a must visit for the pilgrims.

Name: Saurabh Srivastav
Title: Visiting Krishna Bhagwan & Balram's 300 year old school
Review: The Gurukul housed in Sandipani Muni ashram is famous because Lord Krishna with his brother Balram studied different Vidyas here including use of weaponery and modus operandi of divine celestial shashtras.This Ashram is near to Mangalnath Mandir on the banks of River Shipra.It is vast inside though the enterance is small.Entry is free and it is open to visitors from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening.You have to remove your shoes as soon as you enter the ashram.Standing Nandi is also situated in a Kundeshwar Mahadev  temple inside which also has a Shivaling as well as stone idols of various forms of Lord Vishnu like Vamandev etc. inside.A Gomti kund is situated towards the right with steps from all four sides leading to the pond deep below.A corridor thereafter depicts the 64 art forms which were then taught to pupils.Several peacocks are there among the big trees in the Ashram among which are chandan trees too. However a smell of cow dung is generally there in the ashram - cannot guess why. The 300 year old site is well maintained and is definitely worth a visit.

Name: plpalani
Title: Lord Krishna‚Äôs Guru
Review: Sage Sandipani was supposed to had his Gurukul in this location 3000 years ago. Lord Krishna,Lord Balaram and Lord Sudan‚Äôs have studied under the sage.Apart from idols of Sage there are idols of Krishna.Not to miss is the 64 art forms taught at that time vividly painted and nicely displayed in a long corridor

Name: Divyam G
Title: A small ashram not worth the visit
Review: There are a few small temples inside. Nothing worth seeing. There are a few roadside eateries opposite the road. The 15 rupee Parantha is really good.

Name: Gdj
Title: Lord shree krishna schol
Review: In this ashram lord krishna complet early stufies with his brotherlord balram.this ashram situated nearmsngalnath temple.

Name: Mitesh P
Title: Sandipani Ashram
Review: It is well maintained and informative place. Place is recon as Place where Lord Krishna, Sudama and Baldev took their education. There are well informed information which will update well. overall nice visit

Name: trivediar
Title: Mesmerizing Atmosphere
Review: Lots of sandalwood trees on the temple premises, Ancient Gomati Kund, Pictures of 64 different types of knowledge earned by Lord Krishna from his Guru Shri Sandipani. Ancient Shiv Linga with Nandi in standing posture. Must visit Ashram.

Name: Sanjaykumar P V
Title: Traditional
Review: The ashram where Lord Krishna along with Balaram and Sudama learnt the 64 art forms as per mythology.  Traditional place with well maintained paintings and depiction of 64 art forms.  It is a must visit place and there is a very good vegetarian dhabha just next to it with good meals option.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Sandipani Ashram - School of lord KRISHNA.
Review: Its a place where Lord krisna along with balram and sudama learned various type of arts as per indian traditional mythology. there are total 14 Vidya (Techniques) and 64 Kala (Art forms)  are there as per indian mythology which covers almost all aspects of human life and cover each & everything.  apart from temple you can find the detail description of all 14 techniques and 64 art forms with pictorial description.  A must see place for every one to understand how beautiful is indian traditional education system which not just educate but teach you the real aspects of life..

Name: Dipteshrao
Title: Must visit
Review: Religious place where Lord Krishna took his education along with Balram and Sudama, he learned 64 subjects in 64 days Must visit!

Name: rathod2017
Title: Sandipani Ashram
Review: this is a spot where Guru Sandipani coached Lord Krishna, Balram and Sudama, the Sandipani Ashram has many mentions in Mahabharat. The ashram houses a giant stone with 1-100 inscribed on it, as first written by Guru Sandipani.

Name: Yogesh P
Title: Very famous place
Review: Sandipani was guru of lord Krishna. His ashram was located at Ujjain. It was really good place to visit with family. Peaceful environment.

Name: Neelamraju
Title: Gurukul of Lord Krishna
Review: Just after entering the city of Ujjain, the first place of interest is Sandipani AshramSandipani Muni was the Guru of Sri Krishna. Sandipani means complete illumination.It is believed that Bhagwan Sri Krishna and his brother Balarama and their friend Sudhama mastered the 64 arts in 16 faculties..This ashram has been transformed into a temple now which is devoted to Guru Sandipani. There is a stone near the Ashram where numerals 1 to 100 are inscribed, and there is a myth that the inscriptions were made by Guru Sandipani.Even to day As Bhagwan Sri Krishna himself studied here, people bring their young children to this place to start learning to write on a slate.A very peaceful place with green trees and nice surroundings..

Name: amitwanderer
Title: Excellent new addition to Singhasth
Review: We were moved with the way of potrayal of the way bhagwan srikrishna and Sudama along with others in Rishi Sandipini Ashram. A pic though not allowed is attached. It is a must go for children to understand the importance of guru ie teachers in our traditional life. Cheers to our teachers.

Name: Vishnu Pendyala
Title: Quite a lot to learn
Review: It is worth spending time going through all the display boards on the walls.The knowledge that Lord Krishna acquired here, as listed on the Sandeepani Ashram's walls made me wonder if it is this knowledge that imbibed Godliness into Lord Krishna. Or may be that He learned all that because he was God personified.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Gurukulam of lord krishna
Review: Its believed that this is the place where lord krishna, balarama and sudhama resided and had their education from their guru something like a residential school. the place is very famous among the locals as they do visit daily.

Name: Hitesh Rathore
Title: Ashram -can visit
Review: This is a ashram where Krishna with his friends took education and now there are halls displaying in the form of paintings the preaching and happening then. You can visit this place being neutral as its neither related to religious nor history

Name: Ashish Gupta
Title: Lord Krishna had teachings here
Review: Lord Krishna with Balram and Sudama had teachings from Guru Sandipani. This place has Shiv temple and dedicated to Lord Krishna.

Name: meenakshimuthusamy
Title: Visit to a mercury lingam
Review: Aashram allows the visitors to visit the place.The place is very well maintained and clean.Its look is neat.The place has got a mercury lingam to visit.

Name: babita13
Title: Gurukul of Krishna and SUdama
Review: the place have Shiv temple at entrance where the Nandi is in standing position. there is also statue of lord Krishna, Balram in other places.nice place if you have time

Name: haren_kgp
Title: Place of Shri Krishna bhagwan's Education
Review: Sandipani Ashram is famous as Shri Krishna Bhagwan's guru ashram. Here he studied and practiced his 64 kalayen, 14 gyan etc.

Name: Namjoshi
Title: Sandipani Ashram
Review: It is said that God Krishna, His brother Balarama and Sudama studied here from Sandipani guru. Area is nice and clean. There are 2-3 temples inside.

Name: shaileshjpai
Title: Gurukul of Shri Krishna.
Review: This is believed to be a ashram of Sage Sandipani where lord Shri Krishna and Balram studied. This has a beautiful gallery showing 64 kalas.

Name: Jayashree G
Title: Must visit in Ujjain
Review: Do not miss the chance to visit the Ashram of Guru Sandipani, teacher of Lord Krishna and Sudama.  The extensive paintings and descriptions of the 64 arts learnt by Lord Krishna are an infirmative treat.  The Shiva sanctum here has the supine serpent, apparently only one of its kind in the world.I loved the prasadam of ginger and sugar powder that is sold her.A mandap in the Ashram is beautifully created and maintained with depictions of Lord Krishna‚Äôs learnings, the 12 Sun signs etc.,

Name: Ajay KMehta
Title: Sweet Sweet  and always sweet
Review: The place is very ancient with a Shiva's Temple and the place where Maharishi Sadipani gave playful knowledge to Sri Krishna 6000 years back.

Name: Atul Shah
Title: nice walk in an old fairy tale
Review: the place where Krishna and sudama studied and bonded. The spot is nice and green and very clean. Like a Disney story put in real .

Name: Ravi D
Title: Lord Krishna's Gurukul (School)
Review: Sandipni Ashram is the place where Lord Krishna, his brother Balram and friend Sudama studied. Nicely maintained premises, it houses a small museum with 14 disciplines of knowledge learnt by Lord Krishna (see attached pic with details).There is a pond inside the premises called Gomati Kund, which is said to be created by Lord Krishna himself with water from various sacred sources, so that this Guru didn't have to travel. Around the Pond, there are nice pictures showing 64 art-forms.  Lord Krishna had mastered the 14 Teachings and 64 forms in 64 days... Do spend some time going through each of the forms

Name: Dilip123
Title: A must visit for Krishna devotees
Review: Sandipini Ashram, the place where Krishna and Balarama attended school is a beautiful place that houses two ancient shiva lingas and a pond called gomati kund.The shiva temple at the entrance has a standing nandi. There is a stone slab inside the sanctum sanctorum that was used as a bench by Lord Krishna. Do not miss touching the stone that was touched by the Lord Himself.The gomati kund requires cleaning and maintenance. Verses from the bhagavata associated with Krishna's stay in sandipini's ashram have been displayed. Spend some time reading the same.

Name: meghashyam
Title: Tapobhumi
Review: The Gurukulam where sri balaram n sri krishna studied . A beautiful scenic place to meditate for some time .

Name: Payal G
Title: Krishna's school
Review: This place in Ujjain near the Kaalbhairav and Mangalnath temples  is described as the ashram where Lord Krishna learnt 64 arts alongside his elder brother Balarama and friend Sudama. The pond within the campus known as gomti kund is said to contain the water from all pious spots which had been collected by Krishna so that his guru didn't have to travel. The Shiva temple has a unique shivling with the complete naag around it. The temple near the entry has a standing Nandi bull another unique feature. The government has created a new museum with beautifully painted walls as well as a gallery surrounding the gomti kund depicting the 64 arts learnt by Krishna. Touted as a must visit place for students and their parents (especially expecting good results üòâ). A room sells special potions and mixes to aid memory and boost results.Overall the campus is quite clean and well maintained. Involved lot of walking.

Name: Krishnaveni S
Title: Krishna's gurukula
Review: This is the gurukula of guru Sandipini who was guru of Sri Krishna, Sri Balarama and their friend sudama. It has a old Shiva ling, pictures depicting Krishna, Balarama and sudama studying. There is a well maintained pictorial depiction of the 64 Vidya or education according to the Hinduism. There is also gomati kunj where Krishna is supposed to have summoned all the holy waters so that his guru will be able to get it daily. You can take a auto which takes you around all the places outside ujjain for 200 to 250 RS.

Name: AasthaD
Title: Lord Krishna's school
Review: some beautiful sculptures, temples neatly maintains. PLASTIC NOT ALLOWED in the premises. and a museum done by the govt with wall murals depicting the 14 arts Lord Krishna learned there.

Name: Omkar P
Title: REVIEW OF SANDIPANI ASHRAM
Review: The ashram is situated on Mangalnath marg and as guide has informed that Lord Krishna, Balram and Sudama were studied here. The place is very quiet..

Name: arunbvkumar
Title: important Ashram in Mythology
Review: It is the only place where you can see Lord Krishna with a writing instrument instead of a flute. 1 to 100 numbers was first inscribed on a rock by Sandipani. Nandi or Bull is standing waiting for Lord Shiva to come back after discussion with Krishna. It is believed that water from all the holy rivers of the world was summoned here by Lord Krishna. It is believed that 64 different subjects were learned by Krishna in 64 days.

Name: The Golden Age f
Title: Beautiful Aashram
Review: It is a beautiful aashram with idols of guru Sandipani. In one hall the activities  of Lord Krishna, Balram and Sudama pictures are on the walls with writings. In another hall the 14 education was very colorful and depicted beautifully on the walls. There is a pond where they used to clean their slates but the water had turned green in colour. Overall a nice aashram if you have time can spend 1-2hrs reading all inscriptions.     No photography was allowed inside.

Name: KeshavRaina
Title: Good Experience
Review: Very nice Ashram with a good place to worship.They have a small library with a lot of material to read too.

Name: milindujn
Title: Guru Sandipani Asharam where Lord Krishna and Balram learned
Review: The Sandƒ´panƒ´ Muni ƒÅ≈õrama is located 2 km outside Ujjain, in the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh. The area near the ƒÅ≈õrama, known as A·πÖkapƒÅta, is popularly believed to have been the place used by Bhagavan ≈örƒ´ K·πõ·π£·πáa for washing his writing tablets. A locally sourced narrative relates that the numerals 1 to 100 found inscribed on a stone were originally engraved by Sa·πÅdƒ´panƒ´.Near the ƒÅ≈õrama is the Gomti Kund, a stepped water tank. Legend has it that this is where K·πõ·π£·πáa summoned all the holy waters from various centres so that his elderly Guru, Sa·πÅdƒ´panƒ´ Muni would not have to travel other holy places.Th

Name: piyushkachchhava
Title: best place to vist
Review: on the route of mangalnath temple,sandipani ashram placed near this temple.the beautiful lord krishna,radha and balram's murtis over there.and when we went inside the ashram there are lots of indian holy places and books and precious knowledge of hinduism.

Name: Viral Arya
Title: Sandipani Ashram, where God Krishna Learned
Review: A must visit if you are in Ujjain. As per belief, God Krishna and his friend Sudama take initiation from Sandipani Muni in this Ashram. The area nearby the ashram is known as Ankapata, which is believed to be the place, where Lord Krishna used to wash his writing tablet.

Name: Niyati C
Title: Gurukul of Lord Krihna
Review: Good place to visit. Here Lord Krishna came to study. The images depicting lord Kirshna and his activities in this place are very nice. Though the gomti kund where lord use to bathe is full of algae but overall a good place to visit.

Name: sandeeprchavda
Title: Worth visit spending about 2 hrs
Review: It has an ancient Shiv temple, ashram where lord Krishna and Balram studied. gomti kund which needs maintenance here, it has recently opened gallery of describing the 64 vidyas learnt be Lord and 12 learnings

Name: Ktishan Kant Lavania
Title: Divine Place - Gurkkul of Lord Krishna
Review: Sandipani Ashram was the Gurukul of Lord Krishna and Sudama, Very peaceful place spent time here you will fell peace of mind here, Here you will see th only idole of standing Nandi Ji

Name: UmaBG
Title: Ashram is very divine place to visit.
Review: One of the famous place of ujjain to visit during the visit. Ashram is well maintained, clean and very calm and peaceful. It is very much historical place also.

Name: nik_0107
Title: Lord Krishna
Review: Ashram is really well managed and have great gardens. Lord Krishna came to Ujjain his education and studied in this Ashram with his friends Sudama and Balram.

Name: Anjani S
Title: very well managed as well as very green
Review: this is the place where you can come sit and relax. we had spen 1 hour there. words only standing Nandi ji is here. nice place. you will see here sandal trees

Name: Dev-Shiv on a Trip
Title: Krishna s‚Äô Study Ashram
Review: A must visit if you go with children to show them where God Krishan studied as a kid with his friends Sudama and Balram. Also to be seen is the Kundeshwar Mahadev temple dedicated to Lord Shiv and the peculiarity of the temple is that the Nandi Bull is standing as against sitting which is supposed to be nowhere else in the world as per our guide. Also the hall of the Ashram is converted into a museum giving various quotes from the life of Lord Krishna.

Name: ivanand77
Title: Lord Krishna's School
Review: As per Indian Mythology, Lord Krishna came to Ujjain (then known as Ujjayini) in his childhood for his education and studied in this very Ashram. Rishi Sandipani was his Guru and this is the place where he met his friend Sudama. Here you will see a statue of standing Nandi (perhaps the only standing Nandi in the world). It is said that when Lord Krishna came to Ujjain for his studies, Lord Shiva as Mahakaal and king of Ujjayini visited him in Sandipani Ashram to pay his respects. Since two Lords were meeting, the Nandi could not sit and hence the idol of Nandi is in standing pose. This sure is a not to be missed place.

Name: Quiettrail
Title: Good historical significance for children
Review: Ashram of Maharishi Vyas well related to history. Children were excited to learn history and Maharishi Vyas.

Name: Sunil R
Title: one more place on mangalnath road
Review: if you are want to visit mangalnath temple you will cross this place. Sandipani Ashram is GURUKUL of lord krishna. a temple and a holy pool located here.

Name: Sovil K
Title: The place where Krishna, Balram and Sudama studied
Review: There is a 4000 year old Jyotirlinga here, a floating stone from Lord Rama's time and the place where Shri Krishna met Sudama.Commercialised, but still a beautiful place.

Name: Ani De
Title: Teacher of lord krishna
Review: It is an ashram of rishi sandipan who was the teacher of lord krishna and sudama. The temple tell the story of the way how that period education system was.

Name: sssdgn
Title: ONE AMONG PLACES TO SEE AT UJJAIN--
Review: Associated with mythology it is said at ancient times Maharshi (maharshi means a spiritual  teacher) Sandipani taught their pupils here ,place is big and peaceful,we seat here for the meditation for a slot of time,must visit when in Ujjain-thanks--SSS-----

Name: chirag kothari
Title: School of Lord Krishna
Review: This ashram now converted into temple is school of lord Krishna, lord Balram and Sudama. Here is gomti kund which was in deporable state. There is old shivling here with shesh naag in its natural form. There is also hall which has lot of painting on guru lives. Must visit place.

Name: Haridas M
Title: Historically important place
Review: This ashram has close ties to the Krishna folklore and is a small ashram set up , still being developed by the authorities to magnify the importance. The area encloses a gaushala, small temples, picture gallery and a soon to be opened picture gallery near the pond. This is off the city and better hire a vehicle while coming  else you will not get one to go back.

Name: Bimal0401
Title: Positive vibration
Review: The Rishi Sandipani the teacher of Lord Kishna, Balaeam and Sudama. The Ashram is surrounded by lush green trees. The peaceful atmosphere keeps us very kalm. The life of Lord Krishna  is depicted in the hall with in the Ashram. Awesome place. Must visit

Name: Sandeep S
Title: A must visit place
Review: The place is the legendary one where Lord Krishna studied under the sage Sa'ndipani. Reportedly the descendants of the sage are still at the helm of affairs of the place. The localites claim that the  Linga in the temple is supposed to be one of the oldest recorded one in India. We will have to take their claim for that on face value.But none the less, a calm and serene place and one can 'enroll' your children in the ashram for studies just like Lord Krishna. Wondering?. Try it out once your reach there! Believe me the experience is worth it.

Name: Vijay
Title: SERENE AND CALM Ashram
Review: Sandipani, which means ‚ÄúSage of Gods‚Äù, was a guru of Lord Krishna. The Sandipani Muni ashram is located 5 km from Ujjain railway station (Madhya Pradesh). The area near the ashrama is known as ankapata, popularly believed to have been the place used by Lord krishna for washing his writing tablet. Lord Krishna, Balrama and Sudama believed to study here.

Name: Kingshuk P
Title: Cool and green calm place
Review: The place is worth seeing. Lot of trees, green all around. Like a Ashram for sure for people like Krishna

Name: mehul vyas1999
Title: School of lord Krishna,  Balram and Sudama..
Review: As we know about friendship of Sudama and lord Krishna,  here is the place where lord krishna,  his elder brother Balram and Sudama undergone of teaching through Guru Sandipani..  Here now Shiv temple and sandipani temple

Name: sbgholse
Title: Spiritual place of Lord KRISHNA education
Review: The well known Sandipani  Rishi-the Guru of lord Krishna,his brother Lord Balram and friend Sudama gave them  school education.The old shivlinga is here and the pictures of Krishnas lifetime are sketched in a separate hall.The beutiful garden and trees makes the environment pleasant.Must se place in Ujjain and do not miss it as there is no other school of Lord Krishna.There can be many Krishna temples.

Name: Ramamoorthy Mani
Title: Serene and peaceful
Review: Sandipani Ashram is considered as one of the famous tourist spots located at two kilometers from the temple town of Ujjain. The place has a great mythological value. It is believed that this is the ashram where Guru Sandipani used to teach Shree Krishna, his friend Sudama and Lord Krishna‚Äôs brother Balram. This ashram has been transformed into a temple now which is devoted to the Guru Sandipani. There is a stone near the Ashram where numerals 1 to 100 are inscribed, and there is a myth that the inscriptions were made by Guru Sandipani. The Gomati Kunda is a stepped water tank that is situated near the Sandipani Ashram.A peaceful and serene place to visit

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: A must visit
Review: This is the place where Lord Krishna got his education from his Guru Sandeepani . There is a temple of Lord Siva approx 6000 years old which was initiated by Sandeepani . Nice ambience

Name: thingsthatareunique
Title: Quiet place
Review: A quiet place to visit with deep roots to Krishna. Clean surrounds with a steady flow of visitors. No problems with parking.

Name: ChennaiFocus
Title: Place devoted to excellence in academics
Review: This is the place where Krishna and Balarama did their schooling. It has a beautiful pond and 6000 year old Shivling. Prayers are done for academic excellence here.

Name: kvsarma
Title: Very calm and clean divine place
Review: This was a small place or Ashram near ujjain, where they claim Lord Krishna has his studied with Kuchela.Place is very clam, refreshing, you have lots of pictures of Lord Krishna covering life time events, this ashram had Lord Shiva temple and they say its a place of Hari-Hara milan (meeting), you have a small pond (as usual there is very little water). Prasad is very good from Krishna temple.Its worth visiting this place based on the time you have in your trip

Name: authorneelesh
Title: nothing much in it
Review: Krishna and Sudama are supposed to have studied here.There is a maharshi Sandipani temple inside and not much else.a few minutes to tick it off the agenda is allit takes.

Name: Avik Mukherjee
Title: Small but clean ashram
Review: Went there but so grt a small one fully commercial. Not very impressed with this historic ashram. It's upto you

Name: PankajDeep
Title: Spiritual education of lord Shri Krishan,Balaram and Sudama
Review: Old education system of Ashram where all types of education provided by Guru.This is the place where lord Krishna, balaram and sudama studied spritual,practical and yudhha tactics.In the world only 1 seating krishna murti here.Also standing Nandi is here.73rd Mahaprabhuji bethak also here.Very old holy and spiritual place must to visit.

Name: Sunil K
Title: very peaceful and  calm place to visit where ord krishna and Balaram took diksha.
Review: Here Lord Krishna and his brother Balaram took siksha and diksha.Here you will feel very calm and cozy place to take rest.Here you will find no hustle bustle like other religious place.

Name: Sunil K
Title: School of Shri Krishna and their brother
Review: As found the place very well managed and clean also very useful detail in Ashram about shri Krishna education time memory attached with this Ashram. Also 108 images of Shri Krishna,s life and life cycle of Mathura life.

Name: Vj S
Title: peace of mind
Review: this is the place where lord Krishna took his some part of education.. he used to be stay here with his friend sudama..

Name: shivangm871
Title: Ashram of Krishna
Review: It is the ashram where krishna got his learnings. Silent place with less visitors as compared to other religious establishments in the city. But still worth a view

Name: Lalit Surjan
Title: A School For Lord Krishna
Review: It is believed that Lord Krishna and his brother Balarama went to this residential school (Ashram) run by Sage Sandipani in ancient times.Hence, important for Krishna devotees. There are no traces of the past but faithfuls throng to the place amidst lush green tall trees. Adjacent is one of the 84 seats of 15th century Vaishnava saint-philosopher Vallabhacharya.

Name: Dr K K S
Title: Quiet surroundings - still feels like Gurukul
Review: This is where Lord Krishna and his friend Sudama received their education. The ashram is clean and well maintained. Great place for meditation.

Name: sanjayvora45
Title: Lord Krishna School
Review: 10 min from Mangalnath temple or Kal Bhairav temple in outskirt of ujjain city, this temple is not in great condition. Belief is that Lord Shri Krishna and Sudama had their education here.

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Fully Solar Powered ISCKON temple
Review: Ujjain ISCKON temple is most beautiful temple and its unique white marble architecture is so nice to witness. The campus is also huge one and clean and neat ambience enhances the beauty of this temple. This temple is situated on one of the main highway of the city which is near to Nanakheda bus stop.The temple houses the idols of Radha Madhana Mohan, Sri Krishna Balram and Sri Gauri Nitai dressed in vibrantly coloured dresses and beautiful jewelers.Temple Construction details: This temple was constructed with in 10 Months and 20 Days and Inaugurated in the year 2006. The marbles are collected from very famous mines of Makarana. This marbles are same marbles which were used in Taj mahal construction.Specialty of this temple:1. ISCKON Ujjain temple became a fully solar powered temple in 2011-2012. This is the first Solar powered temple in Ujjain and probably the only fully solar powered temple in ISCKON.2. ISCKON Ujjain is also the 1st temple to have LIVE broadcast in Ujjain City.3. ISCKON Ujjain is involved in lot of community service projects like Mid day meal program, Goshala which is contributing significantly in the field of social work.4. Mouth watering dishes are available in Govindas witch is just next to ISCKON main temple.

Name: williamsamaddar
Title: divine
Review: Located in the up-market neighbourhood of Mahashweta Nagar in Ujjain, this temple is magnificient. Well maintained with a huge premise the ambience inside is pure divine. They wake up the Lord at 4pm and offer Puja. This is pure bliss and is something that cannot be missed.  Jai Shri Krisna

Name: DKD007
Title: Beautiful place of devotion
Review: This is a beautiful place of devotion to Krishna bhagwan located in the center of Mahashweta Nagar a posh colony of Ujjain. Neat and clean place very well maintained by the devotees. Also has a restaurant Govinda and place of stay.

Name: KeshavChakraborty
Title: holding the glory of ISKCON
Review: A large ISKCON temple complex, also having idol of Narsimha avtaar which is very uncommon.A real chanting environment.

Name: windpace
Title: A mesmerising experience
Review: Try going during of the aarti sessions.  It is a nice experience.  We visited for a 7:30am aarati and it is an interesting experience to see how the volunteers work like clock work , the rituals and the devotion of the devotees.

Name: skdel2016
Title: Very Well managed Temple
Review: It's a good Radha Krushna temple and well manged as ISKCON are known. A very good area with park and small canteen is there. A must go place to spend some time.

Name: nilesh_nagar
Title: One of the best ISKCON temple
Review: This is one of the best ISKCON temple I have visited. Beautifully made, peaceful surroundings, friendly people, shops r reasonable. My son liked pastry & cake from here. Enough parking area. Must visit place. Hare Krishna.

Name: Gdj
Title: Iscon temple ujjain
Review: Most famous religious place in ujjain.lord radha krishna temple.atractive place to visit in ujjain.devotee prays regulary there.

Name: Dudeace
Title: Peace
Review: This place is one of the most religious place in ujjain,all the things that means real peace are available there

Name: Gdj
Title: Iscon temple ujjain
Review: I like most to visit iscon temple ujjain.god radha krishna murtis most attractive.and shrangar of god is also looking most attractive to me.

Name: alpsbt27
Title: good is great
Review: every time I visited in ISKCON temple I feel so blessed. the atmosphere is so amazing. people love to spend time here.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Jai shree krishna...divine destination of lord Shree krishna
Review: ISKON is a international organisation devoted for worship of Lord Krishna , Ujjain ISKON is one of the newly constructed temple of the city situated in a lush green campus and whole temple built with white marbles , there is food court and restaurant available inside the temple which offers authentic indian food with simply great taste

Name: Sanjaykumar P V
Title: Rich and decorative
Review: Typical ISKCON temple and pooja performance.  The idol decoration stands out and is very rich and appealing.  Separate queue for gents and ladies and one can get a pleasant and silent experience

Name: Gdj
Title: Lord radhakrishna temple in ujjain
Review: Lord radhakrishna temple in ujjain on dewas road bharatpuri. Temple is made in traditional hindu temple style

Name: rathod2017
Title: ISKCON Ujjain Temple
Review: The beauty of the majestic white marble building of ISKCON in Ujjain is truly a sight for sore eyes. The impeccably sculpted marble idols of Radha Madhana Mohan, Sri Krishna and Balram and Sri Gauri Nitai dressed in vibrantly coloured dresses and beautiful jewellery will definitely lift your spirits.

Name: Yogesh L
Title: Famous Krishna temple
Review: As usual another Krishna temple chain by ISKCON and this time in Ujjain. Situated in the city near Birla temple this one is a good attraction in the city.

Name: Prateek
Title: Christmas in Iskon temple
Review: On 25 December 2018, i went to iskon temple, ujjain with my family. We had darshan of lord vishnu, lord rama and his brother lakshman. There were many god in that temple. In front of temple, there are many shops to buy ice creams and snacks. This temple is very beautiful from inside.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Neat and clean
Review: This is one of the branches of the international Sri krishna community in the city of UJJAIN. As usual the temple is neat, calm and devine and is so famous among the locals.

Name: meenakshimuthusamy
Title: Clean Temple
Review: The place is very clean and nice to visit the lord.It is very neat place.It is well maintained.The place is good to visit.

Name: Namjoshi
Title: ISKCON Temple, Ujjain
Review: Belongs to Lord Krishna. Nice statues are inside. Silent area. All temple area is clean. Better to visit when lights are on.

Name: Himanshu jat
Title: It's so serene
Review: The chants of hare Rama gives u such a relief. It's worth a visit.It's better than Mumbai's and indore's iskon

Name: meghashyam
Title: Hare Krishna
Review: Beautiful temple . Lord Jagannath , Lord Balarama , Maa Subhadra , Lord Krishna Maa Radharani , Sri Chaitanya Maha prabhu Sri Nithyananda , Lord Narasimha all are magnificent . Puja is done in a befitting manner . Raj bhog prasad is a must have at this temple . Guest houses are decent .

Name: piyushkachchhava
Title: what a beautiful temple,loved it.
Review: iskcon temple is too beautiful and a must visit temple in ujjain.i visited this temple on my last day in ujjain.a murtis of lord krishna,radha,lord ram,sita mata,ganesh and other god and goddess.a nice clean temple.

Name: YogeshAgrawal
Title: Excellent
Review: Amazing temple with beautiful deity. Just at par with ISKCON temples elsewhere. Have lunch for sure and an awesome experience.

Name: UmaBG
Title: Very nice ISKON temple.
Review: Great ISKON temple in ujjain too. It's beautiful as always we see at many locations. Very auspicious and devine place to visit. We get peace and mental relief at this place.

Name: Vidhi_sharmah
Title: amazing  silence
Review: In ISKCON one can feel that even silence is amazing, slow volume chant of Hare Krishna gives the mood a perfect divine swing

Name: nik_0107
Title: ISKCON
Review: Really a great temple located on the out skirts of the city. Built in a typical ISKCON style in white, the temple is really beautiful.

Name: ivanand77
Title: Beautiful ISCKON
Review: The ISCKON temple in Ujjain is truly beautiful. The idols are so beautiful that one cannot stop take off the eyes from them.  The temple is run by the Hare Rama Hare Krishna Trust and their bhajans are famous. A separate complex is built adjacent to the temple offering accommodations for those who travel from outside. The temple administration also runs a restaurant named Govinda offering delicious vegetarian food.

Name: Achal
Title: Worth Visiting Temple
Review: Dedicated to Radha-Mohan mandir, entire madir is white theme, this mandir is located in new city on outskirts of Ujjain.

Name: Rishi Raj
Title: great iskon temple of ujjain
Review: Iskon temple of Ujjain is very bueautifully built temple. I had an occasion to be a part of evening Aarti in the temple. Te Idols of Gods are mesmerising..

Name: Nish0901
Title: Jai Shri Krishana
Review: This temple is little far away from the main Ujjain city. It was not crowded when we visited this temple. It is one of the cleanest temple in India. The atmosphere was very soothing for the soul and body.

Name: GrannyMaa
Title: Hare Krishna Mandir @ Ujjain
Review: Hare Rama Hare Krishna ISKCON Mandir is present in Ujjain city also. The morning and evening Puja and Aarti are a treat to watch with all the Bhajans, Slokas and chanting. It is a divine feeling.

Name: Haridas M
