Review: I was totally disappointed that such a holy river was in absolute filth thanks to the locals who use it.  The very water was stagnant and the steps on the banks were mossy and broken. I just did not feel like even dipping my little finger into the river water.

Name: Quiettrail
Title: Clean and well maintained ...
Review: Evening time is better and they had a bridge in the river to cross to go over the other side. You can sit there for an hour or so and feel the calmness of water

Name: Sumithran
Title: Place of the Mahakumbh
Review: This is one of the locations of the holy dip during the Mahakumbh. Situated on the banks of the river Shipra, the water is presently stagnant. There are persons regularly cleaning the water of the flower offerings by the devotees. So the place is maintained  clean.

Name: Nish0901
Title: Ghat with many temples
Review: If you want to take bath in Holy river Shipra, visit this place. The place is not clean but acceptable. You will find flowers flowing in the rivers and people were busy in doing some religious rituals there. Many small temples are also there near the ghat.

Name: Hiten_Rathod
Title: Ghat - Calls for Upkeep and Vigil.
Review: A very well built and developed ghat providing ample facilities for the pilgrims to take a dip in the holy river.In the present scenario,the water is stagnant and not flowing allowing the puja items and other material to remain afloat.So just take a splash and be purified.Enjoy and be blessed.

Name: Kingshuk P
Title: Reminds you of Haridwar Ganga
Review: Just like Hari Pauri Haridwar , this place is exactly similar. Same place is used in Kumba Mela. Back side of Har Shiddi Temple and close to Mahakal temple. Lot of Darmashala close by. People come here for puja

Name: mehul vyas1999
Title: Here pilgrims inflate whiskey to kalbhairav dada
Review: Here is very famous mandir of shree kalbhairav dada,  who is a another swarup of Lord Shiva,  here pilgrims  inflate whiskey to kalbhairav,  pujari takes whiskey bottle from you,  open up and pour in plate,  and keep plate near mouth of kalbhairav dada,  and all the whiskey goes in side of mouth,  its a amage to see..

Name: sbgholse
Title: Sacred Holy place of KUMBH MELA
Review: This is a place where a festival called KUMBH MELA is held every 12 years like many such melas in India.This is on the Kshipra river where the water is fed from Narmada river through pipiline.The water is stagnant and non flowing ,hence hygeinically not suitable for dip bath or drinking.However,devotees do it out of their Shraddha.Many small temples present here.This is a place where Lord Ram rested here with Sita mata and brother Laxman on the way back to Ayodhya from Lanka after a war.A must place to visit.However,cleanliness and proper maintenance by local authorities is desirable.

Name: divyanshmoonat
Title: River needs Cleaning
Review: Tha ghaat is tha bank of river Kshipra.All the essentials of temples are thrown in river and no one takes care of cleanig and how could anyone takes a holy bath in such a water.

Name: Paraglider03
Title: A spectacle in the evening
Review: An evening visit is recommended. This is 10 mins walk from Harsiddhi temple. The number of temples on this ghat is just amazing. The water of the river is dammed and does not flow. Its rather polluted and taking a dip could be a health hazard.

Name: Sarbajit G
Title: On of the holy ghats
Review: The ghat by the river Shipra is one of the holy ghats in India. It very resembles with the Har-ki-Pauri of Hardwar. Unfortunately the approach road and the surroundings are little unclean.

Name: Geeess
Title: The Shipra river
Review: The river Shipra is the holy river where the Kumbh festival is held every 12 years.This stairs leading to the river provides places for a dip in the holy river which is fed by waters from the Narbada river through a long pipeline.This is holy also because there is a small Rama temple here to mark the place where Lord Rama rested on his return from the War with Ravana

Name: Sunil K
Title: Here people come to take Hoy Dip in the river
Review: this river is very sacred and holy place where people come to take holy dip.Here kumbha mela held after 12 years.

Name: Sunil K
Title: Holy river of Lords
Review: Its just another Ganga of Ujjain and people belif its directly come from Vishnu's Finger the concerned story is long but bathing there just remind me like Haridwar stairs and evening Aarti at Ghat. Very nicely maintained ghat, but cleaning is less as compere to Haridwar. Still good to take bath at this Ghat and visit the nearby three Shivalyas and perform the evening Aarti.

Name: shivangm871
Title: Religious
Review: If you are a staunch believer then you can have a bath in the river. However water is not so clean and with algae all around there are chances of slipping. Take care.

Name: Kawaljeet Singh
Title: Place to take holy bath.
Review: located on shipra river. taking bath in this place is a part of godship. taking bath in this river at this point will pure your sole.

Name: Masayoshi
Title: Water park ...
Review: I'm a Japanese living in Delhi.So, I don't think I understand the whole meaning of this place. But, it looked like a water amusement park where people enjoy in the water on a hot summer day.Nice pleasant atmosphere was there rather than serious and religious ones.I like it.

Name: uday s
Title: Famous for Maha Kumbh
Review: The Maha Kumbh takes place once in 12 yrs. This place gets flooded with devotees during this period.

Name: blacksteallion
Title: Nice Place on the bank of Kshipra River
Review: Once of the best and famous Ghat of Ujjain. You have to walk around 1 kilometer in order to reach here. This is one of the safest place to have a bath in the river and have safety measurements installed in place. Must visit place in Ujjain.

Name: vthakkar
Title: Also called Shimhasth Kumbh mela that.
Review: On rever Shipra this is one of the holliest place where in every 22 yrs Purna Kumbh/ arch Kumbh mela takes place this is the place where lord Rama took bath and performed pitru tarpan and that's why this is most popularly called 'RAM GHAT'.LAST YEAR DURING KUMBHMELA on 9/10 may last sahi snan(holly bath) by 3 akhada of sadhu took place here.It is saying that AMRUT Kumbh effect remains for whole year (365 days) so my visit was just outside of this period but as devotees I was blessed by all sadhu sant who's feet touched‚Äãthis ghat I was blessed.

Name: Satveer S
Title: Biggest place to visit
Review: It's a best famous place where there is a big temple and kshipra river near to it due to which this place becomes more popular and there is a huge number of devotees comes here or visit here so you must visit there to take bless.

Name: ANSH
Title: Holy Dip in Ujjain
Review: Ram ghat has reasonably clean water and you can take holy dip in that water. Infrastructure around is maintained very well by the government. There are change rooms where specially ladies can change their clothes. This should be in you visit list if you are coming to Ujjain.

Name: ShvRm_Traveller
Title: To be visited in the evenings for witnessing the Aartis
Review: Ram Mandir Ghat is located on the bank of river Shipra in Ujjain. Along the ghat and on the routes leading to the ghats, there are many small temples as well as old houses built which display architectural styles of few centuries back.The evening Aartis at the Ghat are not be missed and the whole atmosphere transports the visitor back in time.The Ghat is made of cemented steps leading up to the water level. As compared to river banks at many other places the Ghats here were well maintained, neat and clean.

Name: Prashant Dutta
Title: Serene Clean and Holy Place
Review: Serene Clean and Holy Place. A must watch for visitor in Ujjain. The river is well maintained and properly cleaned.

Name: RamGanesan
Title: The best place to take Holy Dip in Ujjain
Review: On our way back from our temple visits on the outskirts of Ujjain we decided to take a dip here.  This place is located close to the Harsiddhi temple.  The water in river Shipra was quite clean, however people misuse it to wash clothes etc.  I am sure during the Kumb there would have been a lot of facilities like locker, change rooms etc, but when we visited there were very few such things.  There was just one change room at the end of the cement platform. I was advised by an old lady not to get too deep into the river.  Well said as it was very slippery.  A place of such importance can be maintained much better in tune with the likes of Rishikesh and Haridwar.

Name: traveller_prk
Title: Evening Aarti is the main attraction of Ujjain visit
Review: The Ghat was pretty neat and clean and we could walk to the other end of the river on the cement platform built across the river. The evening Aarati was the spectacular both visually and spiritually.

Name: 810wanderwoman
Title: Site of a beautiful, real evening aarti!
Review: The evening aarti here is beautiful and very non touristy!  The priests set up about half hour prior and ou can watch the lamps being stuffed, the conch shell cleaned, etc.  It's possible to be very close to both the fires, the priests, the river and the holy!

Name: DrArunAgrawal
Title: You can spend sometime in the evenings walking around
Review: The best part that I liked about Ram Ghat is that waters of River Shipra are quite clean. During the Kumbh mela that takes place in Ujjain every 12 years , devotees throng in large numbers to Ram Ghat for taking bath . One can spend sometime in the evening walking around and watching the fountains.

Name: Sneha J
Title: Peaceful and Dirty
Review: This place is dirty the shipra river is not clean. However it is a must visit. I think this a place where ashes are burnt or something. Part of local culture peaceful and serene best times to visit is in the evening sunset. You can take a boat ride too.

Name: Dr_Ankit_Agarwal
Title: easily accessible
Review: the water is clean. it is similar to har ki pauri of haridwar. must take a dip in the holy river. it is easy to reach by auto

Name: Prashant K
Title: Clean Ghat
Review: The ghat was clean however water not so clean. its a 5 min drive from mahakaleshwar temple. There are many beggars there which do irritate.

Name: Sennirmal
Title: A clean ghat
Review: The newly furbished ghat is a pleasure to visit particularly when the 'Sandhya River Aarti' is conducted. A small group of priests have begun this practice lately. The place has been cleaned up. The river Shipra has been dammed here. Clean water is piped in to full the dam. Water is changed every 15 days.  Now garbage any where. No wandering animals.

Name: Amit S
Title: Fresh & Spiritual Feeling
Review: We have visited this during Kumbh. There was plenty of rush of people for the event. The river could be made more clean & arrangements for changing the cloths were not proper.

Name: Rahul
Title: Place of significance but in bad shape
Review: Ram ghat is supposed to be of great significance but was in very bad shape when I visited the place. Plastic bags, flowers and other garbage was floating in the water. I won't recommend taking a holy dip in the river unless fresh water has been released into it.

Name: nilesh_nagar
Title: Historic ghat
Review: Its historic ghaat in ujjain n must visit place. Take a dip in shipra river.very close to most of d temples and very crowded in simhasth. Oldest one I guess in ujjain but of religious importance. Must visit place. Had a dip in shipra here. Nice place.

Name: Akshay Jha
Title: Beautiful Place
Review: I went there during Simhasth Kumbh in 2016 and it was a view worth seeing. However, the water was not clean that time, maybe due to too much crowd.

Name: yogindery
Title: Ram Ghat
Review: Ram Ghat is very famous and popular place of bath and holy place of religious people sipra river in ujjain .

Name: yogindery
Title: Ram Mandir Ghat
Review: Ram Mandir Ghat is famous and very holy ghat for bath at shipra nadi. mahakumbh recently celebrated in ujjain all places of ujjain very neat and clean best time to visit here.

Name: mimi_mechosem
Title: RamGHAT ( THE HOLLY PALACE)
Review: This is the palace where every 12 year later Khumb mela organised. This is Hindus religious palace and this Ghat know for bathing Ghat for Hindu.

Name: Gaurav C
Title: Beautiful ghat on the bank of Shipra
Review: Visited this ghat during Simhastha time and I was fascinated by the arrangements the mela administration had done w.r.t. people taking holy dip in the Shipra river.Not only the water was maintained to be clean ,but they arranged for adhoc changing rooms which i think would be a boon for ladies.Ramghat attracts every person visiting Mahakaleshwar temple.

Name: Sundersham M
Title: Singhasth mela
Review: Ram ghat is famous for its santity. Every one visiting ujjain prefers to take holy dip in moksh dayini Shipra river at the bank of Ramgath. During mela crowd happened to b in lakhs and a good scene during shahi puravs. It is good

Name: wanderer01Mumbai
Title: The evening Aarti is fantastic
Review: we were sheer lucky and got the chance to perform the evening aarti along with the pandits. it was a superb experience and the entire shipra river shimmers when the various lights and diyas are light in the evening.

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: Nice Place
Review: I visited with my family at evening. I saw aarti here. It was totally amazing. Water and ghat is very clean.

Name: Achal
Title: Faith & History - Holy Dip May change your Life
Review: This is one of most scared GHAT on bank of River shipra, History dates to SKANDA PURAN - a place where Kumbh Mela held every 12 years, last was in 2016 April, about 70 million people had holy dip at this location, Shipra Aarti is performed by Pandits every evening same as Ganga Arti, it can be a divine experience for SOME

Name: DEEPAK_23M
Title: Holy ghat of ujjain
Review: Ramghat is holy and sacred ghat of ujjain in singhast people takes dip kumbh snan to get benefits of kumbh. easy accessible from any part of city.

Name: Avinash_H
Title: The place for puja and bathing
Review: We reached this place which is not very clean.  We went there to perform Kaal Sarp Dosh puja.  In a temple besides this ghat the puja was done by three pandit.  This is a 3 hours long puja.

Name: Smritijit
Title: good
Review: We visited at the time of Simhasth. Water is very clean. At that time it is little crowdy but u can take bath.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Main ghat in Ujjain
Review: This is the most famous of all the ghats on Shipra. A large no of temples are located here. Shipra is deep here and hence this is a good spot for holy dip

Name: BK_TheTraveller
Title: Peaceful divinity
Review: Must visit in the evening to witness evening aarti of Kshipra river that happens on the parallel sides of the river.

Name: Sneha D
Title: Superb
Review: Ramghat is the most auspicious Ghat to take holy bath. Amazing experience to take a bath and then night view of Shipra.  Hats off to the  administration for making such wonderful arrangement.. they made it just like ganga ghat...

Name: Sneha D
Title: Jai shree ram
Review: We visited here in may .. ram ghat is just looking like ganga ghat.. very beautifully decorated.. n lighting is awesome.. we attended Evening Shripra arti.. we was feeling we r in Haridwar... really superb..

Name: Ankit Kapoor
Title: Massive Ganesh Idol
Review: Bade Ganeshji Ka Mandir is enroute Mahakaleshwar Temple. The Idol inside temple is a massive Ganesh Idol, enriching the overall experience.

Name: dimpoo1971
Title: Huge Ganesh idol
Review: The temple is just opposite to mahakaleswar temple.              Its Small temple but with  huge Ganesh idol which is said to be largest in the country and hence the name BADE GANESHJI.

Name: SudarshanKS
Title: Huge idol of lord ganesh
Review: close to the Mahakal temple, this temple of Lord Ganesh has a huge idol of the Lord in sitting posture

Name: skdel2016
Title: Jai Ganesh kato Kalesh
Review: Most visted temple after Shri Mahakal temple. It's just out side of main Mahakaal temple complex. Statue of Lord Ganesh is very big and attractive and there is astha associated with as well. Idol of Lord ganesha is as if it will speak. Must go place. Jai Ganesh.

Name: Gdj
Title: Bada ganesh temple ujjain
Review: Most famous ganesh temple near to mahakaleshwar temple.big lord ganesh murtie at there.lord krishna jhulla also at there.

Name: nugu9956
Title: ganesh temple
Review: bade ganesh temple is very famous and very big ganesh murti here and very old temple for ganesh  nahut bada mahatmy hai

Name: Pramod1953
Title: LORD GANESH
Review: This temple dedicated to Lord Ganesh is constructed recently. the main attraction is the size of idol of Lord Ganesh. it is huge.

Name: Mili Dutta
Title: Divine
Review: Must visit at Ujjain. Divinity at its best. Must visit incase you are Ujjain. Blessed!!The statue is huge... amazing sight :)

Name: Chirayu
Title: Big Statue of Ganeshji
Review: Located near Shri Mahakaleshwar temple, this temple houses many other Gods along  with Ganeshji. The statue of Lord Ganesh is very big. It is nearby Jyotirling temple, so one can visit it easily.

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: Wonderful temple
Review: Beautiful temple of Lord Ganesha in a big statue , it's very near to the Mahakaleshwar temple . Many wonderful deities inside the temple . Worth a visit

Name: Gdj
Title: Bada ganesh ji temple ujjain
Review: Veri big murti of lord ganesha.temple is near to mahakaleshwar temple.in this pemple attractive lord shree krishna jhula.

Name: Nithin M Agarwal
Title: Shree Bada Ganesh Mandir.
Review: A different experience and a very colorful temple.This is Ganesha temple nearby the Mahakal temple. The temple houses very lively, huge and colorful idols of various deities including Lord Ganesha.There is also a cute saying put up on a small board. Refer snaps attached. Lord Ganesha idol has been felicitated on the Indian Post stamp, 3 times by 3 different Presidents.Proud and Indian. Respect for Hindu culture and traditions.Date of Experience : August 2009.

Name: Sivakumar V
Title: A Chota temple for Bada Ganesh
Review: This small and sweet temple for Lord Ganesh is very close to the famous Mahakaleshwar temple in Ujjain. As the name suggests , the Gansh idol is really huge in size- about 20 feet tall and about 10 feet wide. The very look of the idol is inspiring and awesome. It is said that jaggery, fenugreek were used in its making along with the water from holy rivers and sand from various holy places like Mathura ,Maya, kanchi , Dwaraka etc.There is a trident and swastika on the head of the statue. A ladoo is pressed into the trunk rotating to the right. Lord Ganesha has huge ears, a garland around the neck. There is a platter of garland in the upper right hand and Japamudra in the lower right hand and laddu in the left hand.There are shrines for Anjaneya - pancha mukha, Yasoda with Balkrishna in Her lap, and Sri krishna playing flute.Though the temple is small , it is a beautiful one with the divinity all over.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Jai Shree Bade Ganesh
Review: as name suggest bade ganesh , it is actully bade ( mean BIG ) you can find a BIG ganesha idol inside this temple probably the biggest ganesha idol of the country.

Name: Gdj
Title: Bada ganesh mandir ujjain
Review: There is very long and big murti of lord ganesha. Temple is situated near mahakal mandir.thers is also done anuahthan,jap,and many other kind of poojas by panditji.

Name: _swapan18
Title: Amazing
Review: Had an Darshan and prasadam. We visited at evening. No rush, calm and quiet. Located by the side of the main road.

Name: trivediar
Title: Jai Ganesh
Review: Lord Ganesha's Big Murthy. Very beautiful and mesmerizing experience. Beautifully built and maintained. Walking distance (3-4 minutes) from Shri Mahakal Temple.

Name: KChandra
Title: Bade Ganeshji, Chota Temple!
Review: After visiting the Mahakaleshwar Temple, our group of 12 senior citizens visited this temple as we had been told that it is an important landmark. The Ganesh idol is large and impressive. However, the temple itself is not so big and the arrangements for visitors are non existent. We had left our footwear outside the temple and when we returned after the darshan, one of the more expensive footwear was missing. With no arrangements for footwear, we were left in the lurch! This incident spoiled the experience and we wish the temple authorities (if there are any) should take note of these aspects.

Name: Yogesh L
Title: The first to be worshiped
Review: One of the first to be worshiped during any Pooja or shubh karya and is right nr the famous temple. Small but beautiful. Must visit.

Name: Vishnu Pendyala
Title: Gigantic - true to the nature and spirit of Lord Ganesha
Review: Quite close to the Mahakaleshwar Mandir. Small temple housing a gigantic idol of the Lord of obstacles.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Valanbhuri vinayagar
Review: The temple is near mahakaleswar temple. The deity is lord valambhiri vinayagar who is so famous among the locals as bada ganeshas the statue of ganesh is so big.

Name: Hitesh Rathore
Title: Only huge ganesh idol
Review: This temple is famous due to its huge ganesh idol which s said to be largest in the country. Its not the must see place . you can skip it  if you are not religious

Name: Shubham Karwa
Title: Big murti and a belief
Review: Small area temple with a big size ganesh murti .. extremely big... must visit if in indore... rem. All temple are just if u have belief bcz everything is a power of universe and positivity...

Name: meenakshimuthusamy
Title: Small Temple
Review: Very nice visit to the temple.It is a good visit to the temple.It is a famous temple.The temple is a ganesh temple.

Name: babita13
Title: Don't  miss
Review: the temple is just opposite to Mahakal Dharmashala. it has very small gate and you can not imagine such big statue of lord gnesha inside this as we also missed it last time. the statue of deity is different from that we use to see in different temple. with this other statues are also there.Must visit

Name: Namjoshi
Title: Bada Ganesh, Ujjain
Review: This temple is just behind Shri Mahakaleshwar temple. Very big statue of god Ganesha and very nice panch mukhi Hanuman murthi you can see.

Name: shaileshjpai
Title: Ganesh temple
Review: There is a huge idol of lord Ganesh. Also you will find other deities. This temple is just opposite Mahakaleshwar temple.

Name: Nagendra Nayak
Title: Bade Ganesh
Review: Big Ganesha welcomes you. You can swing krishna in cradle. What I liked is the panchamuki Hanuman. It is near to Mahakaleswar temple and walkable from there. We were happy.

Name: Vineet_Tuli
Title: Nice Experience
Review: Please do try to visit the temple & love the modak.Great experience & there was not so much rush too in the temple.

Name: Mahesh Kulkarni
Title: Bade Ganesh ji is Really Huge
Review: Visited 2nd famous spot In UjjainThe Bade Ganesh ji.Really huge Elephant deity with big belly in seated pose.Silver trunk of the God attracts your attention immediately at the 1st glance itself.Felt very calm and quiet on visiting.

Name: Krishnaveni S
Title: Badaa Ganesh
Review: This temple is situated very close to the Mahakaleahwar temple exit. The idol of Ganesh ji is really huge and beautiful. Inside there is also a idol of panchamukhi Hanuman. A jhoola in which Krishna and Balarama are seated and a idol of yashodha breastfeeding infant Krishna. Feels Devine here. No much rush.

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: Big Ganesha
Review: Located just in front of the Mahakaleshwar temple , it's a nice temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha . There is a beautiful deity of Lord Hanumana and other Gods inside as well .

Name: Omkar P
Title: REVIEW OF BADE GANESHJI KA MANDIR
Review: The temple is old but well maintained and it is very near means walk able distance from Mahakaleshwar temple while going to Harsiddh temple. There was no rush of devotee.

Name: ToothForTaste
Title: Small temple, Big Idol
Review: this mandir(Temple) is at walking distance from, Mahakaleshwar temple, a small mandir with a really big Lord Ganesha idol..

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Magnificent Temple
Review: I went to Bade Ganeshji ka Mandir. Bade Ganeshji ka Mandir is a magnificent temple in Ujjain that houses one of the biggest idols of Lord Ganesh. It is great place to go.

Name: Viral Arya
Title: Very Good Small Temple of God Ganesha
Review: This temple is located near the Exit Gate of Mahakaleshwar Temple. This temple have very Big statue of God Ganesha for worship. This temple also have pancha-mukhi (five faced) Hanuman for worship. There is also provision for learning astrology and Sanskrit in this temple.

Name: sandeeprchavda
Title: Avg temple
Review: Has a big Idol of Lord Ganesha, can skip if you arr having lack of time. Go to temple can spend 15-20 minutes

Name: Ktishan Kant Lavania
Title: Really BADE GANESH JI
Review: I visited this temple with my mother she was so happy in this temple, This is near to mahakaleshwar temple a, must visit

Name: UmaBG
Title: Very nice templ
Review: Bade ganesh is really BIG. Very nice temple near mahakaleshwar main temple. Very divine place to visit in ujjain.

Name: nik_0107
Title: Great Hanuman Temple
Review: The temple has a really big statue of lord Ganesh. Temple is situated close to Shri Mahakalshwar temple.

Name: Anjani S
Title: best part of trip is BADE GANESH JI
Review: it was very beautiful statute of Ganesh ji. really amazing. just 2 min walk from VIP gate of Mahakaleshwar.

Name: ivanand77
Title: Bade Ganeshji
Review: This temple is situated in the nearby lane of Shri Mahakaleshwar Temple and a walking distance. This temple has a gigantic statue of Lord Ganesha and also contains various other deities within the temple complex.

Name: Rishi Raj
Title: The great Hanuman Temple
Review: The  Ganesh temple is situated just behind the Mahakal Temple. There is a very big  Idol of Lord  Ganesh and that is why it is called Bade Ganesh Ji ka Mandhir.

Name: Ani De
Title: Very near to mahakal temple
Review: One of the biggest statue of lord ganesh in Ujjain for that reason it called bade ganesh. The temple need k maintains very badly.

Name: chirag kothari
Title: Ganesh temple
Review: This temple us just opposite to Mahakal dhramshala. Here the statue of ganpati is big and beautiful. Also inside temple here is panchmukhi hanuman and narsingh. There is navgrah at this temple.

Name: Bimal0401
Title: Really Bada
Review: The idol of Shri Ganesh is very big. The temple is very neat and clean. There is a temple of Panchamukhi Hanuman with in the temple premises. It is highly recommended to visit when at Ujjain.

Name: Kumar K
Title: Bada Ganapati blessings
Review: This temple has a huge idol of Ganesha that is worth seeing. There is space in front of the idol where one can sit down and meditate for some time. Inside there are a couple of small idols of other gods like Hanuman.This temple is about 100 m from Mahakaleswar temple.

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: Nice temple
Review: Situated near the Mahakaleswar temple , this place has a big statue of Sri Ganesha . Inside the temple there is also a statue of panchmukhi Hanumanji and Narsingh . Good place to visit

Name: Sarbajit G
Title: Jai Ganesh
Review: This is a nice temple. The temple itself and its surroundings are very clean, which I believe is very important. It is also less crowded and easily accessible.

Name: Rahul1280
Title: Big idol of Ganpati
Review: This is one of top 5 place and near to Mahakal temple. Small temple so little congested if crowd. Big idol of Ganpati and small 3-4 temples inside

Name: niya27
Title: Near Shri Mahakaleshwar Temple
Review: This temple is dedicated to Lord Ganesh. Huge Statue of Lord Ganesh and his two wives Riddhi and siddhi are there. Beautiful idol of Panchmukhi Hanuman is also there.

Name: Sunil K
Title: Here you can see the very big Statue of lord Ganesha
Review: its Also very near to Mahakal remple.Here you can see the very big statue of lord Ganesha.ots of people to there to worship Lord Ganesha.

Name: Sunil K
Title: Om Ganeshy Namaha
Review: Very big Shri Ganesh ji Maharaj and very beautiful . Just near to Bhasma Arti gait and must visit while in Ujjain. Its very near to Shree Mahakalesver Temple and Big Murti of shree Gahesh ji make it unique temple

Name: shivangm871
Title: Good temple
Review: Situated in the city centre, this temple is quite good . Hard to locate directly without a local person, but is very good inside. Nice temple is what I can say.

Name: blacksteallion
Title: Big Ganeshji .... Really Big Murti
Review: One of the favorite temple for locals as well as tourists in Ujjain. This is called "bade Ganesh" because of the murti of lord ganesha is around 10 o 12 feet big. Small yet attractive place. It is located right on the way to Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlings Temple.

Name: Satveer S
Title: Best temple for devotees of lord ganesh ji
Review: It's a very famous and best temple to visit in Ujjain and there is a huge number of devotees visit here and god bless them. Really there are so many temples in Ujjain so it's a religious city too and this temple is must visit place.

Name: ShvRm_Traveller
Title: Big Ganeshji in a small Temple
Review: The temple is located near Mahakaleshwar Temple, which is the primary landmark of Ujjain. The Bade Ganeshji Ka Temple has a huge Idol of Ganesh in the outer section along with idols of other deities in the inner room.The temple is well maintained and appeared equally popular among tourist as well as the locals. A must visit place for tourists and pilgrims.

Name: traveller_prk
Title: Right next to Mahakaleshwar
Review: This temple is on your right as you come out of the Mahakalshwar temple. A huge Ganesha statue which is pretty impressive. Small temple though.

Name: ramki09
Title: Huge Ganpati
Review: Bade ganeshji ka Mandir is just opposite Mahkaleshwar temple.A huge Ganpati Idol is at the entrance and inside is Panchmukhi Hanuman and Ram,lakshman and Sita.Also Lord Krishna in Joola.

Name: ChennaiFocus
Title: 1060 year old Huge Ganesh Temple
Review: Love the vedic recitals in this temple. Huge Ganesha thrills us. Do not miss the opportunity to see the five faced hanuman and do abhishekam to the lingam there. Place of absolute peace.

Name: Vivek T
Title: Justified his name - The largest Ganesha
Review: Temple next to mahakaal premises. As the name mentioned Bade Ganesh ji ka mandir, yes you will find a big sculptured Ganeshji on the right side. One will be happy to see the giant and beautiful Ganesh ji.

Name: DrArunAgrawal
Title: Spend sometime at this huge Ganesha statue after darshan at Mahakaleshwar
Review: Bade Ganeshji ka temple  is within walking distance from Mahakaal temple , as we proceed uphill to the parking lot after darshan of deity .Built in the year 1875, during the reign of Rani Ahilya Bai Holkar, Bada Ganapati is famous for housing the largest Ganapati statue in the world. From crown to foot ,the deity measures almost  eight meters in length.

Name: tripfreak54
Title: Largest Sculptured Ganeshji!
Review: Bade Ganeshji Mandir is situated near the tank of Mahakaleshwar Temple. It is believed to be one of the largest sculptured image of Lord Ganesh. The temple also hpuses the Panch Mukh Statue of Lord Hanuman ( Five Faced Hanuman) - Symbolizes his Five Attributes - Namely: Courage, Loyalty, Devotion, Strength and Righteousness.

Name: RachanaR18
Title: Temple right next to Mahakal temple
Review: This temple has a very big Moorthy of Ganeshji and is situated just next to Mahakaleshwar temple complex. In fact, you can see it as you walk out of the exit gate. It is also part of the list of important temples to visit in Ujjain.

Name: Sneha J
Title: Nothing great
Review: Nothing great here same as picture. Can skip for trip. It's just a big Ganesh idol near magalnath Mandir you can visit it if you have time.

Name: Santosh Marar
Title: Really big Ganeshji
Review: Situated close to Shri Mahakaleshwar Temple.Houses Chaturmukhi Hanuman, Navagrah.Pleasant temple one must visit

Name: Dr_Ankit_Agarwal
Title: Big idol of Lord Ganesha
Review: Its more than life size statue of Lord Ganesha with Goddesses Riddhi and Siddhi on each side. Worth visiting

Name: CNJ97
Title: Ganpati Bapa moriya.
Review: This is one of the site scene offered during trip of Ujjain. The temple is very small but the idol of lord ganesh is good. There is another idol of panchmukhi Hanuman also present here.U will not see any new thing.

Name: joyienjoy
Title: Cool place
Review: An averge sized temple with some beautiful structures. Just as u enter from the entry door, you can see a large ganesh idol, that will make you say wow.

Name: madhur s
Title: very big Statue
Review: here is very big Statue of bhagwan ganeshnice temple. panchmukhi hanumaan Statue is also present here...nice to see

Name: yogindery
Title: Bade Ganeshji Ka Mandir
Review: Bade Ganeshji Ka Mandir very closed to famous jyotirlinga 'mahakaleshwar temple'.very big murti of lord ganesha situated there one of the famous sight seeing place in ujjain.

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: Ganapati Bappa Moriya
Review: Always nice feel to visit temple specially lord ganesha. Its a new addition in Ujjain walking distance from the Mahakaal temple. There is a gurukul also in the premises.

Name: Avinash_H
Title: Ganesh ji, son of Mahakaal
Review: Its a new addition in Ujjain walking distance from the Mahakaal temple. There is a gurukul also in the premises.

Name: Bharti0702
Title: GAM GANPATE NAMAH
Review: What a g8 idol of Lord GANESHA , its a very big idol hence its call BADE GANESH , its just near to MAHAKAL Temple & opposite to Main Mandir Dharmshala . Its feel different  . Never seen this type of idol of Lord Ganesha before. Never skip this temple darshan of Lord Ganesha when u are in ujjain. G8. GANPATI BAPA MORIA.

Name: BK_TheTraveller
Title: Jay Ganeshay Namah
Review: Bala Ganesh is one of its kind with a 21 foot high Lord Ganesh temple the temple is located on the Har siddhi Mata Marg , opp to Mahakaleshwar Anna ksehtra (an easy miss if you don't know the landmark)The uniqueness is not just the Ganeshji but also a Hanuman idol with 5 faces (panchmukhi hanuman)

Name: suryaprabhakaran
Title: * Mandatory visit
Review: A must visit place in Indore, the size of this Bade Ganapathi automatically takes you into the world of devotion . No more words to describe

Name: Gaurav C
Title: Such a grand statue of Ganesha
Review: Situated near the Mahakal temple complex , Bade Ganeshji ka mandir is worth visiting temple. The beautiful grand statue of Lord Ganesha will leave you mesmerized.

Name: BhowmikM
Title: Do not miss this Divine place
Review: When you come out from Mahakaleswar Temple (take right from Exit gate), this temple comes on the left. The idol of Lord Ganesha is beautiful, nicely decorated.

Name: guptaashok_0511
Title: Relegious Place.
Review: In front of Mahakal Dharmshala. It is also a Relegious place neat and clean, though small. Popular among locals

Name: Rohit
Title: Nice place
Review: Nice place to visit when you are in Ujjain. You may take to auto from hotel itself and can set him for entire city round. It will not cost you much.

Name: guddu1954
Title: A big Ganesha idol
Review: The place is close to Mahakaal temple and is the first temple to be visited once you come out of Mahakaal temple.

Name: Radha S
Title: Ganapati temple King size
Review: Wonderful temple with huge murti of Lord Ganesha. Beautifully dressed. There is also panch mukhi Hanuman. There is big cradle.  Also mother Yashoda with her baby Krishna.  Nice experience.

Name: EnakshiC
Title: A Lovely idol of Ganesh ji
Review: It is very near the Mahakaleshwar temple. We went here as the guide was a good fellow and keen on us visiting most of the temples in Ujjain. It is a large idol of Ganesh ji. Also very awe inspiring idol, and it naturally inspires one to bend in prayer.The temple also has other idols and this one place is quiet and spiritual. Nice temple!

Name: ashishkul
Title: Wonderful Idol of Lord Ganesh
Review: The temple is just next to Mahakaal temple towards Harsiddi temple...It also has a small area dedicated to Lord Krishna..Please spend sometime sitting in front of the Lord Ganesha.

Name: narasimham1949
Title: beautiful temple
Review: It is very nearer to mahakaleswar temple.The height of th idol is high and you can have good darshan .

Name: sharmasanchit32
Title: The Real Big Ganesha in Bade Ganesh ji ka Mandir
Review: The main attraction of the temple is its big Shri Ganesha deity. A must visit for all who have come to Mahakaleshwar temple.

Name: praveen c
Title: Big statue of Lord Ganesh
Review: This temple is very near to Mahakaleshwar Mandir. The temple is small but clean. there is a staue of Panchmukh Hanuman in the same temple.

Name: pln111
Title: Have Bade Ganesh`s Blessings
Review: This is very nearer to Sri Maha Kaleswar Temple. From the Kaleswar  temple one can walk into this temple. The idol of Ganesh is large and beautiful.considering its size it is known as Bade Ganesh Mandir. One of the attrractions at Ujjain.

Name: rakhsup
Title: Lot of dieties within this temple. Don't Miss Hanuman idol
Review: Ganesh idol is quite large, but I found the Hanuman idol to be more interesting. It's got four different faces, each facing the respective directions i.e. east, west, north, south.

Name: ankan146
Title: bade ganesh ji
Review: near mahakal dharamshala very nice lord ganesh statue with ladoo in his hands.. one of its kind in ujjain.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Visit for the Panchmukhi Hanuman idol made of ashtadhatu
Review: This temple has been established by freedom fighter Pandit Surya Narayan Vyas. Located near the Mahakaleashwar temple, there is large idol of Ganesha consecrated in the temple. However the real attraction here is the Panchmukhi (five faced) idol of Hanuman made of eight metals (ashtadhatu).During the war between Lord Rama and Ravana, Ravana asked Ahiravana king of Patal for help. According to Hindu cosmology, Patala is the seven lower regions of the universe which are located under the earth.  To protect Lord Ram and Lakshman Lord Hanuman formed a fortress with his tail. Mahiravana disguised himself as Vibeeshana and took Lord Ram and Lakshman to Patal. When Hanuman entered Patal to rescue Rama and Lakshman, he found that to kill Mahiravana he had to extinguish five lamps burning in five different directions at the same time. So he took the Panchmukhi form with Hanuman, Hayagriva, Narasimha, Garuda and Varaha faces and extinguished the lamps killing Mahiravana.

Name: Vidyadhar S
Title: Lord Ganesh Temple, Ujjain
Review: In Hindu Temples , Ganesh is prime deity, we worship. You will have various temple in Ujjain . This is nice location for visitors. But main temple , i.e. Garbhagruha is comparatively small. Its very pleasing experience. Sourrounding of this temple is also good. one can have tea, snacks.

Name: sachindixit
Title: Small Temple with huge Ganesha idol
Review: A few mins walk from Mahakaleshwar temple, Bade Ganeshji Ka Mandir has a huge idol of lord Ganesha. There are also some more idols inside!

Name: Ameet_Pathare
Title: Large idol of the God Ganesha..
Review: Very near to Mahakal Temple.Huge idol of Ganesh.The idol of Ganesh is beautiful.Provision for learning of Sanskrit and Astrology in the temple.

Name: Chockalingam S
Title: Pleasing God
Review: Very near to Maha Kaleshwar temple. One will have peace of mind and feel very pleasant on the first view of the huge Lord Ganesha here.A very good and neatly maintained temple. Panjamuka Anjaneya is also there.

Name: Kamal P
Title: Big Lord Ganesha Temple
Review: Temple with big statue of Lord Ganesha. This temple is near Mahakal temple. If possible attend evening arati. Panchmukhi Hanuman statue is also a must watch here...

Name: JAGDISH RAVAL
Title: Temple of Ganesha
Review: The Temple of Ganesh is just near temple of Mahakal in Old city of Ujjain. The idol is very big so the temple is called Bade Ganeshji ka Mandir. there is also a temple of Hanuman.first tourist spot after starting.

Name: sanjay k
Title: Very Nice Big Ganesha
Review: Very Nice Big Ganesha Temple statue.Standing in front of big statue is just a different feeling all together.Also Hanumna's statue in five different direction is also fabulous.

Name: VivekRastogi
Title: Big Deity like Ganesha
Review: This is one of the Big Deity at ujjain of Ganesha. This is very near to Mahakal Temple. Its on walking distance infront of Dharmashala. I like this temple from my childhood. The mouse who is well known savari of Ganesha is also big. Really you will love this temple.

Name: Ketan27
Title: A huge idol of Ganeshji
Review: This temple has huge idol of Lord Ganesh and located near Annapoorna Mata temple situated and is on other side of the town.

Name: Gdj
Title: Gopal mandir ujjain
Review: Most famous temple situated in center of ujjain city.activties of this temple maintained by sindhya trust.

Name: Gdj
Title: Gopal mandir ujjain
Review: Most famous temple on center of ujjain city.temple management by sindhiya rajgharana trust. Lord radha krishna temple.

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: Beautiful Vishnu temple
Review: Dedicated to Sri Dwarkadhish , this is a very beautiful Vishnu temple . Lies just near the Mahakaleshwar temple. Very nice paintings ,depicting the life of Lord Krishna adorn the walls . A must visit

Name: Nithin M Agarwal
Title: Nice. Positive. Simple Temple of Lord Krishna.
Review: It is a well located temple in Ujjain. Do visit for the beautiful wall carvings and the aartis/prayers.Date of Experience : August 2009

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Devoted for krishna.
Review: Gopal is the name of lord krishna , since this temple is dedicated to lord krishna , its a vintage property belongs to schindia estates later on turns into temple  , situated at heart of the city and because of this temple the whole area is names as Gopal Mandir . lots of flowers , bangles and hand made items and devotee items you can find close to this temple. and dont forget to try ujjain famous kulfi located very close to gopal mandir

Name: Gdj
Title: Gopal mandir ujjain
Review: Gopal mandir situated in center of city ujjain. This temples arrangement maintened by sindhya rajgharana gwalior.

Name: trivediar
Title: Beautiful
Review: Very beautiful statues of Lord Krishna, Balram, and Radha Ji. Situated in the Main Market so very crowded most of the time. But must visit when visiting Ujjain.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Gopal Mandir Temple
Review: Gopal Mandir Temple is also known as dhwarkadish temple and it is the temple of lord shiva. this place is located at the middle of main market.

Name: Shankar I
Title: A beautiful Krishna Mandir
Review: This temple is situated on a busy cross road of a main market in ujjain. It attracts lot of visitors. It is built in Maratha style. The Krishna is silver coated marble (2 ft )

Name: Vishnu Pendyala
Title: Built by the Scindia family ancestry
Review: It was closed when we visited, so had to see from outside. At least important temples like these should be open all through the day.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Jagannath mandir
Review: The main deity is lord Jagannath together with balaramar and subhathrai, and is most famous among the locals as gopal mandir. Its not that crowded so can have a visit here

Name: Sunnilbgautam
Title: Historical Lord Krishna Temple
Review: This is a small but beautiful temple in the city centre. Built by Royal Sindhia clan.Managed by there trust. Alter is built in such a way that if a person standing 100 feet away in front of the temple still the person can see the deities. Beautiful Maratha architecture.

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: Beautiful Krishna temple
Review: This is a beautiful Krishna temple in Ujjain . Built in Maratha style of architecture . Built centuries ago , it was destroyed by Muslim rulers and Mohammed Ghaznavi took away the heavy silver door to middle East . It was again brought into India by another Muslim ruler and Scindia scions then brought it back to original temple . History apart ,it's a beautiful , peaceful place with beautiful paintings ,depicting life and times of Lord Krishna on the roof . Deities are wonderful to have darsanas . Always a treat to visit the temple

Name: Omkar P
Title: REVIEW OF GOPAL MANDIR TEMPLE
Review: Though temple is old but well maintained. But few devotee visit to this place. Here you will find statue of Lord Krishna, Balram and Subhadra.

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Beautiful Temple
Review: I went to Gopal Mandir. A majestic marble towered structure at the centre of the market square, the Gopal Mandir in Ujjain is famous for the beautiful Krishna idol it houses. It is great place to go.

Name: nilesh_nagar
Title: Must visit
Review: In the heart of the city, lord Krishna temple is must visit place. Very old & historic temple. No parking place available there though but u can park 100 mts away from the temple and walk down. Buy some mehndi from outside the temple, it‚Äôs famous for mehndi also.

Name: Ktishan Kant Lavania
Title: Sakshi Gopal ji
Review: visiting Ujjain, must go to Sakshi Gopal Ji, The Gopal Ji is always with you, Really good, Visited with my mother

Name: sandeeprchavda
Title: Avg
Review: Can visit if you have ample time, nothing of must see , its basically a normal temple for Lord which is not must see if running out of time

Name: UmaBG
Title: Ancient temple.
Review: Gopal temple is neat shree mahakaleshwar temple very much inside the city. Very beautiful idols in the temple. Dedicated to lord krishna.

Name: DreamerDisha
Title: You may visit if in Ujjain. But not among the must to see places
Review: In the heart of a city, the contrast is evident that the idols in the temple face a mosque. To me, it symbolizes how we humans have divided one God. Good visit in the evening. A kirtan was going on and the energy was very positive.

Name: nik_0107
Title: Close to Shri Mahakaleshwar Temple
Review: Gopal Mandir Temple is located close to Shri Mahakaleshwar Temple, is dedicated to lord Krishna. Do confirm the times when it is open before you visit.

Name: niya27
Title: Jai Shri Krishna
Review: This temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna. We reached this temple at 2.00 pm. It was closed at that time. It opened at 3.00 pm for darshan. So, it is better to confirm closing time before going there.

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: A must see temple
Review: Located near to the Mahakaleswar temple , Gopal temple was built in 19 Century by a queen of Scindia dynasty . Lots of history associated with this temple . Architecture is brilliant with the stories of Sri Krishna depicted on the walls through beautiful pics . Very tranquil and peaceful place

Name: Masayoshi
Title: A unique place
Review: I'm a Japanese living in Delhi.Maybe I missed some meaning of this place.But, I experienced a unique place on a busy Commercial street.Inside of the gate was very much peaceful and calm.The contrast was interesting.Nice experience

Name: Aman P
Title: One of the most religious temple of ujjain
Review: The temple is situated just 750 meter from the world famous mahakaleshwar jyotirling . Very ancient temple with beautiful architecture on it One should visit this temple one his visit to ujjain

Name: Satveer S
Title: Best place forever in Ujjain
Review: It's a best temple in Ujjain and biggest too. There is a huge number of devotees visit here and god bless them. This place is also good for cheap shopping experience especially for clothes. So you must visit there too.

Name: traveller_prk
Title: Right in the middle of town
Review: The temple was closed when we first visited however on our way back it was open by 3pm. Idol is of dwarkanath and the temple interiors is also well decorated with carvings.

Name: Phb0414
Title: Centre place in market
Review: when u want to do local street shopping in ujjain... Gopal mandir is the place.. everything is nearby.. sarafa i.e. all well known jwellery shops, utensil shops, grocery items are available, etc. All place are nearby to gopal mandir,.. Its a krishna temple... idol is situated high so visible from outside also... nice place to roam around and taste the local culture of ujjain...

Name: ramki09
Title: Beautiful architecture
Review: Gopal mandir is a beautiful,clean and good architecture temple.Houses Lord Krishna and Radha.The main door entrance believed to have been originally in the somnath temple which was looted by Mohamed of Gazni and later found its way to lahore from where the Scindias brought it back to India and installed it here.when we visited nice bhajan was going on

Name: nilesh_nagar
Title: Very ancient but well maintained
Review: Ancient temple but well maintained by the administration. Thousands of people visit here everyday. Lord krishna looks like he will speak. Must viait place. Situated in a crowded market place. Almost no parking space but it is must visit place.

Name: yogindery
Title: Gopal Mandir Temple
Review: Gopal Mandir Temple is very peaceful and beautiful temple situated in between ujjain city.temple dedicated to lord krishna build by scindia's family.

Name: Manish B
Title: Divine and Beautiful.
Review: The temple is dedicated to lord Krishna and also known as Dwarikadhish Temple. Temple was build by  Bayaja Bai wife of Daulat Rao Scindia between 1848-56. Very pure and divine place to visit and worship.

Name: Yusuf B
Title: A peacefull place
Review: The gopal mandir is situated in ujjain which is consider as one of the best and historic temples of ujjain one should visit the temple at least once in their life

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: Beautiful
Review: Lord krishna temple is one of the famous temple to visit in ujjain.his temple is located in the mid of the city and on a walkable distance from the Mahakaleshwar temple.

Name: Gaurav C
Title: Beautiful Krishna Mandir
Review: Gopal mandir is one of the famous temples to visit in Ujjain. Beautiful idols of Lord Krishna and the best part is after visiting the temple, one can explore the nearby local market and also enjoy local kulfi and snacks.

Name: Pratul T
Title: Mandir of gopal
Review: Jai shree Krishna Gopal mandir just at a distance of few minutes ( by walking ) from mahakal temple The mandir js very big and is very temple made under Vikram Aditya rule

Name: HS-MISRA
Title: Good Temple
Review: this temple is located in the mid of the city and on a walkable distance from the Mahakaleshwar temple. This is very old temple built by Ahilya Bai Holkar. One can also enjoy shopping in the adjoining Market.

Name: 466surenderm
Title: Beautiful temple of Lord Krishna
Review: Gopal Mandir, located near City Market, is one of ancient temples of Ujjain. The temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna. Beautiful idol of Lord Krishna is in the temple. The architect is very good and good paintings can be seen in the temple. Atmosphere is very peaceful.

Name: Anmol18Gupta
Title: A divine holy Place
Review: Shree Gopal Mandir or Dwarkadhish Temple is a must visit place in Ujjain, here you will find the divine beauty of Lord Krishna.A place of divine serenity...

Name: Shalini020
Title: Peace right in between a bustling market
Review: There is a big market surrounding this temple but as soon as you are inside the premise there is peace and tranquility. There is beautiful murti of Krishna and some very beautiful paintings as well. Just go and sit and feel the silence.

Name: law_madhulika
Title: Temple of Shri Krishan
Review: Its an ancient temple of lord shrii krishan. As you know Ujjain is the city of temples this is one of the temple of Radhe Krishan. Beautiful architecture can be seen here.

Name: Nivedita_15
Title: Travel with shopping
Review: Be sure to go in morning. After darshan be prepared to spend some shopping time around. Be ready for crowdy market place

Name: Sujit Kumar Biswal
Title: Very nice temple
Review: This temple is located almost 1.5 km away from Ujjain railway station. One can hire an auto to reach this temple charges around Rs 40/- however if you take share taxi (Tata Ace) they will charge Rs 10/-. This temple is very beautiful one will appreciate the paintings on the roof. There are lot of shopping options around the temple so dont miss  the same.

Name: girishanjhim
Title: One out of 20 attractions in Ujjain.
Review: If you have come for pilgrimage, please do come to Gopal Mandir Temple in Ujjain. It is one of those 20 temple attractions in Ujjain.

Name: shailesh j
Title: nice temple in heart of city
Review: the temple is good and well maintained. this temple is of lord Krishna. the place is very easily accessible via public transport as it is in heart of city. various shops available nearby for shopping and eatout's are there. there are many places/temples near to this to visit

Name: Deepak19011975
Title: cool place
Review: again nothing to mention about this place as ujjain is nothing to dislike, once any visit there he feel like its every where god is place its a ver big TEERTHagain nothing to mention about this place as ujjain is nothing to dislike, once any visit there he feel like its every where god is place its a ver big TEERTH

Name: Arti66
Title: Holy experience
Review: Very historic ,iconic temple by Sindhiya royalsIn centre of town.Evening bhajans by locals .Outside shops are also tourist attraction

Name: JAGDISH RAVAL
Title: A Nice Place
Review: This is temple of Lord Krishna. The temple is in centre of city. There are also some other temples in main temples.Temple was neat and clean and we were pleased to offer prayer as there was not crowd although a big temple.

Name: VivekRastogi
Title: Krishna Temple in the heart of Ujjain
Review: This is one of the old krishna's temple in ujjain. Still this is belongs to Sindhiya's family of Gwalior and they are the trusty of this temple. Whenever Mahakal visits Ujjain in Savan and Bhado called Savari,At Gopal Mandir Temple priest of the temple and Sindhiya family do pooja of Mahakal savari, this is called HariHaran Milan.After evening aarti one can enjoy Bhajan in Temple. Infront of temple lot of parking space available.

Name: riteshsingh2k
Title: Very nice Temple
Review: It's very nice temple , when you visit ujjain , you must visit gopal temple . It's very nice to be there at Janmastami festival.

Name: ppg1961
Title: Visit to Ujjain city of Temple
Review: Ujjain is very religious place of Madhya Pradesh, known for Jyotirling Mahakal, my visit to Ujjain was for personal one.We stayed at Hotel Surana Palace and visited old and new city.Gopal Mandir is very old Temple of Shri Krishna established by Scindias, very much Maratha type construction of temple with black stone, very much in centre of old ujjaini nagari. chanting of bhajans was soothing to ears. area surrounded by local market for linen with hand prints.We also visited Ghantaghar, new Ujjain market, very well designed after 50s. lot of shopping hubs surrounding the area, with good sweet and namkin shops, Malwa is famous for.Taste of food is excellent.

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Krishna's Temple by Shinde's
Review: Constructed by Bayajibai Shinde, the queen of Maharajah Daulat Rao Shinde, in the 19th century. The door in the inner sanctum is believed to have been carried to Ghazni from the Somnath temple and from thence by Mahmud Shah Abdali to Lahore, from where it was rescued by Mahadji Scindia.This door is decorated by original emarald which is priceless.This temple is located at Chatri Chowk.

Name: KASI VENKOBA RAO
Title: Gopal Mandir@Ujjain
Review: This temple is situated in a busy area and the temple is surrendered by Market. It is one of the temples to be visited, when you visit Ujjain. The evening Aarthi is good and attracts a lot of pilgrims. Gopal temple at Ujjain is dedicated to Lord Krishna in blue form. It is also known as Dwarakadhish Temple. I had visited this  temple separately not with the arranged tour of Ujjain.

Name: Yogesh2801
Title: Gopal Mandir Ujjain
Review: This is a beautiful Krishan temple worth seen. It is said that on Shivaratri the idol is taken to Mahakal temple and on Janamashthami the Shiva idol is taken to Gopal temple in procession. One find solace on visiting Gopal temple.

Name: Reena S
Title: You will fallen love with kanha
Review: The kind of structure and and the idol is in this temple, one can easily fallen love with Lord Krishna, after visiting this temple i have realizes why Lord Krishna is having so many followers

Name: smanohar
Title: Amazing experience!
Review: We went to Gopal Mandir at around 7PM. Bhajan in the mandir had already started and it was an awesome experience to be part of it. Thousands of devotees (mostly locals) singing in the praise of Lord Krishna was just mesmerizing!!!.After this we did lot of shopping around Gopal mandir which has many shops catering to tourist needs.

Name: Gdj
Title: Simhastha mahakumbh in ujjain
Review: Simhastha mahakumbh organised in every 12 years intervals in ujjain.in 2028 next simhastha mela organised in ujjain.

Name: Gdj
Title: Simhastha mela in ujjain
Review: Simhastha mela organised in every 12 years interval in ujjain on back of shipra river.thousands of sadhu saint involved in simhastha mela.

Name: Gdj
Title: Ujjain simhastha
Review: Simhastha organised in ujjain at every 12 years interval on shipra river.a lot of people and sadhus participated in simhastha mela.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Divine Event.. Holy Bath..and much more ..KUMBH THE BIGGEST SPIRITUAL EVENT OF THE WORLD
Review: KUMBH or simhasth is considered as one of the worlds biggest event where people from all around the world visit ujjain to see listen various hindu spiritual gurus and to take divine holy bath. it's held on ones in a 12 year duration.

Name: Gdj
Title: Simhastha 2016
Review: In 2016 ujjain host simhastha mela.sadhus and millions of people involved in this spiritual programe.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Ujjain Simhasth Kumbh
Review: Ujjain Simhasth Kumbh is located in Ujjain once in every 12 year Ujjain Simhasth Kumbh mela is held. so many people came here for this Ujjain Simhasth Kumbh.

Name: Yash
Title: Simhasta 2016
Review: Hosted in Ujjain, once every 12 years, the Simhasth Kumbh Mela was last held in 2016. With an attendance of over 5 crore sadhus as well as devotees, this is surely a worth visiting event.

Name: arunbvkumar
Title: Dream come true to visit the Place of Kumbh Mela
Review: The experience was divine and visit of the place of kumbh mela was very fortunate. so many small temples and all the temples have been numbered. There is a small temple of Shipra Goddess where the evening aarti is conducted.

Name: designER_SACHIN
Title: Religious Kshipra River, Ujjain Kumbh
Review: The river Shipra is one of the holiest rivers in India. The most popular ghat of Shipra River is ‚ÄúRam ghat‚Äù. Ram ghat is the most ancient ghat of the river Shipra. During the Kumbh Mela or Sihasth which held after every 12 years

Name: nik_0107
Title: Kumbh Mela
Review: Simhasth Kumbh was held in 2016 in Ujjain when city saw huge influx of tourist in the city. Administered really well, it was once in a lifetime experience.

Name: Nish0901
Title: Simhasth Kumbh
Review: 2016 Simhasth Kumbh in Ujjain has made the fortune of Ujjain city. The newly built road is still working perfectly. All the places were given names with their description and significance. You can still find out the boards describing the place in front of every temple.

Name: GrannyMaa
Title: Ujjain Kumbh Mela
Review: We had participated in the Ujjain Kumbh mela held recently and it was a once-in-a-lifetime experience. To witness the huge population converging in this small temple town with a bevy of Sadhus, Sant, Babas, Devotees. Administrators & Police.. is a sight to behold. No words to describe it.

Name: parmanand06
Title: kumbh
Review: The place was too crowded but good arrangements were done. The hotel rates were exorbitantly high during the kumbh, All the river banks were cleaned and managed very well.The water was clean and atmosphere was great. The state goverment arrangement were also up to the mark.

Name: csathish
Title: KumbhMela Experience
Review: Lot of people, queues everywhere, ghats full of devotees. Two days of experience with too much of crowd in all direction. But with people from different parts of country with lot of devotion and reverence in air, totally a different experience. P

Name: uday s
Title: Holy Dip
Review: Holy place minus poor quality of water. So, take bath at your own risk. The place is famous for Kumbh mela.

Name: Adv Ashish F
Title: Holy place
Review: Ujjain simhas place is excellent constructed place with a holy touch . You can visit with family   The place is just adjecent to market area .

Name: Rakeshbagda
Title: Very nice place to visit
Review: It is very clean and people there are very helpful and nice. Please stay at some distance from the ganga ghat because there hotels are cheaper than hotels near ghat

Name: Satveer S
Title: Must visit there
Review: As simhasth is held in every 12 years it's the best thing in Ujjain as Ujjain is famous for it too. It's must visit place but we have to wait for 12 years for simhasth. You must enjoy in simhasth and I assure that. There are so many babas, gurus and so on comes here on simhasth and so many motivation lactures, bhandaras held there and we must enjoy swimming in kshipra river which is the best river. So if any one visit in Ujjain during simhasth time than they must visit mangalnath too and kshipra side too. And there are so many big hotels here for resting and simhasth is for 1 months and there are some saahi isnans at which we must go for isnan at shipra and its really a prime time forever and it has been running for very long time. So everyone must visit here at simhasth and there are so many ashrams in ahead of shipra river so you must visit there to meet guru ji's and take ashirvad of them. I hope you find my review helpful and you must want to visit in Ujjain during simhast time too and you must visit Ujjain at other times to visit mahakaleswar temple, kshipra river and many others temples, gurdwaras, masjids and many hotels. There are two churches here too so you can visit there too and during Christmas time there is a rush there so you may visit here at that time too because there is a good celebration at that time.

Name: RamGanesan
Title: Holy Dip
Review: The Kumb Mela happens here every 12 years.  Though we did not visit this place during that time, we definitely felt the vibration of this place when we visited.  The Kumb is on the holy Shipra river that flows though Ujjain.  When we visited there was not much facilities to take take bath and change, therefore we just opted to have water splashed on our heads and prayed to the Sun God.  If one is in Ujjain a holy dip is a must in the Shipra river as it is believed that it removes all sins committed by us.  The Ram Ghat is a comfortable place to take a holy dip.

Name: ramki09
Title: Kumbh place
Review: Ujjain simhasth kumbh place is the one where kumbh happened on the banks of River Shipra.Water is very clear and cool

Name: Phb0414
Title: holy experience
Review: kumbh mela comes after every 12 years.. last mela was in april-may 2016.... its a different experience to live in ujjain during kumbh...

Name: tripfreak54
Title: Ujjain Kumbh Mela!
Review: Ram Ghat is the site of Kumbh Mela. It is situated in the proximity of Mahakaleshwar Temple on the banks of Shirpa River. Kumbh Mela is held here every 12 years. The Kumbh Melas are held at Four Locations in Rotation: Haridwar (Ganga River) Nashik (Godavari River) Allahabad (Triveni Sangamam) and Ujjain (Shipra River).The Ujjain Kumbh Mela is normally held during Planetary combination  of Jupiter in Leo and Sun in Aries positions. The last Kumbh Mela in Ujjain was in April 2016.

Name: Naveenpawar
Title: Sahi Snan
Review: Very nice experience when visited Ujjain Simhasth Kumbh with my family and friends. Waiting for the next Simhasth Kumbh .

Name: Sandy
Title: Jai Mahakaal
Review: Awesome feeling. We visited this place on last day of the great mela. Huge crowds but excellent arrangements made by state govt. Hats off. We had a bath in water which was not that clean but when Shradha is there, everything is alright. Later we visited Mahakaal mandir where we had easy Dharshan. Jai Mahakaal

Name: Aditya A
Title: awesome experiece
Review: so good to feel, experience the rich culture of india ...very good experience in kumbh mela...never saw such a huge crowd at a single place

Name: sunil123singh
Title: Once in a lifetime experience
Review: Could take a holy dip in river shipra during Simhasth Kumbh in May'2016 alognwith my wife. It was her long time wish to take a holy dip in Kumbh fair which got fulfilled. We were so lucky that it was almost no crowd the day we reached and had this holy dip. Really lifetime experience

Name: nilesh_nagar
Title: Crowded but awesome feel
Review: Simhasth kumbh comes once in 12 yrs. Spread in huge area and people viait from all corners of d world. Visited this place also. Was crowded that time not now. Government did good arrangements that time including security n administration. Full marks to the government for making it successful.

Name: amal2019
Title: good places
Review: its a nice places of worshiping i m go in this place and its a totally awesome for me my personal say

Name: Akshay Jha
Title: Great Experience , Great management by State
Review: The place was too crowded but good arrangements were done. The hotel rates were exorbitantly high during the kumbh, something like 7000/night whereas its <1000 during normal days.  The experience was good, water was not so good.

Name: Gary M
Title: The Kumbha Mela is a magnificent spectacle.
Review: ‚ÄúIt is wonderful, the power of a faith like that, that can make multitudes upon multitudes of the old and weak and the young and frail enter without hesitation or complaint upon such incredible journeys and endure the resultant miseries without repining. It is done in love, or it is done in fear; I do not know which it is. No matter what the impulse is, the act born of it is beyond imagination, marvellous to our kind of people, the cold whites.‚Äù-- Mark Twain in 1895, after visiting the Kumbh Mela ‚ÄÉ ‚ÄÉ ‚ÄÉ

Name: Avidtraveller1514
Title: It's a school where Krishna had studied
Review: Nice temple! Has full history of how Krishna got his vidya in this ashram! Worth visiting if u r going for Ujjain darshan

Name: girishanjhim
Title: A lifetime event..worth being there
Review: Had visited the Ramghat and Sunheri ghat in the midst of Simhastha mela. The arrangements made were very good. No crowd no hustle-bustle.

Name: Kirit_J_Patel
Title: Nice arrangements
Review: What a g8 arrangements made by authority during kumbhmela at ujjain.  Inspite of heavy rush there,  security, home guard,railway police,  trainee home guards available in a lot of qty to guide pilgrim who came for holy deep in Shripra River. Clean & enough water in river. Really enjoy.  If you didn't visit this kumbh.  Don't miss next kumbh after 12 years.

Name: 1205abhi
Title: Holy Dip
Review: Holy dip in maa Kshipra is a great experience. Everyone should come here take a holy benifit of Moksha.

Name: Praveen M
Title: Ujjain Visit
Review: We recently visited the Mahakal shrine n was amazed with Darshan..Next day we planned to visit other famous temples and the kumb area was ofcourse in the list.We went just a month ahead of the Kumbh mela n the arrangements were being made for the visitors but found tht the ghats were well built for the convinience of the visitors. Must have been an amazing experience during Kumbh.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Once in a life time experience
Review: It is held when a rare configuration of planets takes place with the Sun in the zodiac sign Aries and Jupiter in the zodiac sign Leo. This configuration happens once in 12 years. in 2016  the Simhastha Kumbh was held in Ujjain from 22nd April till 21st May.

Name: Namdeo R
Title: A Holy bath
Review: This year on the last day of Simhasth ,we have have travelled by Duster from Nagpur to Ujjain and taken rest at Akhada known to us, and took holy dip in Kshipra in the morning.

Name: Sneha D
Title: Jai mahakal
Review: The best ever place ujjain bcms in kumbh.. its was my first experience to attend mahakumbh.... really once in life everyone must c this.. its a lifetime achievement...

Name: Abhinav@Indore
Title: Great experience
Review: On the most beautiful experience as simhasth is coming in every 12 years ,whole ujjain is looking beautiful . KSHIPRA RIVER IS.FULL OF WATER .

Name: Dr Amit  S
Title: Holy dip
Review: We went for sinhasth kumbh with my whole family,I. E my parents, wife and 2 kids,  my brother n his wife and their kid.The river was well maintained with adequate security. Water was clean.The only issue we faced was reaching the ghar in the scorching summer.Conveyance facilities were missing. Especially trouble some fr senior citizens. Otherwise, a wonderful experience

Name: joshisandeep
Title: Simhasth Mela
Review: Kumbh snan in holy Kshipra river was very excellent, I saw best arrangements and very clean water there.

Name: jhashyam
Title: Simhasth Kumbh
Review: Ujjain is one of the most sacred place for Hindu. Taking dip in Kshipra river during Kumbh mela is wish of every Hindu. Going to Kumbh mela with wife was most cherished wish which fulfilled.

Name: prannoy m
Title: Great Simhasta visit
Review: Ujjain was best to visit during simhasta to see sadhus, pandals, cultural and mythological events through out the fare area and of course the holy dip in river Kshipra.The water was clean and atmosphere was great. The state goverment arrangement were also up to the mark.Really enjoyed the simhasta trip to Ujjain.

Name: suryaprabhakaran
Title: Must visit Kumbh
Review: Hands of the police, army and the local people for their seamless support during this event. Man around 1 crore people would have visited in the past 30 days and still they had the energy to take care 1 more crore

Name: Gaurav C
Title: The great Kumbh mela
Review: This was my 2nd Kumbha mela visit to Ujjain and I must say compared to the last kumbh , this was much arranged , systematic and the government really made great use of technology.Kudos to the govt. of MP for great arrangements and also kudos to the volunteers who left no stone unturned to make this a successful mela.

Name: DNAGRAWAL
Title: simhasth Kumbh excellent arrangement by MP Govt
Review: visited kumbh on May 9th Shahi snan day. Excellent arrangement clear road side. even after major damage because of Rain etc. fast and good arrangement to rebuild. stayed at KUMBH RESORT for 2 days a company from Ahmedabad who are every year arranges for Camp at White Desert on Runn of Kutch. It was an experience with clean tent good staff excellent food. One night stayed in a Camp with a big Sadhu Akhada. This time govt has made excellent Toilet with every batch having one Western Toilet. Claen with Good water arrangement.

Name: Balaji S
Title: SimHastha-2016- Experience of a lifetime
Review: Travelled during May16. Saw the most number of people in a single place the first time in life. Was an experience of a lifetime. Appreciate the state authorities for planning and arrangements for such a massive gathering, the place was cleaner than expected. There were around 2000 swimmers and 60boats for the security of devotees. There was crowd that anywhere we could see human heads and nothing  else, but was moving. Had a fun time.

Name: Kasi V
Title: Shahi snan on May 9th Akshaya Trithiya
Review: I was in Ujjain on May 9th for Shahi Snan on the auspicious occasion of Akshaya Trithiya. I secured accommodation in MP Tourism Yatri niwas at Nanakheda Bus stand which is very close to Mahakal Temple and Ram ghat. Due to heavy inflow of pilgrims, I could get darshan of Lord Mahakaleshwar at 1930 hrs, ie evening arthi which I was lucky to witness live.MP Tourist accommodation  is very good and if planning to visit Ujjain, please do book a room  which can be done online also.Their restaurant also serves tasty and hygienic food.However I could visit Harsiddhi Mata Temple due to time constraint.

Name: soumitrapanda01
Title: Once in a lifetime  experience
Review: kumbha snan(a holy dip in river shipra during kumbha tithi jog) is believed to give mokshya(salvation).But I think a kumbh mela (fair) gives one a rare opportunity to touch the soul of India. Ujjain Simasth Kumbh  2016 would be remembered for long due to participation of milions of people, the sadhus ,akhdas ,the  natural diseaster during kumbh mela, the mismanagement and religious fervour.

Name: Hemu J
Title: SimhasthKumbh 2016
Review: Where you can find a place on earth where millions people assemble to seek nirvana ? Certainly you need to head to Kumbh !2016 Kumbh is ongoing at Ujjain, the city of Mahakaal and is famously known as Simhasth Kumbh. You can see primarily rural India flocking with family and friends to take a dip in holy Shipra. Needless to say the entire brigade of Sadhus of different aakharas and maths claiming the first right to take holy dip !  You can essentially observe how insignificant we are as an individual when such a mass of people is at one place and this in itself is a nirvana moment. I was escorting a group of elders (all in age group of 60+ ) and planned the trip keeping their health in mind. We had booked our flights early from Delhi to Indore and from there we hired cab to reach Ujjain. We stayed in aakhara as we know someone there. As plan B I had aleady seen few hotels and they seemed to be quite good for stay of elders. We carried basic medicines along with what elders were already taking regularly. We carried sufficient clothes for 4 days. I prepared Identity Cards for elders stating name and contact numbers of family and friends so that if someone gets lost it is easy for elders to get united with family and friends. Also we had sufficient biscuits, light snacks and water bottles.  I also downloaded simhasthKumb app from Google Play and this is something I recommend to one and all those who are planning to visit SimhasthKumbh as it contains lot of useful information.

Name: SameerParanjape
Title: Visit to the Simhasta Kumbh 2016
Review: The religious congregation where close to 50 Million people visit the banks of river Kshipra over the 30 days period (between 22nd Apr to 21st May), to take a holy Dip in the river to purify their Souls and seek freedom from the Sins. The bank is dotted with 12 Ghats (stairs), which can be used to reach out to the clean river water, which is continuously cleaned by the Ozone RO purifiers to maintain Hygiene. People from all over the country congregate, participate in religious discourses, meet the esteemed sages and seek their blessings apart from the visit to Mangalnath temple and Mahakal Temple. The city which has a population of 0.6 Millions gears up infrastructure to receive so many devotees , and the administration manages the event well. The city embraces you, energises you and you feel pure after the visit.

Name: _shwetaajaypurohit
Title: Happy to be a part of the kumbh
Review: It was an amazing experience. ...although the place is very crowded which ought to be  but still things were well managed at many levels like police; medical;traffic controllers .U have to walk a lot...weather is really hot...remain hydrated and avoid moving out in daytime . everyone is helpful as such but every one wants to make money...Anyways worth going and enjoying the bliss of shipra river...jai Mahakaal

Name: Vishuq963
Title: Life time experiance
Review: One of the most managed and clean Kumbh. before planning we were having lot of apprehensions about the arrangement but once visited we were delighted

Name: Arun L
Title: Well managed and safe Kumbh
Review: This Kumbh is one of the best managed Kumbh:safe and comfortable dip in the holy river.There are police and attendants at most of the locations and the police too are quite helpful.

Name: Yogesh2801
Title: Simhast Kumbh at Ujjain
Review: Ujjain Simhastha is a Hindu religious mela held every 12 years in the Ujjain city of Madhya Pradesh, India. The name derives from the fact that it is held when the Jupiter is in Leo (Simha in Hindu astrology).It is one of the four fairs traditionally recognized as Kumbha Melas, and is also known as Ujjain Kumbh Mela.  According to Hindu mythology, drops of amrita (the drink of immortality) dropped at four places, while transporting it in a kumbha (pot). These four places, including Ujjain, are identified as the present-day sites of the Kumbh Mela.

Name: mukulchand
Title: The Best of the Kumbhs
Review: The Simhastha Mahakumbh was the fourth Kumbh I have attended. It was the best organized. I thoroughly soaked myself in the Religious Ambience. The Ghats were amazingly clean and it was a pleasure to take a dip in the River.

Name: ominvent
Title: A gathering of faith and belief.
Review: As many others have reviewed, the arrangement by the local administration is superb and calls for appreciation w.r.t people's security and traffic management. During "Shahi Baths" there will be restrictions for general public to have bath at particular times due to Sadhus taking a dip in river Shipra in groups. But otherwise it will not be much crowded at the ghats for taking bath. It will be a lifetime experience to witness such a religious gathering and being part of it. From accommodation and meal point of view, one needn't go for hotels which charge inflated amount during this period, instead one can look for "Pandals" or "Vishramgrahs" setup by many charitable trusts and saints of various regions mostly for free or few hundred bucks( yes both accommodation and meals). This will definitely not be of the level of hotels but surely is economical and safe too.Tips:1. If you wish to remain economical in your expenditure, then you can go to "Peepli Naka" area. There are many free/economical accommodation+meals provided by various religious trusts. Also this area is closer to bathing places called "ghats" and "Mahakaleshwar temple".2. This area is merely 3.5 km from Ujjain railway station. But remember, in the night, taxi drivers might refuse to go there due to traffic restriction by police. But ask them to drop to a nearby place, the remaining distance will surely be walk-able.3. Don't worry if you reach late in the night at Ujjain railway station because due to Kumbh this city is awake 24x7.

Name: Vipin G
Title: Akshay Tritya Snan in shipra nadi @ ujjain
Review: 5* rating for the Govt and organisers.  The ghats were well protected, the security impeccable and water was clean.  No rush on GHATS (except Ramghat) even on 9th May, when 70 lakh people took bath at Mahakumbh.  What more can one say about excellent level of organisation

Name: Narain S
Title: The biggest exhibition on the planet.
Review: The kumbha mela is a must visit event in anyone's life .I could bet there is no experience in this world which brings you close to god than the kumbha mela. One could see people from various parts of India coming here for the kumbh for its religious significance and foreigners come to witness such a marvel. The kumbh experience is spiritual as well as phsycadelic. It is a world completely isolated but yet connected to this world.One can easily find Naga sadhus in the streets and ghats . They roam naked, smearing holy ash over their body,chanting mantras and smoking ganja in their chillum. You may think that these guys are out of their minds doing all crazy stuff . You wouldn't know how rich they are in their knowledge about this world , their perspective about this world is entirely different from what you would have imagined.
