They live in a state of trance thinking only about Lord shiva. One can learn from their life that "man who has nothing is the richest".not anything in this world except lord shiva can ever fascinate a Naga sadhus.once after the kumbh is over they go back to their caves in Himalayas or wherever they came from only at the kumbh they can be seen inside the civilization.My experience in the kumbh was really 1000 times better than what I thought it would be . I thought it would be poorly organized but the Madhya pradesh government proved me wrong. It requires such a great amount of planning to organize such an event without any risks of stampedes or terrorist attacks. MUST DO THINGS AT THE KUMBH :*Vist the mahakaleshwar temple*Interact with people on their views of the kumbh mela *Share a chillum with some group smoking up. You would get stoned and go into deep conversation about questions of life .*Have a dip in Kshipra *eat local food *Drink Bhang near the mahakaleshwar temple shouting "JAI HO MAHAKAL"one the whole the kumbh is a must Vist marvel . I am sure you would learn as well as enjoy a lot there . A life changing experience for sure . Will make you think 360¬∞ ..a 5/5 experience HAR HAR MAHADEV !!

Name: Riteshamd
Title: Amazed, distinguished people, religious gathering
Review: It's amazing to see such a large gathering of people at one place. Super arrangements by administration for managing crowd, cleanliness, hygiene, and ghats. All ghats ( place where people take holy dip) are well maintained, clean and with volunteers to help people. We were with kids and had no problems. We visited so many Sadhus, and pandals. People are just coming "Aastha still there". Once in 12 years if you can make it you should go for it...

Name: Shaileshbharal
Title: one must visit in life time
Review: This maha kumbh celebrates every 12 years and called Simhatha. As per Hindu mythology a holy dip during Simhastha is a step to Moksha/Nirvana. It is in a radius of 40 kms .Very nice arrangements by local administration.You will find many spiritual Sants Sadhus and will have a spiritual feelings and will come to know Santan culture.

Name: Ravi S
Title: Religious wonder
Review: MP Govt has done lot to make Kumbh Mela comfortable and attractive.However when we visited, there was hardly any rush, but still police did not allow vehicles to go near ghats and we, senior citizens, had to walk two km to reach ghat.This could have been avoided . Water was not clean and not flowing but we had a dip and made ourselves a part of the religious occasion.Ghats were clean and area colourful . Great to see sadhus in their camps.Must visit even with some inconvenience

Name: tikkuJaipur
Title: A Conclave of Hinduism
Review: Once in a life time oppurunity to witness the vastness and complexions of hinduism. Never to seen naga sadhus and other spiritual leaders is a biggest postive of this Kumbh mela in ujjain. All the river banks were cleaned and managed very well. Adip in the holy khispra river is the most preferred activity by the visitors.

Name: guptaashok_0511
Title: Must visit
Review: Not to be missed. Had bath at  Mangalnath Nath and Ramghat. Well organised. All that's are clean. Not to be missed.

Name: skdel2016
Title: Good Place to perform Pooja for Nav graha shanti.
Review: It's a big temple complex having very calm environment where one can spend some time. The place is popular for it's navagraha dosha santi pooja including sadhe sati pooja of Shani. There are temple of each graha. People offer potli ( small packets) of grains in different colured cloths as per differen Graha. Good place.

Name: vinay760
Title: Ujjain Darshn
Review: This is one of the historical and famous temple and must visit. this is on the way to Ujjain and very powerful temple.  It is all Navagrash idols and Shani Mandir.  Very nice and beautiful place near to River, enough space for parking, please visit on working day to less crowd .

Name: Gdj
Title: Shani mandir ujjain
Review: Most famous shani temple in ujjain at bank of shipra river.there is also navgraha temple in that location.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Triveni - A combination of 3 rivers
Review: Its a place situated at banks of river shipra where lots of pilgrims visited to take holy bath and spiritual rituals . its a divine destination with cool ambiance

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Navagraha ( nine planets ) temple
Review: Navagraha means Nine planet ( its a temple where you can find idols of all nine planets ) as per hindu mythology every planet is a god and having there own significance associated with every human being and there sun signs.

Name: Gdj
Title: Shani mandir triveni ujjain
Review: This is most famous shami bhagwan temple bank of shipra river.5km Away from ujjian city on indore road.

Name: trivediar
Title: Pranaam
Review: There is a Shani Dev Temple and Navgraha Temple also. Worth visiting as the holy Shipra river is visible from here.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Triveni Ghat Sri Saneeshwara Navagraha Temple
Review: Triveni Ghat Sri Saneeshwara Navagraha Temple, is located near bank of shipra river dedicated to lord Saneeshwara.  peaceful and well maintained place.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Navagraha Mandir
Review: Navagraha Mandir, this one is must see place in Ujjain. this place is located near to bank of shipra river and known for navgraha.

Name: Neelamraju
Title: Must Visit while traveling to Ujjain
Review: Navgraha Mandir is dedicated to nine planets - Surya, Chandra, Mangal, Budh, Guru, Shukra, Rahu, Ketu and Shani all in the shape of a  Lingams. According to Hindu scriptures Shani is the greatest judge and a teacherThe Hindus believe that Navagrahas play a key role in their destiny. The nine planets are worshipped for good luck and to overcome adversities. Of the nine deities, seven are named after planets in the solar system and correspond with the names of seven days in the week of the Hindu calendar. The remaining two -- Rahu and Ketu -- are actually demons who managed to gain a place. ( These are refereed to the Solar and Lunar Eclipses)Each Planet is also represented by a color Surya - Sunday - RedChandra - Monday - whiteMangal - Tuesday - RedBudh - Wednesday - GreenGuru - Thursday - YellowShukra - Friday - WhiteShani - Saturday - BlackPeople offer various colored cloth with other offerings and flowers during their visitWe visited this place on a Sunday and were surprised to find a hoard of footwear left behind from last night ( Saturday) it is believed that people pray Shani and leave their footwear behind  as it is believed that Shani enters us through our legs!!

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Sani temple
Review: This is one more temple along the banks of river shipra  dedicated to lord saneswarar, one of the most important grahams among the navagrahams .

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Temple for navagrahams
Review: One of the temple along the ghats of shipra river is dedicated to the navagrahams and the Temple is not that crowded,but mostly have local devoties around.

Name: shaileshjpai
Title: Temple
Review: This temple is dedicated to navgrahas. It is located near ujjain.it is a small temple. You can see a triveni sangam ghat here.

Name: Dilip123
Title: Ancient temple worshiped by king vikramaditya
Review: This is an ancient temple that was worshiped by king vikramaditya. The deities of the nine planets are housed in 9 different chambers. The idols are just faces that have been eroded over time which reflects the antiquity of the temple. The idols are placed in the corner of the room and also has a small linga kind of a thing in the centre. It is a very unique temple and definitely worth a visit.

Name: Dilip123
Title: Ancient temple worshiped by king vikramaditya
Review: This is an ancient temple that was worshiped by king vikramaditya. The deities of the nine planets are housed in 9 different chambers. The idols are just faces that have been eroded over time which reflects the antiquity of the temple. The idols are placed in the corner of the room and also has a small linga kind of a thing in the centre. It is a very unique temple and definitely worth a visit.

Name: akankshacoolgirl
Title: Lord Shani Temple
Review: This is a famous Shani temple on the ghats of triveni river. The temple should be visited on Saturday if you are nearby

Name: Omkar P
Title: VISIT TO NAVGRAHA MANDIR
Review: While going to Omkareshwar temple from Ujjain, the temple is on the way. The lord of all grah's statue are assembled in one roof.

Name: arunbvkumar
Title: Unique temple dedicated to 9 planets
Review: It is one of the kind of unique temples where the Navagrahas are worshipped in the form of shivalinga and all of them are swyambhu. The temple was built by Raja Vikramditya. There is Triveni Ghat near the temple.

Name: sandeeprchavda
Title: Avg place
Review: This temple has all 9 Gods i e nav grah. Not a must see place, you can visit if you are having ample time

Name: Vidhi_sharmah
Title: one of its kind
Review: there are not many temples in world dedicated to Nine planets , this temple is situated on triveni ghat on the banks of river shipra, must visit

Name: nik_0107
Title: Outskirts of Ujjain
Review: Temple is located on the out skirts of the city and needs around an 1 hour to reach. Located on the banks of river Shipra.

Name: Richs V
Title: Lovely temple
Review: Must viist temple.I simply loved this temple..Outside temple you can found so many shops who are selling pooja samagri (I bought it and find it very usefull as it contains all items to be offered to all planets) and you can found all planets temple around shani temple so its nice.

Name: Dev-Shiv on a Trip
Title: Shani Dev and Nav Graha Temple !
Review: This temple complex is on the Ujjain - Indore road. Takes some time to reach and the taxis and autos generally don‚Äôt take you here because of the distance involved. The Shani Dev temple is quite well known and along with it the Nav Graha ( Nine Planets) temples are worth visiting. Worth a visit and not to be missed if in Ujjain. A number of shops are on the outside from where you can purchase mustard oil( sarson ka tel ) for offering to the Shani Dev Temple.

Name: Sunil R
Title: Very Popular Ghat
Review: you will see more crowd on amavasya and purnima of every month, Triveni ghat is located  on Sanver road or you can say indore ujjain road. famous for shani temple, navgrah temple and kshipra Ghat.

Name: parmanand06
Title: clam ghat
Review: It is famous for all nine grah god,The temple is on the bank of Kshipra.Good place to visit and awesome experience for nature lover.Beautifully situated along the banks of the river

Name: Sunil K
Title: Calm and Relegious place of Shani Mandir
Review: We visit the temple on 18th July 2017 the location is well connected by good transportation and The temple is on the bank of Kshipra But did not taken the bath there as there was sergeant water and algae was all over the area.Its ok for warship of Shani dev and considering all Garh in one temple to performing any pooja.

Name: Sunil K
Title: Calm and Peacful temple near kshipra river
Review: The temple is very nicely located on the bank of River kshipra wthich is triveni Ghat. All garh temple situated in one temple and near the Triveni Ghat make it very religious. The temple is some far from Shri mahakaleshvar Temple but worth to see.

Name: uday s
Title: Navagraha Temple
Review: Beautifully situated along the banks of the river. This is a powerful Shani temple famous from the days of King Vikramaditya

Name: uday s
Title: A rich history
Review: Dates back to the days of Vikramaditya, when the king built this temple due to Shani Peeda. His wife was an ardent devotee of Shani Dev. This place is situated on the Triveni Ghat of the Shipra, 6 km away from Ujjain.

Name: RamGanesan
Title: A calm temple
Review: Situated around 10 kms from Ujjain center, this place is a very peaceful and clam place.  I understood from the people in the temple that this place is not very crowded most times.  This temple is believed to have been built and worshiped by Vikramaditya the noble king of Ujjain. One will need a auto from the center of Ujjain to reach this place.

Name: Phb0414
Title: Navgraha mandir/ shani temple
Review: Situated at triveni ghat... its a very famous shani temple in ujjain... it is far from main city..towards indore road...

Name: Viswaconsultant
Title: Enjoy the river..
Review: We have visited in the morning..Quite calm area.. Monkeys are  plenty.. Take care.. Backside of the temple, calm river is running.. approach road is not good ..slippery..

Name: BeGuide
Title: Navgrah Mandir
Review: As name suggest this temple is devoted to navgrah. While visiting all temples one must visit navgrah temple too.

Name: Dr_Ankit_Agarwal
Title: Just besides river Shipra
Review: Very calm and peaceful environment. The temple is situated very near the Ujjain Indore highway, on the banks of river Shipra.

Name: Manish B
Title: Navgraha and Shani Temple
Review: The temple is approx 6 to 7 Kms away from main city towards indore. Very famous temple of shani maharaj. On sat lot many people visit the temple and pray to god. At the river bank the location is very peaceful.

Name: DEEPAK_23M
Title: Temple of 9 graha
Review: Navgraha temple were all nine grah idols separate section there is a myth if u have a shani dosh than u should do pooja here, shani dosh problem will b solved

Name: Achal
Title: A place to worship Sani [Saturn]
Review: A temple on the bank of Kshipra [triveni], location is perfect to spend time on Ghat & temple its on the Indore-Ujjain highway about 8km from main city center

Name: Arun L
Title: One of the important temples of Ujjain for the religious visitor
Review: This temple is one of the important temples for the religious visitor.However for the usual tourist,this temple is of limited interest.

Name: BhowmikM
Title: Sri Saneeshwara Navagraha Temple and Triveni Ghat
Review: This temple is situated on the Triveni Ghat of the Kshipra river, around 6 km before Ujjaini town (while coming from Indore). You need to take a small detour to reach the temple entrance.It is dedicated to the nine planets (Navagraha - the nine/nava major celestial bodies (Grahas) of Hindu astronomy). These planets are Surya (Sun), Chandra (Moon), Mangal (Mars), Budh (Mercury), Guru/Brihaspati (Jupiter), Shukra (Venus), Shani (Saturn), Rahu (North Lunar Node) and Ketu (South Lunar Node). The temple is located at the confluence of 3 rivers - Kshipra, Saraswati and Gandaki. Spend time at Triveni Ghat, take a holy dip.

Name: guptaashok_0511
Title: Good bathing ghat.
Review: It is near to Navgriha/Shani Mandir. You can enjoy dip in the river. Ghats are clean. It is on the Indore Road

Name: guptaashok_0511
Title: Relegious place
Review: This is a Relegious place on the bank of Shipra River ( Triveni Ghat) around 6 kM from railway station. A simple mandir.

Name: guddu1954
Title: Goddess Durga in her nine Awatars
Review: This temple is having nine awatars of Goddess Durga inside the main temple-in fact this is a nine in one temple.

Name: npn2000
Title: Navagrah Temple
Review: Triveni Ghat Sri Saneeshwara Navagrah is accessible when coming from indore road , must visit temple and enjoy the surrounding

Name: perplexed_soul
Title: Great place
Review: The temple is situated in a very good location (3 rivers merge nearby). Also, this temple is renowned for temples for all 9 stars. Place of astrological importance.

Name: rahulkumar1411
Title: triveni ghat
Review: this navgrah temple is based on triveni ghat and just 6 km from ujjain.it is famous for all nine grah god whch idol has been established here

Name: law_madhulika
Title: God of all stars
Review: As per Hindu mythology, every human being's life moves with its stars movement and every star is headed by one GOD.This is the temple where you can worship all nine god in one place.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Triveni sangam
Review: It is located close to the Shani Navgraha temple. It is the confluence of three rivers- Shipra, Gandaki and Saraswati. The ghats here are not so well maintained and the sangam is usually dirty. But it is a nice serene spot with old banyan trees. It is peaceful to sit under these old trees and enjoy the cool breeze here.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Situated at confluence of three rivers
Review: The Navagraha mandir is situated at the confluence (triveni) of three rivers- Shipra, Gandaki and Saraswati. There are nine temples dedicated to nav grahas- Surya, Chandra, Mangal, Budh, Guru, Shukra, Rahu, Ketu and Shani.

Name: ashutosh r
Title: Lord of the Rings :)
Review: This is a place of astrological importance, Indian astrology suggests that the life of an individual is goverened by the placing of the nine planets and sun in an individuals horoscope. This temple is like a ring with all planets on the periphery and the sun temple in the center. Mythology also suggests that when the planets received the status of the Devtas(Gods), they requested Shiva the mighty Lord that they should also be worshipped in the form of Shiva. Hence in all the temples of individual planet you will find the Shivlinga, a form of Lord SHiva.

Name: pradeep_parhi
Title: Famous Shani temple in Ujjain
Review: We had been to Navagraha Mandir of Ujjain on 21st October 2015. It situated in the outskirts of ujjaiin at a distance of around 8-10 kms from the city on the Ujjain-Indore highway. There are idols of nine grahas here. Shani temple is the main temple here. It is said that king Vikramaditya worshipped Shani Dev here. On Saturdays the temple premises remain crowded. On all other days, a good amount of crowd is observed during evening. It is situated near Triveni ghat.During Ujjain visit, one should not skip this place.

Name: Kapil J
Title: A Secluded Serene Temple
Review: The Navgraha Temple popularly known as Shani Temple in Ujjain is very old temple on the banks of River Shipra. It is said that King Vikramaditya of Ujjaini used to visit this temple regularly to offer his prayers to Navgraha. I loved the calmness of the place. The temple has greenery all around. If you visit it once, you would love this place. The place is very close to Indore Ujjain highway.

Name: Krishna1970
Title: Famous temple of for Shani dosa nivarana puja
Review: The Navagraha temple is located on the outskirts of Ujjain city to Indore main road. It is near by Triveni sangham on the  banks of Shipra river. There are nine idols for nine planetary Sun signs. People came here to worship their sun sign planet for peace and prosperity. Mostly crowded on Saturdays as devotees came here for Shani dosa nivarana puja.

Name: JAGDISH RAVAL
Title: A small Temple
Review: It is believed there are 1000 big and small temple in Ujjain. So ujjain is called city of temples.this temple is located at Triveni Ghat on Bank of River Shipra. Here are idols of Nine Plantet and temple is dedivated to nine planets. Huge crowd here on full moon day.

Name: srisherry
Title: Very different
Review: On the way from Indore to Omkareshwar ji, one should stop to pay darshan to relatively a very large dedicated Navagraha mandir.

Name: jeyakumar
Title: wonderful temple
Review: the temple is on the outskirts of ujjain.separate abode for the nine grahas.the top of the building is i muhal style.one of the very few big temples of navagiraha whether you believe in astrology or not pray at Navagraha Mandir

Name: Dipsy1982
Title: if you believe it please visit it.
Review: nice place to visit if you are in Ujjain, as the indian and world mytholoy says our past present and future are control by nine planet this is based on the same logic. there are nine temple of each gruh/idol

Name: Pallavi_Raj
Title: For the peace of all sun signs
Review: "Navgraha" means all the planets n stars supporting our sun signs. People come here to worship their sun sign's master planet for peace n prosperity. Saturdays are the most rush days here as the main temple of Shani dev is supposed to be very popular here. People who are suffering from shani dosh comes here n perform abhishek. The temple is very popular for dosh nivaran pooja. It is situated at river bank n so its an awesome tourist spot too. Beware of monkeys as wen we went there few monkeys were there. From city its a 10 km ride on highway going to Indore. But its better not to hop-on on private buses going to Indore as they are always over loaded. Just pack your food n try a two wheeler ride.

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: One of the most Visited place of Ujjain
Review: Bhartrihari Caves are situated near GadKalika Matha temple, above the banks of Shipra River and is one of the major tourist attraction of Ujjain. These 11th century caves owe their name from Bhartrihari who is step brother of King Vikramaditya.  History of the Caves: Bhartrihari born as a King, but still renounced his affluent lifestyle and adopted the grab of an ascetic. It is said that reason beyond that was his disturbing relation with his wife. The heartbreak led him to give up all his dreams and become a spiritualist. When Bhartrihari decided to renounce the worldly life, he came here in search of a peace to continue his meditation. In due course of time these Caves  became his shelter where he spend considerable part of his life.  Bhartrihari was a great scholar and renowned poet, known for his delicate use of Sanskrit in his verses. Some of his great works like Nitishatak, Shringarshatak and Vairagyashatak are considered as gems of Indian literature. It is believed that all these were written in this caves only. The interior of the cave is extremely cool, peaceful and spiritual. Narrow route inside the cave number 1 leads to the place where Bhartrihari meditated. The stone curved statue of Bhartrihari in the sitting position is arranged there for visiting purpose. There is also a small temple in Cave number 2 that is a holy shrine of the Nath community. Throughout your journey to Bhartrihari Caves you will have a feeling of travelling to a different era.

Name: SudarshanKS
Title: nice caves
Review: Nice caves, dominantly belonging to Nath pant gurus. Locals say the brother of King Vikramaditya gave up his worldly life to do penance in these caves.

Name: abkush
Title: Caves in Ujjain
Review: Nothing much to see here. I think caves are redone with all ceiling and floor laid newly. But I believe the original caves are totally replaced as some underground tunnel.The entrance is quite small, and gets stuffy when multiple people are there.Can be missed.The statues of the deities is quite mesmerizing (specially the Kali Ma statue).

Name: skdel2016
Title: Place to remember  Mahpurush
Review: The place is a cave now being developed as tourist place. Its a open place on small hill . The King Bhartrihari (relative of King Bikramiditya , The only King having throne equipped with yogini popularly known as " Throne of Vikramaditya" who was treated as most scientific and knowledgeable person to whom even Devta came for judgement)  later became a masrishi did mediation there for the sake of good man kind. Place shows how the mediate there and show there devotion towards God. Small caves with Trisuhul etc are worth watching. Currently any visitor can offer grass to cow as " Gau seva" starts from Rs. 50 on wards. Beautiful place to spend some time with nature little far from main city.

Name: AnshumanMaini
Title: Total time waste
Review: There is nothing to see here. Nothing. I mean nothing. Seriously. I went with expectations and this is just time waste, money waste, petrol diesel waste, energy waste. This is not a place one would like to see on any day. I mean it. Any given day. NO. May be good for residents as they have historical and emotional connect, but for outsiders/tourist NOTHING.

Name: nugu9956
Title: caves
Review: bhartrihari caves is ujjain here very big caves is caves k shath old fact jode hui hai very big gaushala is here

Name: hipiyush007
Title: Caves of Ujjain's First King
Review: These are ancinet cave in which Ujjain's king and his brother spend their many years in worshipping their god. These are small and narrow cave , not recommended for old age people or for those who have problems of anixiety or backpain. But a must visit place to understand the effort and meaning of tapasya in ancient history of india.

Name: Sivakumar V
Title: Ancient Caves - a must see in Ujjain
Review: These caves were supposed to be where the King Bharthihari , a cousin of the Great Vikramaditya lived as a saint after giving up the king- style life under a depression. He meditated years and wrote in Sanskrit three great books.The small but awesome caves in two parts is on the shores of the Shipra riverand about 6 Km from the centre of the town of Ujjain

Name: 1Jayanthi
Title: Historic caves
Review: This caves are supposed to be more than 3000 years old. Here King Vikramaditya‚Äôs brother went for mediation.Caves are not maintained well.

Name: plpalani
Title: Small caves
Review: The caves was supposed to have been inhabited by Bhartrihari,brother of King Vikramaditya some 2000 years ago.There are few steps to go down but the cave it self is very small and nothing much to see

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Unique Historical caves...
Review: bharthihari was the step brother of king vikramaditya and one day he decided to leave his lavish life and go for search of peace , he decided to go for medication and selected this caves for meditation purpose and later on it becomes shelter for him and others. you have to enter with a very narrow space in this caves and advisable to take proper care specially when you are visiting with small kids.

Name: Gdj
Title: Bhartri gufa ujjain
Review: Bhartri caves located 5 km away from ujjain city.there are varrious gods murtis in the caves.caves shown wonderful traditional art of that period.

Name: trivediar
Title: Wow!
Review: I was amazed after entering into the caves of Shri Bhartrihari and Shri Gopinath Ji. Both caves are near to each other. I felt different kind of energy when I was inside the caves. Must visit place.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Bhartrihari Caves
Review: The caves are situated on the banks of River Shipra, adjacent to the temple of Gadkalika. Legend has it that this is the very place where Bhartrihari, the step brother of Vikramaditya and a very renowned poet used to live and meditate after relinquishing all the luxuries of life.

Name: brad
Title: Nice view of historic spirituality turned into money making.
Review: The cave is off the beaten path and away from alot of tourism yet it is a tourist attraction still. Inside the main cave is a great place of spiritual energy. Worth the visit if you wanna connect to history of Natha Sect and Bhartrihari and the legendary king of Ujjaini.

Name: RanjithKumarPrabhu
Title: Meditating place of Raja Bhartrihari
Review: Bhartrihari who is the step brother of Vikramaditya use to meditate here. There are two caves altogether. They are located underground. But no worries, they are not narrow caves where one suffocates. The caves are fully lit and well air conditioned, and they look like ordinary rooms. The is also a shiv linga in one of the caves, where it is mentioned that praying here is equivalent to covering the char dham yatra.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: One of the tourist place
Review: place is one of the important must see tourist place in the city if time permits.cave gives us a feeling that there could have been some settlement around in early days.

Name: Vishnu Pendyala
Title: Experience the neeti shataka
Review: Having committed many stanzas of the saint's neeti shataka to memory when i was a student, it was a great experience visiting his place of residence / meditation. Of course, unfortunately, the trip is certainly not for the faint heart or the elderly. Glad that i could visit when I'm still fit.

Name: Hitesh Rathore
Title: Just caves
Review: One of the visit sites in Ujjain almost in the citi's outskirts. Please avoid if you have heart or lungs or breathing problem. As the site requires you to get inside the congested stone caves with limited air and light circulation and inside is full of smoke and dust.

Name: babita13
Title: Claustrophobic Caves
Review: interesting place to visit as one can not assume it from outside. one has to go down where that is little claustrophobic

Name: shaileshjpai
Title: Cave
Review: This cave is a meditation place of sage bhartrihari. You can see 3 caves here.  Small place but worth visiting.

Name: Ajay KMehta
Title: Peace and love of Shiva
Review: Underground caves where Bhartrihari ji,Sri gorakh nath ji and many other great saints of Naath lineage prayed.Nice temples and you have to go underground for the caves.Be cautious as air is very stuffy underground.Even today you can feel the love of God in these great saints and get touched by them.

Name: Dilip123
Title: An ancient place steeped in history
Review: This is an ancient place with a lot of history associated with it, the details of which have been given by a lot of reviewers here.Couple of things to be noted before visiting this place:1. One needs to get down a series of steps to reach this place. It is more like descending a hillock. So travellers who are old or have a weak knee should be prepared for this descent and a climb on return.2. Having reached the entrance, one gets to see some old carvings, small shrines and a fairly new temple constructed by the goraknath cult.3. The actual caves are below this level also. There are two sets of caves having separate entrance rooms. Old people might find it hard to get down and climb the steep stairs here.4. One of the caves have an AC unit running in the main chamber which is really helpful.Gorakshaknath people have a go-shala at this place and sell fodder for cows. If interested, people can feed cows here.

Name: Krishnaveni S
Title: Claustrophobic but exciting
Review: These are the caves we're Raja Bhattrihari who was brother of Vikramaditya meditated. He took up sanyastva because of the infedility of his favorite wife. There are 2 caves. The second is smaller than the first. There are idols of Nath Yogi's, trishul and the place where the king meditated. You will be covered in sweat by the time you come out

Name: Omkar P
Title: REVIEW OF BHARTIHARI CAVES
Review: This cave has been built by King Bhartrihari. But after that king has left his kingdom and became saint.

Name: AasthaD
Title: Historical Caves
Review: Beautiful small, deep and mystical caves. Though painted saffron by the MP tourism to give it religious face, it is a beautiful archaeological site with beautiful carvings and sculptures

Name: KeshavRaina
Title: Exploring Ancient Cave
Review: Very good experience exploring these caves. Please Remember inside the cave the oxygen level and air quality is too low. Caves are too claustophobic and the ceiling is also very low, ceiling would be around 5 feet tall. You can also get to see hanuman idol which is believed to hold the cave together. Also get along with baba's sitting inside already claustophobic cave.

Name: Viral Arya
Title: Ancient Caves of Bhartrihari, the step brother of Vikramaditya
Review: These are historic caves. Bhartrihari was the step brother of King Vikramaditya. According to legends these caves was assigned during 11th century AD. It is said that when Bhartrihari decided to renounce the worldly life, he came here in search of peace. Please note that the passage to enter in caves is very narrow and there is darkness with suffocation. I suggest to not enter inside main caves if your suffering with breathing problem. Please don't forget to bring torch.

Name: Priti C
Title: Nice place to explore temples in caves
Review: The place has 2-3 cave temples. The caves have very low ventilation and hence can feel claustrophobic. Also the caves are smelly. If you travelling in after noon make sure to wear socks as the ground gets too hot to walk. The caves are good to explore the rich culture of Indian temples. Cave no 1 has some tricky stairs so be careful if you travelling with old parents or people. There is a gaushala near the caves where you can feed the cows with your hands and donate some money.must visit spot if you travelling to Ujjain.

Name: sandeeprchavda
Title: Below average
Review: This place is having 3 caves, one is for Bharathri, one is for gopichand. It is stinky and you can easily skip this, nothing sort of ancient cave, its like ancient rooms

Name: Ktishan Kant Lavania
Title: Amazing Place but not Maintained
Review: I visited this place with my mother, as the caves are down stares so my mother could not visited inside, here bhartrihari maharaj pray several years. Suffocation is there inside caves, Visit if you have time

Name: aangeltaurus
Title: Amazing
Review: This place is amazing there is two caves where bhartrihari maharaj pray several years. Not for senior citizens bcoz one cave is very deep to go downstairs and oxygen level is low.

Name: nik_0107
Title: Not Maintained
Review: The caves are in terrible condition and needs major repairs. Local cabs and auto drivers suggest these caves to increase the number of attractions they will show.

Name: Richs V
Title: Suffocating caves
Review: First of all they are not caves as I thought..they stinks a lot and you feel suffocated there.If you are short on time then dont visit it.

Name: Anjani S
Title: biggest dispointment
Review: this was the 7 places we were told to be visiting by our Auto driver. this is very smelly. cave is very small

Name: ivanand77
Title: Centuries Old Caves
Review: These caves as estimated to be 2500 years old and is dedicated to Raja Bhartrihari who was the elder brother of King Vikramaditya.  He was spiritually motivated and left the kingdom behind for his vrother vikramaditya and joined the Nath Sect.  He did his Tapasya in this very cave and it is believed that it consists a secret path that opens to char dham.

Name: Sunil R
Title: Not that big but average caves
Review: These caves are now partially closed by natural phenomena but they have long history inside . according to history of ujjain these caves have underground road to main city but now they are closed. read about King Bhartrihari before you visit here.

Name: chirag kothari
Title: Average Caves
Review: These caves are situated on banks of river. Here caves are not so great and seems like small house built out of cuuting rocks. One can enjoy these caves and there is lot of diety inside cave with shiv linga. Though camera is not allowed inside cave, people were taking pictures and selfie.

Name: sssdgn
Title: RAJA BHARTHARI MEDITATED HERE----
Review: It is said that king Bharthari became saint he meditated here,this is the tapsya sthali of Raja Bharthari,Gorakhnath and Matsyendranath,little out side from Ujjain city this place is for those who are interested in mythology as well religious attire --thanks---SSS----

Name: Bimal0401
Title: Preserved Historical site
Review: The Historical caves are  well maintained and kept very neat and clean. The place is less crowded. It will be a unique experience by visiting Bhartrihari (Brother of King Vikramadatya) caves. Do not miss to have masala butter milk near cave. it's great in taste. When at Ujjain, this place can be kept in mind with other locations of visit.

Name: Vijay
Title: Mind Your Head in Bhartrihari CAVES
Review: Place of historical visit. Located near Garhkalika Temple, It is believed King Vikramaditya's Step Brother Bhartrihari meditated here. If time permits, the place can be visited. A good Architectural site..

Name: Kingshuk P
Title: Lesser known but possibly the best historical place to visit
Review: Lesser known but possibly the best historical place to visit. It is really enjoying going to caves inside. You can feel less of oxygen but warm place. Nice experience to feel King Vikramaditya's time

Name: niya27
Title: Think twice before enter
Review: These caves will be covered if you have hired a toured auto, which will charge 300 - 400 INR and will take you 8-10 places. These caves are dark and inside the environment is too much humid. You will sweat profusely inside the caves.

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: Historic place
Review: Very old caves where holy saints did a lot of meditation . There is a story regarding King Bhrathari who was guided by Guru Gorakshanath and proved to him that all worldly possessions and relationships are futile . There is a very nice temple of Guru Gorakshanath as well . Very nice place

Name: Paraglider03
Title: Fake caves
Review: Only after you enter the so-called ancient caves, you notice you are constantly walking under a concrete slab. There is no authenticity to the structure. Definitely to be avoided.

Name: Maneesh12345
Title: 3 caves a must visit
Review: A must visit place in ujjain after Mahakaal jyotirlinga and kaalbhairav mandir. But please abide by the rules and don't use your camera or click pics inside the temple. awesome caves.. smells a little bad my be due to insufficient access of air and one may feel suffocated there,

Name: SatKD
Title: Only people who appreciate indian mythology
Review: Interesting place, next to Shipra river (no moving water). Lots of cows (kaamdhenu). Few caves (must be very calm during earlier days) which don't have proper ventilation. Nice temple. Climbing downstairs and coming back up gives feeling accomplishment.

Name: Swapnilg146
Title: Good one
Review: I visited Bhartrihari caves recently when I visited Ujjain. Not crowded and well managed. One must visit this place.

Name: Rathnam J
Title: I have visited and one must visit the caves
Review: It is worth seeing. Instead of looking at reviews I recommend to visit this place at leisure. you will enjoy

Name: Gary M
Title: A visit to the Bhartrihari caves of Ujjain
Review: I have been to this holy site on two occasions and had conversations with several Nath Yogis there, who were very generous in sharing stories about their life experiences.The Bhartrihari caves of Ujjain are situated on the eastern bank of Kshipra (Shipra) River, about 7 kilometres from Ujjain city. They are almost midway between the revered Maa Gadkalika Temple (600 metres) and Rinmukteshwar Mahadev Temple (400 metres). Named after the famous sage Bhartrihari, these caves are very popular with Hindu pilgrims and tourists alike. The Kshipra River passes close by, which adds to the natural beauty of the area.These caves are said to be where the philosopher-poet and former King Bhartrihari lived and meditated after renouncing his throne in favour of his younger brother, King Vikramaditya. Bhartrihari turned away from the material comforts of royal life and became an ascetic of the Nath Yogi sect on the advice of his Guru, Gorakshnath. It is believed that he did so because of a domestic intrigue involving his wife that caused him great despair and rendered him disgusted with the pleasures of this world.Gorakshnath was a renowned ascetic and founder of the Nath Yogi sect who instilled fearlessness in his devotees. He is revered all over Northern and Western India, and especially in Nepal where the famed and fearless Ghurkha soldiers honour him as their guiding light. Although Gorakshnath is traditionally regarded the foremost disciple of Matsyendranath ‚Äì claimed by Nath Yogis to be the first human Guru in their teaching succession ‚Äì Matsyendranath most probably preceded Gorakhnath by three centuries.Bhartrihari is remembered as a great scholar and renowned spiritual poet, known for his elegant Sanskrit prose, including Vairagyas‚Äôataka, Nitis‚Äôataka and Shringars‚Äôataka. His special predilection was towards the Hindu Trinity of Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva. According to the commentaries of prominent 19th century Indologist, Kashinath Trimbak Telang (1850‚Äì1893), Bhartrihari flourished towards the end of the 1st and the beginning of the 2nd centuries of the Christian era.There is a holy shrine in one of the caves for visitors belonging to the Nath community with effigies of Matsyendranath, Gorakshnath and Bhartrihari. Every year, thousands of tourists and pilgrims visit the place, some out of curiosity and others to pay homage to these three great Yogis. Nath Yogis also camp in tents in the surrounding area and can be seen sitting around their ritual fires.Some of the passages in the caves are very narrow and there is smell of incense and burnt wood inside. Visitors are not restricted from entering, but those who suffer from claustrophobia will not feel comfortable inside. There are also ascetics who still live in nearby caves and carry out their spiritual practices. There are also several refreshment houses and restaurants in the surrounding area. So, whether you are a pilgrim or just a curious tourist, it‚Äôs a great place to visit.

Name: Sunil K
Title: Its historical and famous cave Bhratihari had done Tapasya.
Review: Its very nice place for historian and those interested in archive of indian mythology.here Bhratihari,matsyendranath and baba Gorakhnath done tapasya.

Name: Nits90
Title: Temple with Caves
Review: The location of templenis beautiful. Outside the temple, Kshipra river flows and inside where there are idols is beautiful. There are 3 caves inside, one is closed for public now. There's too hot inside the caves and less oxygen but good thing is there's no queue for entering. One can go easily inside and came back same route.

Name: Ashok Kumar Agarwal
Title: Caves
Review: every body who visits Ujjain also visits here, but i didnot found any interest here, Under the caves when you enter problem of Oxygen is there, so think before entering in caves.

Name: Sunil K
Title: Very Intrusting ,Religious and Ancient Caves in Ujjain
Review: Very dark and down in earth cave no 1 and 2 is also very long and small. Still one baba in each cave making it belive that how in old time people were doing tapasya space like this. Very informative and peaceful location. Near a  Gaushala make it more Religious where you can feed grass to Cowes  and can spend spiritual time there.

Name: shivangm871
Title: Religious
Review: As I said during earlier review, you can cover the entire places nearby during one visit in UJJAIN. In summers, it is very hot. Do remember.

Name: Lalit Surjan
Title: A Philosopher King Lived Here
Review: The legend has it that King Bhartrihari lived in these two ancient caves for meditation after renouncing worldly power and comforts. A visitor may get a sense of history but there is nothing much to see. Moreover, the caves are now enveloped by a later day temple precinct of the Nath sect. The king was a philosopher and authored three books of verse namely Shringar Shatak, Vairagya Shatak and Neeti Shatak.

Name: sanjayvora45
Title: Ancient Caves
Review: Near to Gadkalika Temple, one has to descend some 50 step upto basement to reach this caves. It is said that step brother of Raja Vikramaditya had done a penance here.Small temple is located opp. to the caves. One can go inside caves but having strong foul odour.

Name: blacksteallion
Title: Beautiful Caves ... !!!
Review: This place is famous among locals as well as tourists. Local government has developed this well and is located in the remote location of the Ujjain city. Though it is around 10 km away from the city. There are two caves and a temple nearby and a good destination for religious shopping.

Name: Himanshu G
Title: Caves in the basement
Review: This place consists of two caves each of which is below ground level. It is a good place to visit specially if you are with young people as the caves are constricted and one may feel suffocation inside. A tough place to visit in summer. Good time to visit will be in morning.

Name: ShvRm_Traveller
Title: Caves associated with spiritualism
Review: These caves are popular landmark for pilgrims and tourist to visit. There are series of caves where some ascetics still live and carry out their spiritual practices. Some of the passages in the caves are very narrow and there is strong smell of burnt wood inside. The visitors are not restricted from entering the caves, but the caves are not among st the best maintained ones. Next to the caves, there is a small temple at slightly higher elevation. The temple and surroundings are well maintained.

Name: traveller_prk
Title: Intriguing historical place
Review: A very well visited and revered place by the locals and the religious people visiting Ujjain. The caves although are a little claustrophobic in certain parts so need to be careful.

Name: Phb0414
Title: for history lovers
Review: this place is very old and has historical importance.... though caves are not maintained properly but it shows beautiful architecture and skills of that age..

Name: ChennaiFocus
Title: Beautiful architecture maintained as is!
Review: Do not miss this cave and be ready to bend and walk through stone steps and small entrances. We can see the silhouette of the Great Bhartruhari and places where many sages have done penance.

Name: Rahul B
Title: Bhrathari cave is a Cocktail......
Review: The place is situated along the banks of Kshipra river. You can enjoy the view of natural landscape around the place. The place is of historical significance because king Bhrathari, elder brother of king vikramaditya, did intense penance in the cave for self realization. Thus, makes this place a perfect cocktail of history, spirituality and nature. A must visit place in Ujjain.

Name: Hardik_Agg
Title: Happy to go there
Review: There are 3-4 caves in the complex. One has to climb wide stairs which are very steep. When we enter the complex, there is stone cut architecture. The caves have organised rooms with Shiva and other temples. Please mind your head while entering into any cave. Also, it is very hot inside the caves. The caves inside have sculptures, Shivlinga and there is no proper lighting. The cold Chhachh is very soothing one which one can bought while climbing the stairs from the shops. Rishi Bhartrihari is said to have do tapasya here.

Name: Dharmendra S
Title: Bhartrihari Caves
Review: A very ancient place of worship not far from UjjainThe Caves are easily accessible and well keptYou can sit for sometime thou A nice place to visit Lots of Penance must have been done by Rishi's

Name: Santosh Marar
Title: Can avoid
Review: While this is caves are of historical importance there is nothing much to see, you will see lot of sadhus in the temple who shower blessing if you donate.

Name: EnigmaticIndia
Title: Mixed feelings
Review: As reviewed by fellow TAs, the caves were used by the step brother if king Vikramaditya, Bhartrihari (well in my childhood history I don't remember reading about him) for tapasya. The caves give you the feeling you are entering Something natural but then you see organized rooms,  shows craftsmanship during those days to prepare this place.The whole place can be inaccessible to elders and the differently abled. Also if you have breathing problems do take caution.Overall it's okay from my perspective to visit this place. Well on the positive side on the stairs at the entrance there is a lady selling "Jhal mudi " for INR 10 and it's one if the best I have had in many years

Name: priyankprudhvi
Title: Caves - typical old caves with modern eminities
Review: Very good caves with lord shiva temple and other temples, Ghosala with min 50 cows also available.. One should visit for the knowledge of the caves

Name: Sunil
Title: Nice Historic Place
Review: Historical caves located on the banks of river Kshipra. Caves are very narrow so please mind your head. Lights are equipped inside the caves. Bhartrihari, believed to be the step brother of Vikramaditya, meditated hereafter renouncing the worldly possessions. These caves are one of the best examples of natural caves.

Name: CNJ97
Title: Old caves
Review: This is the one of the site scene during ujjain trip. The place is old and said that Bhartrihari was meditate here. The caves are old but well maintained. Please do not visit caves if you afraid of darkness.

Name: raofca
Title: Nothing great
Review: Skippable. Can't say much about this. Two caves. Not very accessible for the elderly.  It is history meets museum meets archeology.

Name: Rahul
Title: Place of Historic Importance.
Review: Though located on the banks of polluted kshipra river (sad to see such a religiously important river in this bad shape) the caves are well maintained. Would not recommend it to people who are asthmatic or have phobia of dark spaces as the caves are underground with limited air and lighting.

Name: yogindery
Title: Bhartrihari Caves
Review: Bhartrihari Caves is also a very popular sight seeing place in ujjain. very attractive and religious sight seeing place where 'king bharthari' prey 'kathor tapasya' after his self realisation when rani pingla give 'bewafaai to his lover king'.

Name: Manish B
Title: Amazing Place
Review: These underground caves are one excellent place to visit/ Its said that brother of king vikramaditya meditated here and enlightened. Bhartrihari was one of the important historical figure and caves are one excellent place to see.

Name: Avidtraveller1514
Title: Surprised to see how deep inside the caves saints went for tapasya
Review: These caves are famous for deep down caves of Gopinath Ji! Make sure u r fine goin so down inside he caves! There is a lot of humidity and suffocation in there! Whe I came outside I felt like now I am in heaven haha

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: Average Attraction
Review: Whwn i visited here with the huge hope but not upto my wish. It looks very simple, no wonder attractive. Simplly time pass place.

Name: Kasi V
Title: Bhartrihari caves
Review: Definitely worth a visit. Well maintained and clean.However the caves are a little bit stuffy and it is recommended that in case of crowd, wait for the crowd to disperse before entering the caves especially cave no 2.

Name: Avinash_H
Title: Bharthari and Gorakhnath ji
Review: Bharthari was King of Ujjain and his guru was Gorakhnath.  Due to deceit by his queen, Bharthari became a sanyasi and became disciple of Gorakhnath.  In these caves, he did tapasya.  The caves are deep but well lit.  One just have to watch his head.

Name: KishoreMK
Title: Could be skipped..
Review: This is adjoining to another temple , so usually lists in the regular site seeing trips. During Simhasth kumbh mela, the caves were closed so nothing to see in there, but there is another temple in the same compound. Priests as usual arent interested much, even if u probe them with any questions., You wouldnt miss a thing by skipping this.

Name: Kunal Yadav
Title: Famous as Bharthari Gufa
Review: It's an Ancient cave .Famous as it is linked with the name of King Vikramaditya.As per sayings heard , From here King used to visit Char Dham temple through this cave which is underground.And once when earthquake came King has hold a part of ceiling where he was enchanting and stopped that part from breaking down.Hand prints are still visible there and anyone can check this.

Name: Naresh Prajapati
Title: Cave attach with History of King Bhartrihari
Review: Bhartrihari Cave is located in Ujjain which is 5-8 km from Mahakaleshwar temple.I visited this temple in my Ujjain tour. Its historical touch with king Bhartrihari Where is the king past his time in cave after join sadhu‚Äôs life.There is 40-50 step to down for cave. There is 2-3 floor in cave. First cave is big. Second cave is small compare to first. There is also problem of air. Place is not tourist place. Local auto & other vehicle available to visit this place & also other places.You can leave this place in Ujjain tourist place

Name: banjara_abhi
Title: Mystery Caves of King Bhartrihari
Review: Bhartrihari was the emperor of Ujjain dynasty and he used to do meditation in these caves. You will find here two caves and some Vikram Vetal significance also. Caves are quite narrow and you need to take care when you enter and exit. Lights are equipped inside the caves also. Though the photography not allowed inside the cave, but for you I just clicked one.

Name: Radha S
Title: Bharat hari caves
Review: The view is good. There are steps to get down. You will find monkeys on the way with their babes.  There is Kal bhairav temple but nothing more as the caves are small. Lot of work going on. You can feed cows.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Bhartrihari meditated here
Review: Bhartrihari and his nephew Gopichand are believed to have meditated in these caves. Bhartrihari is believed to have written the great works- Neethi shathakam, Vairagya shathakam and Shringara shatakam here. There are two caves here- Cave1 is the Bhartrihari cave where Bhartrihari meditated. This cave has idols of Kal Bhairav, Mahakali and Matsyendranath. Cave-2 is the cave where Gopichand meditated. At the far end of this cave is the Neelkanteshwar mahadev. Within the same complex is a newly constructed NavNath temple that has idol of Guru Gorakhnath enshrined. Nearby are the samdhi sthals of two saints from the Nath cult- Ganganath and Brihaspatinath.

Name: VidhyaMahadevan
Title: Met an interesting young priest boy in the caves
Review: The Bhartrihari caves are very intriguing. I had to climb down quite a few levels deep into the caves. The caves have bats hanging down, not much air circulation and hot. If your a size too big, you may have to think twice before entering.I met the most interesting young lad who is a priest. He spoke so charmingly well in English and hindi. What was more pleasing was his radiant face, happy, accepting of life, taking the world one day at a time. It calmed me down.

Name: Shashi Ranjjan Kalvaar
Title: City Tour
Review: The Caves r at the outskirts of Ujjain. A decent place but moreover it is a temple. It has been misunderstood as a cave because the idols are under ground n u need to move through sort of caves look alike. But a decent and peaceful place to visit. A bit suffocated for air as oxygen level comes down n is hot beneath the cave. At the outside of cave u can feed the cows with grass available with the local pundit. Our kids enjoyed a lot.

Name: aloksinghk11
Title: Amazing Experience
Review: Once you enter these caves you will feel you can not stay more than 10-15 minutes as the oxygen level is very very low and very hot ( at least in summer ) but it gives you very different experience.

Name: Anil Pal
Title: Amazing Caves
Review: I visited this caves on my Ujjain Tour Trip. The cave entry is very long. When u enter this you will feel less air in atmosphere. The experience is truly  amazing.

Name: pavrahi
Title: Caves from the old times
Review: The location is on the bank of river Shipra. You have to walk 400mts from main road. Not recommended for people not fit. The air inside the caves is very congested and humid.

Name: rakhsup
Title: Warm interiors
Review: These caves are near to a temple, which served as a meditating place for a sage. The interiors of the caves are warm and suitable to young adults and kids. Senior citizens may face difficulties accessing these caves as they're very narrow and inside.

Name: Vidyadhar S
Title: Bhartrihari Caves, Ujjain
Review: Ujjain city is very ancity of India. Kings Like Raja Vikramadity, Bhsrtihari are seen. Some different sects of Hindu religion are like Nath Panth.When we visit this place we have to come down with good number of steps. Then we have 2 caves to visit. where goddes idol is there .Wehave to go down in caves to see the place. But during afternoon it is suffocating there. In that premises on enice temple is there.Overall its nice experience.

Name: Ameet_Pathare
Title: Bhartrihari-reat scholar and a talented poet
Review: The caves are situated just above the banks of River Shipra near Gadhkalika Temple. The caves are famous as the place where the step brother of King Vikramaditya meditated.Entry of more people at a time can cause suffocation

Name: Darshan R
Title: Very peaceful place
Review: Nice place to visit and read the description written on a banner.Caves are very silent and peaceful when lower number of visitor are present. Enchanting place among all Ujjain local places.

Name: padmaja111
Title: Legend is more appealing than Caves !
Review: Raja Vikramaditya and Bhartrihari are well known through out the country. While Bhartrihari was doing penance ,in these caves , Indra wanted to disturb him , Lord Shiva protected him by keeping his hand over him. That hand is still seen on the upper portion of the cave !And BHARTRIHARI WENT ON TO BECOME A CELEBRATED POET AND HIS POEMS ARE STILL READ IN SANSKRIT AND OTHER INDIAN LANGUAGES .IT is an example to show that poet lives longer than the king, in people's memory.the caves can be reached after climbing more than  50 steps but the repairs and renovation work changed the ambience  ,so ,one feels it's lost its appeal and ancient charm.

Name: JAGDISH RAVAL
Title: Ancient Caves
Review: This is very old Caves and known as cave oBhartihari. Bhartihari was step brother of King Vikramaditya of Ujjain. Bhatuhari was also a Poet and a Scholar. He forsaked the pleasures of world and became a sadhu but before that it is believed he made Medidation(Sadhana) here.

Name: 99Bhupendra
Title: Quite old Bhartrihari caves
Review: The caves are quite old and deep. Be careful in getting down the caves. Also lots of monkeys near the cave wall which sometime attack so be careful. Also it gets quite uneasy to breathe inside the caves due to large crowd.

Name: Ketan27
Title: Old caves
Review: This is the place where Gopinath Maharaj used to stay and meditate, there are two caves next to each other with very narrow entrance and it is very dark inside. It is worth a visit

Name: SharmaPari
Title: Did not seem like natural caves
Review: The interiors were all man-made with concrete walls and steps and floor. I was expecting some natural stone caves but was utterly disappointed.TIP: since the entry and exit in the two caves is small and the interiors lack free flow of air, I would advise those with breathing issues to skip it.

Name: RajShar10
Title: Don't visit if you have breathing issues
Review: These are caves where, supposedly, King Bhrtrihari, brother of King Vikramaditya, lived after renouncing the world. There are two caves and the entrances are quite narrow. However, I could not find anything cave-like inside them as everything was man-made with concrete walls and pillars. Nothing like natural stone caves that I had imagined.

Name: Ankit Kapoor
Title: Raja Vikramaditya Temple
Review: This is a temple dedicated to Raja Vikramaditya. It comprises of statues of Vikramaditya's court members and a huge Vikramaditya Idol.

Name: Gdj
Title: King vikramaditya tilla
Review: There is big statue of famous king vikramaditya king.teela is presented at center on rudra sagar near to mahakal temple.

Name: Sivakumar V
Title: A Beautiful Temple for the Great Emperor, Vikramathithya
Review: In heart of the town of Ujjain is an open temple for the Great King Vikramadhithya. A huge statue of the king is the centre of attraction. The path leading to the temple is broad and beautiful. The king's statue is surrrounded by the seats of his ministers. A good layout and a must-see in Ujjain. A central durbar like appearance is awesome. A statue of the Great Poet Kalidoss with an idol of  Kalima completes the settings of the yore.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Memorial of king of ujjain..Maharaja Vikramaditya
Review: Its a memorial and worship place devoted to Maharaja vikramaditya ( a very famous king of india ) famous for his decision taking ability and fare practices . there are lot of famous stories you can find over net and one of the epic story  series is Vikarm Baitaal story.  You can find a big bronze color sculpture of maharaja vikramaditya over there and small sculpture of her 32 maharanis ( another famous story is simhasan battisi ) . if you are history lover a must place to visit.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Vikramaditya
Review: Vikramaditya is nice and well maintained place. it is constructed in a huge area. and it is all about king Vikramaditya.

Name: smandal2858
Title: Vikramaditya Tila
Review: Around 500 mtr from Mahakaleshwar temple. The place helps you to know about the great king Vikramaditya. Well maintained. You can see the 32 doll and their story about Vikramaditya with board and statue.

Name: Yogesh L
Title: Beautiful
Review: Nice place reminding the Avantika time of Raja Vikramaditya who ruled Ujjain for decades. Nice place to visit with family - well maintained.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Dedicated to vikramaditya
Review: The place is dedicated to the king vikramaditya, and the place is still well maintained. We didn't visit all over but as far as i know it's quite good

Name: Ashish Gupta
Title: Vikramaditya The Greatest
Review: situated next to bank of Shipra and opposite to Mahakaal Temple.Here you can see Shila where King used to sit. A big sculpture of Vikramaditya is also present. You can see History here.

Name: Nagendra Nayak
Title: Vikram aditya the great
Review: As far as I am concerned, this was the best part of Ujjain tour. There is a big elegant sculpting of vikram aditya and other important characters are also there. Kalidasa, Dhan want sri etc. Also Idols of beautiful women. For those who know, it is pretty exciting. It is a befitting tribute to the great king.

Name: Atul Shah
Title: the throne of king vikramaditya
Review: very nicely made memorial for king Vikramaditya and his 32 dancing dasmels . a vetaal is on the side as well. other murals of his regime. nice art work

Name: Sunnilbgautam
Title: Interesting Historical piece of art
Review: This belongs to Vikramaditya the great king of Avantika. Its a must visit for its historical, educational importance. It has a display of a huge statue of Vikramaditya along with his Navratnas (9 key Court Members). Interesting stories are put up on pillars at the surrounding walk along with statues of 32 Putlies (lady guardians to the throne).

Name: Viral Arya
Title: Very Good place dedicated to Indian King Vikramaditya
Review: A Memorial dedicated Indian King Vikramaditya, located at at Vikram Teela behind Mahakal Temple. The centre attraction of the place is 30 feet brass made statue of King Vikramaditya. This premises also have various other brass made sculptors.

Name: AnshumanMaini
Title: Such a pity
Review: There is a 10 rs ticket, we went inside but no guide and without a guide we can't understand the functioning of different apparatus/dials used there. They said no guide during covid times. We came back disappointed but will still recommend because I like such places with scientific inclination and it's good for all.

Name: Pramod1953
Title: Astronomical Interest
Review: this was built by King of Jaipur - Raja Man Singh. He had deep interest in Astronomy. The structures are for tracking of time, position of planets and many things of astronomical interest.

Name: Gdj
Title: Jantar mantar ujjain
Review: This is also called vaidhshala.very popular tourism destination in ujjain.there provide information about how decide time in ancient time.

Name: Sunnilbgautam
Title: Jantar Mantar Ujjain
Review: This place is must visit for children and people interested in astronomy and geo science. This is also called vedh Shala, Observatory. This observatory work on movement of sun.

Name: Gdj
Title: Jantar mantar ujjain
Review: I like to visit this type of place. Description about solar syatem is deacent and unique. Time watec is amazing

Name: vroy29
Title: Jantar mantar
Review: A historical monument which is very well maintained . Guide also extremely knowledgeable. A must for anyone visiting Ujjain

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Experience the Historical observatory.
Review: Its a very good place for school kids and for everyone who is interested in geo science , various scientific instruments which runs on direction or movement of sun and other planets situated there .The architectural marvel Jantar Mantar (also called the Vedh Shala Observatory), established in the 17th century is the oldest to be constructed among the group of five observatories ( Jaipur, Delhi, Ujjain, Mathura, and Varanasi).

Name: Gdj
Title: Jantar mantar vaidhshala ujjain
Review: This in very old vaidhshala establishe by king jaysingh.here described infoemation of our universe in 3d animation very effectively.

Name: trivediar
Title: Amazingly structured
Review: What an idea by creating the structure by which one can identify the exact time. Marvelous and hats of to the ideology.

Name: Dipteshrao
Title: Disappointed
Review: I came to see and learn about the observatory but as I reached one man was there who was giving the ticket for observatory and no one was there to assist or to show the things Disappointed for the approach of observatory

Name: rathod2017
Title: Jantar Mantar
Review: The architectural marvel Jantar Mantar (also called the Vedh Shala Observatory), established in the 17th century is the oldest to be constructed among the group of five observatories ( Jaipur, Delhi, Ujjain, Mathura, and Varanasi).

Name: RanjithKumarPrabhu
Title: Observatory
Review: Among the five Jantar mantars. this is the only one which is still used to make Panchang. It was established by Raja Jaisingh in 1725 considering the passage of the tropic of cancer through the place. There are some instruments or dials, namely Samrat Yantra, Sun Dial, Niyati Chakra, Shanku yantra etc to measure the movement of celestial bodies. The boards briefly explain all the instruments, there are also local guides to explain in detail.

Name: smandal2858
Title: Jantar Mantar
Review: The attraction is must see place in Ujjain. Tourists are less. Maintenance is not up to mark. The place helps us about the how the length of day and night are increasing and decreasing according to months.

Name: Vishnu Pendyala
Title: Similar to the Jantar Mantars in other cities
Review: The attraction at Ujjain may have special significance since it is located on the tropic of cancer. There's a huge globe, so you can take pictures in front of it.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Observatory in ujjain
Review: This is one of the 4 observatories in India and visiting the place around noon is well worth we were told. Even though this is small when compared with others, can have a great feel around the place.

Name: Namjoshi
Title: Jantar Mantar
Review: This was built by Raja Jaising in 17th century after observation of sky for so many years. Madhavrao Sindia restarted this as it was close about 150 to 200 years. Now maintenance of this place is not good. very few tourist visit here.

Name: Yash
Title: Vedh Shala
Review: Interesting place with historical importance, since Ujjain is called the Greenwich of India. There are various instruments in the observatory, and the telescope show is also recommended

Name: arunbvkumar
Title: observation of the observatory
Review: Ujjain known as Greenwhich of India and Jantar Mantar is the only ancient observatory where the research being carried out till today. It has different yantras such as Samrat Yantra/Sun dial/Niyati Chakra. etc.

Name: Omkar P
Title: VISIT TO JANTAR MANTAR
Review: This jantar mantar is made in 1719 means before 300 years and it is showing time by made of wall and the shadow of wall . It is soaccurate that no once can believe. This was made by the king of that time. (name is not told by guide).

Name: Pal C
Title: Historical trip
Review: I visited with my family and really admire the Historical tour and amaze to see how much tecnology was advance in oldendayes in Ujjain(India).My kids grow up in UK so they lurn alot about Indian History.We visited to one another place in Ujjain which is not found in this web is Taramandal Ujjain. The show was Excellent . I have seen the same kind of show in U.K.(National Space Centre Leicester). I was amazed to see same kind of show in Ujjain .My kids enjoyed it.I highly recommend this show. I think more kids from school should visit for this show as this is very educational and informative. This is very reasonable and the best thing is this is free for student. I must say on this platform that this is the best work have been done by M.P. government so far I have seen.

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Brilliant
Review: I went to Jantar Mantar. Several data including the study of planetary motions get published every year. Jantar Mantar indeed is a work of intelligence which undoubtedly has brought grandeur to the Indian Architectural works. It is great place to go.

Name: Akhil P
Title: Vast knowledge of Hindu Culture
Review: you will be able to thousands year back how Hindu culture was advanced. Its match the same time which we see today in our watch. you can see the IST by just seeing the shadow of sunlight.

Name: sandeeprchavda
Title: Must visit
Review: Must visit, but it is very difficult to interpret the calculations happing there, still we can feel how our ancestors were consious about science.

Name: Achal
Title: Amazed how rich our culture is.
Review: Visited the place after long, amazed to learn how accurate the calculation were designed using simple tools and instruments, time calculation to nearest seconds, positions of starts and planets, star gazing with simple structure, all in working, a must visit place for young and old.Located on the bank of river Kshipra. The GMT of east and 0 maredian for world in olden days

Name: Vidhi_sharmah
Title: amazing stuff
Review: like all other jantar mantar this one also left me amazed by the end like how did people build this with so limited access to science and technology

Name: nik_0107
Title: Smaller but good
Review: Jantar Mantar is one of the several Jantar Mantar in India though the one at Ujjain is relatively a smaller version. Nothing exceptional to see.

Name: SatKD
Title: One of the five Jantar Mantar
Review: Decent. If you have never been to any, you must visit here. Sun dial is cool and simple to understand but other Jantar (Yantra - machines) are for astronomers. There is a small planetarium inside and may be good add on to your visit.

Name: Akhil
Title: Sort of Good place to visit!
Review: Wel the place is good. Wish there was a guide who could explain a little bit in clarity.There was a priests who explained to us the meaning of different instruments but that was not sufficient. Nevertheless do visit as there is a modest fee of Rs 10 for adults.

Name: Kawaljeet Singh
Title: small model of jantar mantar
Review: Its a garden with small models of wonders.good place for children to enjoy with learning some science

Name: Masayoshi
Title: Small version of the others
Review: I have visited Jantar Mantar in Jaipur and Delhi. They are larger.But, smaller does not mean less valuable.This place has the history and meanings.So, by having imagination, you can enjoy more.Look at the sun above your head in summer. It's observed with these large devices.Also the river behind looks nice

Name: blacksteallion
Title: Beautiful ... Architecture ... Amazing ... :)
Review: This place is all about engineering of Indian ancient people... it is also like mini version of Jantar-Mantar of Delhi. There is a nice light show of the sky and stars which is a must see. Nice photographic scenery and is located in a little remote location.

Name: Phb0414
Title: Science behind time
Review: This place is my favourite since childhood... wonders me.. how intelligently everything is created to know the time and planetary observations and date... its one of the five jantar mantars in India... must place to visit when in ujjain....

Name: tripfreak54
Title: Greenwich of India!
Review: Also known as Ujjain Ved Shala was simply breathtaking is an observatory with complex design that gives details about the distance of moon and sun from the axis of earth. Ujjain was the centre of Astronomy and Astrology in ancient India. The calendar of North India or Panchang is based on the calculations made at Ujjain.The historical city of Ujjain is considered the Greenwich of India due to the fact that the first meridian of longitude passes through it.

Name: Chetan Shroff
Title: Old heritage
Review: We visited this place when I came for a marriage. There are 5 equipment/ structures. There was an unofficial guide who explained the whole place and we gave him a small trip. I was happy to see how we were far ahead in science. This place is not far from city. Also there is aa 30 minutes show which we found interesting. Ticket cost is Rs 20

Name: Santosh Marar
Title: Recommend if you have not visited other Jantar Mantar
Review: Built in 1730 the though process used by people of that time are commendable.Recommended for astronomical studies

Name: CNJ97
Title: Understanding Day time of 17th Century.
Review: This is the place offered during local site scene in Ujjain Trip. This monument was build during 17th century by Raja Jaisingh. This is one of the five places in India. If didn't visited any Jantar Mantar then u can visit there.

Name: Manish B
Title: Observatory
Review: The Observatory also known as Vedh Shala in Hindi is an excellent example of ancient system to calculate time, planter y positions etc. Build buy Savai Raja JaySingh between 1725 and 1730 AD. Excellent place to visit.

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: Nice Place
Review: Amazing view here for all tourists. A little way from the city is one of the five observatories built by Raja Jaisingh of Jaipur. It is still functional.

Name: guptaashok_0511
Title: Good place
Review: One of the well preserved place. Used for astronomical studies in ancient times. It is similar to other Jantar Mantar. Locally it is known as Vedhshala

Name: simham
Title: A majestic astronomical structure of 1700s
Review: Built by Raja Jaisingh, who later constructed Jantar mantar at Varanasi, Delhi & Jaipur also in 1758 or so, it is the pinnacle of Astronomical Structure anywhere in the world. His knowledge and the fact the Tropic of Cancer passes through this City (this point) makes this all the more significant.The movement of not only Sun or moon but all the Nine planets and placement of Palnets makes this place unique. Ephemeries are worked out at this Ved Shala & used in all Indian Panchangams

Name: DocMehta
Title: Proud of our Past
Review: A little way from the city is one of the five observatories built by Raja Jaisingh of Jaipur. It is still functional.I could compare my watch time with time shown on Sun Dial instrument (see photo). There is one more instrument that also shows time and that time also compared well.How did my ancestors design such instruments, about 200 years back?While instrument areas (total five) are clean, and each instrument has an explanation board; rest of the compound is not well maintained, especially toilets were dirty.There is small entrance fee.

Name: Bharatbackpacker
Title: No different from other Jantar Mantars
Review: I was very excited before visiting this observatory as it is listed as a functioning observatory. However, the functioning is just people noting down the values. It is no different from other Jantar Mantars and possibly the smallest of them all. If you have not seen the other Jantar Mantars (Jaipur, Delhi) then definitely do visit.

Name: road2parin
Title: Sun temple where you can check your timings based on shadow
Review: If you want to see how intelligent our ancestors were, check out this architecture and get a guide. Based on the sun's shadow, there are different markings and you can actually read the time. Must visit place in Ujjain

Name: sharmasanchit32
Title: Interesting for those who wanna learn time reading without a watch.
Review: Small however knowledgeable time instrument. You can learn how to read/guess time with the help of sun. However no sun no shadows to help understand this huge historic instrument.

Name: PinakK
Title: An experience to have
Review: Jantar Mantar is the place to visit during the trip to Ujjain. It arguably exhibits simplest of all the instruments which helps one understand the hindu calendar.

Name: Irina F
Title: One of the oldest observatory in India
Review: Nice small observatory with some interesting medieval astronomic instruments. The setting is charming - a nice garden next to the quiet river. It's better to have someone who can explain you about the way they used all those instruments :)

Name: SrinivasaB2015
Title: Indian Scientific Knowledge on display
Review: Place is only for those with an interest in science, maths and astronomy. Ensure that you catch a right guide who doesn't mixes astronomy with astrology or with our Puranasa. It is basically a Laboratory.

Name: VaranasiDayTours
Title: Must visit
Review: This is one of the five observatory in India. Massive sundaial is accurate to 20 seconds and is the largest sundial in the world. We can understand how the longitudes and latitudes cross here. There  are a number of other exhibits as well -- for each of the signs of the zodiac.

Name: rahulgautam
Title: the observatory
Review: good place for children to understand how the longitudes and latitudes cross madhya pradesh. there is a fee for this attraction but for children this is a great place

Name: ScubaDiverRick
Title: Worth the stop
Review: Enroute from Jaipur to Agra, stop in to see the observatory.  Massive sundaial is accurate to 20 seconds and is the largest sundial in the world.  There are a number of other exhibits as well -- for each of the signs of the zodiac, however the observatory was my highlight.  It's worth a quick stop.

Name: mayaKasaragod
Title: This science museum requires some improvement
Review: This open Museum where sun dial and Jantar Mantar is constructed.Should be visited in Ujjain. But for foreign tourists there is no guide who knows English. And even our guide was not able to explain the machine which could measure the distance between stars and this simple machine is not maintained well.This place is having rare collection and needs good guides. Better to train the existing guides.

Name: VivekRastogi
Title: One of the best among four in India
Review: I must say this Jantar Mantar is One of the best among four in India, This is well maintained and who is interested in Astrology or calculating time, they must visit Jantar Mantar of Ujjain. You can guide for the Jantar Manar at the location itself.

Name: nkjain_pune
Title: Visit to Jantar Mantar, Ujjain
Review: This place is one of the old places where Astrlogy was practiced based on the positions of various planets. Mande by a King called Maharaja Sawai Singh, almost more than 300 years back. various Yantras or monuments are located within the campus to predict / calculate postion of planets. There are sun dials and monuments indicating sunrise and sunset timing. Wirth visiting for people having interest in historical monuments.

Name: Ketan27
Title: A must visit place
Review: This is the place which should not be missed even if you are not intended in Astronomy, Sky, Space or measurements or time. I feel very proud to visit this place and it shows the capabilities of Indian mind, who during that period of time could think and built these structures.

Name: Charles W
Title: Interesting
Review: This is one of the observatories set up by Raja Jai Singh. The site is very compact. The guide will explain how the different pieces are used to tell time and the position of the stars. Ujjain is India's Greenwich as it is on the first meridian of longitude for Hindu geographers.

Name: blur2clear
Title: Good place to visit and learn
Review: The place looks forlorn as pilgrims don't bother much, but we went there out of interest. The observatory setup by Raja Jai Singh, is very interesting, if you have interest and understanding of  basic geography.
