There is a local person in charge who explains basic calculations and in a very interesting manner. The place makes one feel proud of our scientific knowledge so many years ago

Name: KASI VENKOBA RAO
Title: Jantar Mantar@Ujjain
Review: In  India,there are five Jantar Mantars in total, located in Delhi, Jaipur, Ujjain, Mathura and Varanasi.The purpose of the  instrument (Jantar Mantar) located at this place is  to measure the time of day, correct to half a second and declination of the Sun and the other heavenly bodies. The Guide at this place, explains in detail, the working of the Sundial and how the time can be calculated with the instrument.  Its very scientific and interesting to know the details.J

Name: Yogesh2801
Title: Vedha Shala or the Observatory
Review: Vedh Shala, locally known as Jantar Mantar, is an observatory built in  the 17th century by Raja Jai Singh. Similar observatories are at Jaipur and Delhi etc.

Name: Shaileshbharal
Title: Place of importance but neglected by administration
Review: This place is among few in country.In old days this place was significant for most of the astrologer in calculating abot planets.But such an ancient and important place is not given importance by administration

Name: Rajat Kulshrestha
Title: SMALLER SIBLING OF THE ONES IN  DELHI AND JAIPUR
Review: One of the lesser known attractions of the city,it is an observatory built by the usual suspect-Sawai Jaisingh of Jaipur when he was the governor of Malwa.It was renovated by the Scindias in the 20th century.It has the same set of instruments as one finds in Jaipur,but on a much smaller scale.It stands on the bank of Shipra river,and that is one of its USP,you can have a spellbinding view of the river.Visit it during rainy season.The place is cleean and the river is beautiful.

Name: tvdsuccess
Title: Well preserved structure
Review: We were impressed by the fact that the structure was so well preserved. I understand that this is the oldest Jantar Mantar of the 4-5 in India. Take a guide to really appreciate this place better.

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Devotional Tree with great history
Review: Siddhavat is located on the banks of Kshipra river. Siddhavat is known for rituals and tarpans across the country. As per Hindu puranas, there are four important banyan trees in this world.Siddhavat of ujjain is also famous for its purity like Akshayavat of Prayag, Boudhvat at Gaya and Vanshivat of Mathura Vrundavan.There is a huge Banyan tree at Siddhavat. It is believed that this tree was planted by Maa Parvathi herself. There is Shiva temple is situated here which is called as PAtaleshwar temple. According to the believes lord Rama did the tarpan of his father king Dasharatha here.It is believed that worship is done here to get three kinds of accomplishments like progeny, property and good luck. Apart from this, rituals are performed for the ancestors here.Mughals tried to destroy this Baniyan tree many times but not succeded as this was planted by maa Parvati

Name: AmulAwasthy
Title: One of the Five VAT Trees
Review: Siddhwat Ujjain is one of the five VAT Trees in India. It Holds a significance importance and considered as age old tree. It also has a mention in VIKRAM VETAAL Stories. 4-5 Km from Mahakaleshwar temple this is easily reachable from Shared Auto or Taxi.

Name: abkush
Title: Vetaal used to reside on this tree
Review: This is the vata vriksha (banyan tree) on which vetaal use to reside!!!.It is situated in a temple complex, situated some 5 kms away from Mahakaleshwar Temple.Easily accessible by rikshaws and autos you will find near Mahakaleshwar temple.Temple is situated on the banks of river Kshipra.Nice to know and see that the tree from Vikram Vetaal stories (considered to) exists.

Name: Gdj
Title: Siddhavata temple
Review: Most famous temple in bhairugad area of ujjain on bank of shipra river.big banyan tree there for pooja.

Name: vinay760
Title: Visiting Ujjain and near by places
Review: Must read history while visiting Siddhavat and it is amazing history to understand and learn, Beautiful place near river , nice view,   Govt needs to focus on temples renovation, quality and upkeep of imp historical places and make it fine experience to visit and keep visiting.

Name: Sivakumar V
Title: A place in Ujjain to perform rituals
Review: The Siddhavat temple on the banks of the river Hshipra is about 4 Km from the centre of the city of Ujjain. The vast temple with the huge and revered Banyan tree is considered to be as old and as holy as the Akshayavat in Gaya. People perform rituals to theie departed near and dear. The rituals are observed in all sincerity by the priests of the temple. A solemn place where everyone pays homage to the departed souls.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: A spitiaul banyan tree
Review: Devotees visited this place to perform pooja on various hindu festivals , its a big banyan tree famous for spiritual rituals . as per name Siddhavat ( Siddha means pure or tasted ) & Vat means tree. A tree spreads positive vibes.

Name: Gdj
Title: Siddhavat temple ujjain
Review: Temple situated at shipra river.at that campus people do tarpan pooja for there pitrus.this temple has tree and most importance to do milk pooja ot that tree.

Name: trivediar
Title: Very Nice
Review: Very Nice temple. We went there in April 2019. Atmosphere is hot during summer here so light color clothes are advisable.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Siddhavat
Review: Siddhavat is located near the bank of shipra river. so many temples are near to bank of shipra river but this one is a huge banyan tree and people came here for pooja and havans.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Place for ritual
Review: This is a place along the banks of river shipra  similar to the one in gaya where one can perform last rituals for their ancestors.

Name: babita13
Title: Old temple
Review: This it on the bank of river kshipra, this tree is said to be planted by Mata Parvati. Lots of poojas going around the ghat near by. Many priests are sitting before the temple and have records of peoples families

Name: Nagendra Nayak
Title: Ujjain. Siddhavat
Review: I thought this was the setting for vikram and metal story. It is a chopped tree and a sacred place. I was not delighted. Can see just because of the story associated with it.

Name: Payal G
Title: Vikram Betaal
Review: The temple is built around an ancient banyan tree that is said to the tree in the popular folklore of Vikram and Betaal. Ask the priest to tell the real story of Betaal which is totally different from the popular television and comic stories showing him hanging on King Vikramaditya's back asking him riddles (won't spoil the story).The tree is a wish tree with thousands of wish threads tied to it. Worship for ancestors is done on the ghat next to the tree.Another unique thing that must be noted on the left before entering the temple is the place of the record keepers. These books called Bahi-Khatas record information of visitors dating back centuries including family trees. Do check if known ancestors had visited the place (precise place of origin has to be mentioned as books are filed as per location and then caste and surname). This is an ancient way of maintaining records which is particularly helpful in keeping track of deaths and births before government certificates came about (the person showing us the books bragged about how even the Supreme Court accepts these as evidence üôÑü§î). Overall a different experience.

Name: KeshavRaina
Title: Mid size temple with ancient history
Review: Its a mid size temple, known for a sacred historic banyan tree, located on bank of Shipra River. The maintainence is very poor and very unclean, but there is a lot of crowd.

Name: Viral Arya
Title: Temple of Historic Sacred Banyan Tree
Review: It is a temple of sacred Banyan Tree. As described in Varahpuran, Ghuddhavtaa in Soron Shookar Kshetra, Akshyavat in Pryag, Panchvat in Nasik, Vanshivat in Vrindavan, Gayavat in Gaya and sacred Siddhavat in Ujjain. As per famous stories, it is said that the Mughal rulers cut the banyan tree and covered the entire area with iron sheets to restrict the growth of the tree. But, this sacred tree pierced the iron sheets and flourished significantly.

Name: sandeeprchavda
Title: Visit to see ancient tree
Review: As per legends tree was planted by Godess Parvati, also it is believed that offering raw milk to tree will be giving peace to our ancestors

Name: Ktishan Kant Lavania
Title: Historic Tree Temple
Review: Visited this temple with my mother, This it on the bank of river kshipra, this tree is said to be planted by Mata Parvati.

Name: UmaBG
Title: It's temple of tree.
Review: Siddhavat is actually a tree prayed is believed that mata parvati planted. Locals has belief that your all wishes gets fulfill here. Very nice place to visit. Deep aarti is also good.

Name: nik_0107
Title: Historic Tree
Review: Siddhavat tree is said to be planted by Mata Parvati. It is a banayan tree where people offer puja/milk.

Name: Bimal0401
Title: Vatavrukha
Review: It is said that the tree is planted by Mata Parvati. The holy banyan Tree is very very old but needs attention by the authority as there is a mesh near the tree. Due to performing various rituals i.e. Tarpan etc. entire vicinity requires cleanliness. Anyway, recommended to visit when at Ujjain.

Name: Vijaykumar Sharma
Title: PERFORM KAAL SARP DOSHA POOJA AT SIDDH VAT
Review: As per Shiv Puran, when Lord Shiva established his form of Mahakaleshwar at Ujjain - his Gan, pret bhoot and army personnels prayed to him to create a place where even they found respect and were offered prayers. Lord Shiva directed them to this place now called Siddh Vat and stated that any person performing Pooja for their Pitra ( Atma or soul of ancestors who have left their bodies - are dead) will be praying to you and his prayers will be successful.Prayers to Pitru , for Pitru dosha nivaran include the Kaal Sarp dosha pooja.Another spot for Kaal Sarp dosha pooja at Ujjain is the RAM GHAT where Lord Ram performed the Tarpan rites upon death of his father.

Name: yogindery
Title: Siddhavat
Review: Siddhavat tree plants mata parvati ji and very holy and old tree situated near shipra river we visited there and prey during our ujjain trip, different type of hindus pray in this place.You can spend hours here in meditation and pray and relux.

Name: Sunil K
Title: This  vat tree was being planted by Maa Parvati
Review: This tree is one of the oldest tree in India. the Sidhavat is located on bank of Shipra River.As said that this tree was planted by maa parvati.

Name: Sunil K
Title: Siddhavat the banyan tree on the bank of Kshipra bank
Review: its saying that Maa Parvati has planted it. the area is very Religious and for different karm kand people come here to clear their old dues. Very simple but ancient tree and many story belogs to this place. Just go there and feel the change in you.

Name: Dr K K S
Title: Serene bank of pious Kshipra river
Review: Very old banyan tree with mythological significance. The tree needs preservation. Pls avoid offering milk, its harmful to the tree. Its customary to feed fish here. You can take a dip into the holy river, but be very careful if you are not a swimmer. You can spend hours here in meditation ... its a sure shot stress buster.

Name: Dimple K
Title: A divine experience in an unclean environment
Review: This is such a divine place... I believe it's also called the Vaikunth dwaar... I sincerely wish that the government takes appropriate steps to clean this temple... It's got such a golden mythology attached to it... But not all well organized... Or clean... Sad!!!

Name: ChennaiFocus
Title: Siddhavat - A Banyan Tree of Holy Significnce
Review: Siddhavat is a place along the Holy Kshipra river where a banyan tree supposedly planted by Parvati Devi is seen. Ujjain itself is a holy city of underground spiritual wealth - Temples everywhere seen and unseen. Do visit the Patal Lingam amidst the complex - it is holier than what you can see anywhere nearby.

Name: CNJ97
Title: Holy place
Review: This is one the place where puja of Kalsarpa and Shrad is done here.  If you are mythological then must visit this place during your visit.

Name: Harish S
Title: Lots of heritage here
Review: Vikramaditya, Parvati, Kartikeya. There are lots of heritage here. Vikraaditya got over the vetal here. Godess Parvati planted a banyan tree that still exists here and is a temple now. Kartikeya won over a demon here.

Name: PATHAKMumbai
Title: The best place to repay the 3 debts (‡§¶‡•á‡§µ ‡§ã‡§£, ‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡•É ‡§ã‡§£, ‡§ã‡§∑‡§ø ‡§ã‡§£) and to get rid of Kaal Sarpa dosh
Review: In the first sight, Siddhvat situated beside Shipra river in Ujjain appears to be a dead place. However, Hindu mythology describes it as the best place on the earth to get rid of the three debts (‡§¶‡•á‡§µ ‡§ã‡§£, ‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡•É ‡§ã‡§£, ‡§ã‡§∑‡§ø ‡§ã‡§£) and Kaal Sarpa dosh. I went their for my son, whose horoscope had kaal sarp dosh. He was very arrogant, impolite and irresponsible till the age of 15 years. Just after performing Tripindi, Narayan Bali and Kaal Sarp dosh nivaran pooja, I saw a drastic change in his personality. Now all my relatives and friends give his example to their sons and daughters. I feel proud of my son now. We had become hopeless about his studies, but after all the poojas performed at Siddhvat, he became studious and competed in all engineering entrance exams including IIT Mains. He is now studying engineering in Manipal and is among the best students of his batch. All glories to Mahakaal !

Name: Manish B
Title: Divine Atmosphere
Review: The temple is at the bank of river kshripra and very old temple. The place is said to be the place where goddess parvati had same and since than the place is worshipped. People take holy dip at the river bank and perform ritual.

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: Nice Place
Review: I visited with my family. This place is famous for perming kal sarpa puja and pitr dosh. This place has a significance in Indian mythology. It is connected to "Vikram aur Betaal".

Name: Yogesh S
Title: Perfomed puja at Sidhvat
Review: This place is famous for perming kal sarpa puja and pitr dosh. It is recommended to have prior appointment with trustworthy preist as some time they ask for more money. one should be fix amount so that there is no problems afterwards.

Name: banjara_abhi
Title: Place to tribute your loved ones
Review: This place is famous to do after death formalities. People come here and do pind donation. You will find this place bit crowed as compared to other places. People sits in line and have there hairs removed and do some mantrocharans and say their parents to rest in peace.

Name: perplexed_soul
Title: Mythological significance
Review: This place has a significance in Indian mythology. It is connected to "Vikram aur Betaal". Lately this place has been frequented by a lot of people.

Name: pradeep_parhi
Title: Siddhavat - considered as a holy place
Review: We had visited Siddhavat on 21/10/2015. It is situated at the bank of river Sipra. There is a banyan tree here. It is considered as a holy place. Generally people come here to offer "pind daan" to their forefathers and relatives who have died. There are many priests to perform the pind karma. People take bath in the river at the bank and then perform puja. The river bank is very dirty, unhygienic. There is a big parking place here. There are also some eateries where one can take poha, kachori and other snacks item.

Name: rbs02
Title: "Pitro ko Aamantran "
Review: The holy Tree called "Vat" and the temple is called "Siddhvat" . Before marriage we performed Pooja and invited our ancestors to bless us.

Name: rakhsup
Title: Vikram aur Betaal
Review: The "Vat" tree which is worshipped here is famous as, its the same tree where King Vikramaditya is said to have interacted with the Betaal who was residing on the tree and used to tell the king a story.

Name: Anil Pal
Title: Regious banyan Tree
Review: iddhavat is an old Banyan tree on the banks of Shipra river and has a great religious importance. Pilgrims take a dip in the Shipra river. This place was also a popular worshipping place of Nath sect. Long ago Moghul rulers cut off the Banian tree and covered the whole area with iron sheet to prevent its growth. But this tree pierced the iron sheet and flourished wonderfully. So a temple was built and this tree is worshipped with great reverence.

Name: Rahulg31
Title: Perform Puja's Here
Review: A Place where all Pooja's Take place, You are visiting Ujjain for some pooja, this is the place, Siddhavat is a Tree which doesn't increase a inch, neither decrease a inch.

Name: aloksinghk11
Title: Holy Place Siddhavat
Review: The holy place for hindu pilgrim is Siddhavat of Ujjain, it is located near river Shipra. This place is also famous for absolution of kalsarpyog ( informed by locals).

Name: ankan146
Title: very rare -sidhavat
Review: on the banks of shipra . very old sidha vat tree is here. worship and offer milk to get blessings. , priests are there to helpoffer prayers.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Connected with the Vikram-Betal (Ghost) legend
Review: Siddhavat, banyan tree on banks of river Shipra is worshipped in form of temple. It has the same religious sanctity as Akshayavat in Prayag and Gaya, Vanshivat of Vrindavan and Panchavata of Nasik. According to Skanda Purana Paravati performed penance and planted this tree. Shiv and Parvati‚Äôs son Kartikeya is believed to have killed demon Tarakasur under this tree. This story finds place in Kalidas‚Äôs celebrated work Kumarasambhava. King Vikramaditya is supposed to have meditated here for magical powers to control the ghost (Betaal). King Ashoka‚Äôs son Mahendra and daughter Sanghamitra embarked on journey to spread Buddhism after offering their prayers here. Other than the temple at Nasik, this is the only temple in the country where special puja is done for those who have Kal sarp dosh

Name: all4uArnab
Title: ancient place
Review: This is the place as the myths tell about King Vikramaditya and vetala. People who wish to do their rituals of ancestors may take help of the priests there....

Name: VivekRastogi
Title: Divine Experience
Review: Siddhvat as name suggested its Siddh Vat means the Great Banyan Tree. It is having historical importance. King Akbar has put brass pan over it, so it can not grow. But it was an miraculous moment, The banyan tree has grown himself by broken the brass pan, then King Akbar careenage and didn't force to stop growing tree. As this is the mythological story, The banyan Tree itself is like god.Siddhvat is famous for pooja of "Kaal Sirp Yoga" and "Pitradosh". Every Amavsya which falls every 30 days, people visiting here for removing thir "PitraDosh" by pouring milk on Siddhvat. Siddhvat is also well known and famous for "Pind Daan", when people die then for the peace of soul, his relatives do organize a pooja called "Pind Daan".There is a lot of Parking Space, Near by one can find Hotels for stay and good local food restaurants for Breakfast and Lunch. One can stay in the mid of ujjain in good hotels and SIddhvat is around 8 km from the heart of city called "Freeganj".

Name: SharmaPari
Title: Too much of a myth
Review: The priests there would lead you to believe that the temple is built around a tree that was planted there by Goddess Parvati but when I looked at the tree, it did not look thousands of years old as suggested by them. A Vat tree would have grown to humongous proportions by now. However, everyone thinks differently and it is upon everyone to decide for himself / herself.

Name: RajShar10
Title: Too much of a fantasy
Review: Another one of those religious places with stories and beliefs that are too good to be true. It is a temple built around a tree that was, supposedly, planted by Goddess Parvati.To me it seemed like another of those religious myths propogated by the priests to lend significance to a temple and earn more through better footfall. But, you can decide for yourself.

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Final Rituals
Review: Siddhavat features an enormous banyan tree on the banks of the Shipra, considered sacred since the medieval ages. This banyan tree has got the same significance as that of akshayavata in Prayag and Gaya, Vanshivata of Vrindavan and Panchavata of Nasik. Thousands of people take dip in the Shipra River from the bathing ghats built here. According to one tradition, Parvati is believed have performed her penance here. It used to be a place of worship for the followers of the Natha sect.People conducts here rituals for the lost soul.

Name: harshit_bly
Title: Planted by Mata Parvati
Review: whole golden history of the tree is carved on the boards inside the temple !! the tree defeated Mughals!! They cut down the tree as it is scared by the hindus but the tree soon grew up again from the roots !!and it is one of few important scared banyan trees of India i.e. Bamshi wat of Vrindavan, Akshay wat of Allahabad, Panchwati of Nashik and Budh wat of Gaya !!but the consition of place is pitiful, the place is unclean and the shipra ghat inside the temple is totally unclean! it needs maintenance!

Name: Yogesh2801
Title: Siddhavat Ujjain on Holy Shipra
Review: Siddhavata at Ujjain is well known for its sanctity as Akshayavata of Prayag, Vamshivata of Vrindawan and Panchavata of Nasik. Post funeral rites are performed here at the Siddhavata ghat of holy Shipra. Thousands of pilgrims take a dip in the Shipra from the bathing ghat built here. According to hearsay, Goddess Parvati is believed to have performed her penance here. It used to be a place of worship for the followers of Natha sect. The banyan tree is not flourished now a days and moreover the Shipra is not clean here. Water in the Shipra is not flowing. Heaps of garbage were strewn all over the Ghat Beggars and sadhus were loitering around.

Name: varugupt
Title: Historical importance
Review: It has history dated to the time when Karthikeyn arrived there and killed the asura. Near it Karthikeyn gave his power in the holy river Kshipra. People perform many rituals here for the peace of their ancestors. Many dosh like(sarp dosh, manglik dosh) can be prevented by doing puja there.

Name: Amit_holiday
Title: Holy place...
Review: Patal Bhairav Temple.. is a holy place for worship. The temple is devoted to Lord bhairav. Nice peaceful place.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: A heritage temple.
Review: its of of the temple dedicated to lord bhairav , there are movies based on the story of patal bhairav. as per indian mythology bhairav is god of fear and they punish who committed guilty . its  a  "terribly fearful form" of spiritualism

Name: rathod2017
Title: Patal Bhairav Temple
Review: Patal Bhairav Temple is the temple of lord kalbhairav. this place is also famous for black magic. this place is located at the centre of city.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: One of the nava bhairavars in ujjain
Review: There are nine temples of bhairavars in nine different forms scattered around the city and this is one of the important form of bhairavar

Name: nik_0107
Title: Unique Experience
Review: The Patal Bhairav Temple is located at the centre of the city, devotees offer liquor to lord as a offering.

Name: uday s
Title: Jai Kal Bhairava
Review: The place can be reached by hiring a cab or rick. People offer liquor to Kal Bharava(the one beyond Kal or time)

Name: blacksteallion
Title: Jai Kalbhairav ... Feel Blessed :)
Review: This is the place of lord kalbhairav to whom people offer liquor in prasad. People say that if you are blessed by lord kalbhairav, you don't need to worry about anything like black magic and all. This is a nice religious place in Ujjain.

Name: David S
Title: Lacks Ventilation.
Review: The place could have been kept well. Lacks Ventilation, hence uncomfortable.Very energetic. Hope he place revives soon.

Name: RamGanesan
Title: Old temple for Kal Bairava
Review: Situated away from the city, one has to take an auto to get there.  They will charge around 200 INR for this.  The actual cave is underground and not recommended as it is dark and not that well kept.

Name: Phb0414
Title: old temple in city
Review: this temple is in bhairavgarh... place far away from city life of ujjain... situated on banks of shipra river.... its one of the oldest temples in city ... in recent years lots of contruction have taken place which actually changed the real old feel of temple...

Name: Raviraj
Title: Superb....
Review: It's very near to Ujjain. From Ujjain you can travel in Auto's they will charge 200-250 they will only show another 5-6 temples... Beware for monkeys...

Name: RachanaR18
Title: Temple looks like a fort
Review: This temple looks uniquely like a fort from the outside and is located on the outskirts of the city. It is believed that every Shakti Peeth is accompanied by a Bhairav temple and this temple is a must visit for all those who visited Harsiddhi Maa temple.

Name: Yogesh S
Title: Bhairav temple visit on 29/07/16
Review: Visited bhairav temple on 29/07/16. Liquor is presented to bhairav ji as Prasad. Cage is not recommend as it is too dark inside.

Name: DEEPAK_23M
Title: Jai Patal Bhairavi
Review: Patal Bhairavi temple is situated in under ground of kaal bhairavnath temple no light is be carefull in ladders

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Underground cave near Kal Bhairav temple
Review: Patal Bhairavi cave lies near the temple entrance. During the Mughal period a monk named Jadarupa used to live here. Mughal emperor Jahangir used to visit him regularly during this stay in Ujjain.

Name: perplexed_soul
Title: Different place
Review: This temple is dedicated to Patal Bhairav and holds significance in Hindu mythology. This temple might seem to be unusual compared to others.

Name: rahulkumar1411
Title: bhairav temple
Review: this is bhairav mandir and here as prasad people serve wine on idol and miraculasly this wine get dissapear immediately

Name: law_madhulika
Title: This is the place where while running towards katra bhairav nath has taken shelter
Review: A famous temple dedicated to the Shakti (power) of the mother Goddess namely, Patal Bhairav Temple has an interesting legend behind it. As per Hindu mythology, a cruel and selfish demon, Bhairav Nath chased a young lady named Vaishno Devi, the reincarnation of Mother Goddess. In order to flee, the Devi shot an arrow in the ground from where water rushed out and took shelter here

Name: VaranasiDayTours
Title: It was dark and suffocation inside
Review: It was dark and suffocation inside of this temple. It is always recommended to have quieck visit to this temple.

Name: harsh_jim
Title: People were offering drinks to bharav Ji !
Review: Nice temple well maintained...Shocked to see people offering drinks to bharav ji and it was given back as prasad...

Name: williamsamaddar
Title: Do not miss
Review: If someone aspires to have a darshan of the Char Dhams along with the twelve Jyotirlingas in one place and under one roof, this special temple located on the west of Rudra Sagar lake [ opposite side of Mahakaleshwar Jyotirling Temple ] is the place to be.  A cave like structure leading to a tunnel will also give one a feeling of Vaishno Devi and a glimpse to a host of other deities. Children will enjoy this place a lot.

Name: Ankit Kapoor
Title: Char Dham Temple
Review: This temple consists of replicas of the Char Dhams, 12 Jyotirlingas & a tunneled walkway replicating Maa Vaishno Shrine. Location is near Mahakaleshwar parking.

Name: Gdj
Title: Char dham temple ujjain
Review: Most famous temple in ujjain.all char dham gods murtis at one premices in varrious attractive manner.

Name: Dhruv Bhargava
Review: Temple is well maintained and Beautiful.chardham gallery is beautiful and ashram also well maintained

Name: Mili Dutta
Title: Divine
Review: Char Dham is a must visit at Ujjain. Divinity at its best. Must visit incase you are Ujjain. Blessed!!

Name: Gdj
Title: Char dham mandir ujjain
Review: Chardhar mandir temple is situated in jaisingh pura area near to hardiddhi temple.in this temple atrractive murtis of lord.

Name: Sivakumar V
Title: A Temple for all the important Holy Shrines across the country
Review: All in one- this may be the correct description of this char Dham Temple in Ujjain. We can see the deities located in the famous chardhams - Kedarnath , Bhadrinath , Gongothri & Yamuothri , & the Gods of Puri , Dwaraka Vaishnavo Devi , Dwaraka Ahobilam --all could be worshiped in this temple. Beautifully organised including a cave like structure is a must-see in Ujjain. Well maintained and is open all days.

Name: alpsbt27
Title: beautiful place
Review: visited char dham mandir on sunday on Ujjain tour. its really beautiful place and quality time space and make feel energetic.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: 4 dham at one place
Review: Its a 15 year old temple situated at the back side of mahakaleshwar temple where you can find four temples ( 4 DHAMS ) at one place apart from temple there is small spiritual exhibition is also there which you can visit by paying a nominal ticket fee 10 rs. but worth to see at this price.

Name: Gdj
Title: Char dham mandir ujjain
Review: This temple located at jaisinghpura area of ujjain.there is murtis of chardham god under one roof. Temples attraction most like by me.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Char Dham Mandir
Review: Char Dham Mandir is nice temple. this is a replica of char dham. so many statues are there. nice experience to visit this place.

Name: Dipen Shah
Title: One time visit
Review: We had been to ujjain for jyotirling darshan and happen to visit herer as local city tour.Its okay and you can visit one time.Best is dwarkadhish temple

Name: Vishnu Pendyala
Title: Replicas of the 4 dhams
Review: There is also a guest house inside for pilgrims to stay. Also visit the mini spiritual theme park on the side.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Not at all maintained
Review: The temple houses four shines for Jagannath, ramanathaswamy,badrinath and dwarkeshwar, think its not maintained and can be avoided.

Name: meenakshimuthusamy
Title: Nice temple to visit
Review: The place is clean and has got neat look.The temple is very famous temple in the place in the city of ujjain.

Name: Dilip123
Title: A fairly new temple
Review: Ujjain is a city steeped in history and temples here are thousands of years old. In a such an ancient city, the char dham mandir is a fairly new temple with modern construction and concrete idols. This did not attract us having visited other ancient shrines in the city.It can be avoided in case of shortage of time.

Name: arunbvkumar
Title: Char Dham Mandir
Review: This is good place to see if there is time available  the replicas of all the 4 important religious places and also an additional Vaishnov Mata temple.

Name: Rohit C
Title: Nice temple
Review: Nice templeMust visit when you are in ujjainFour temples are inside in this templeMata devi temple is also there

Name: Ktishan Kant Lavania
Title: Good Temple chaar dham at one place & Mata Veshno Devi
Review: Visited this temple with my mother, good new temple, you can visit chaar dham at one place withMata Veshno devi temple,So many Jhankis are also there.

Name: DreamerDisha
Title: Good temple but no historical significance
Review: Replicas of the char dhams, few jhankis. Does not have any historical significance as a temple . Not a must visit temple when in Ujjain. If there for a day trip, can avoid. If have time at hand, go visit. Close to Harsidhi temple

Name: Vidhi_sharmah
Title: chaar dham at one place
Review: amazing temple and it is believed that visiting this one temple gives fruits of visiting four dhams which are situated too far away from each other

Name: nik_0107
Title: Four Dhams
Review: The newly build temple is clean and offer glimpse of all four dhams- Puri, Rameswaram, Dwarka, Badrinath.

Name: Anjani S
Title: nice mandir with JHAKI
Review: you will have all four dhams here only. nice mandir. it has a borading school of little kids who are studying vedas. jhaki is very good here.

Name: Nish0901
Title: All four dhams at one place
Review: We visited this place after visiting  Shri Mahakaleshwar Temple & Harsiddhi Mata Temple. The temple was clean and glimpse of all four dhams was the main feature there. There is a small garden outside where you can take rest.

Name: Kumar K
Title: Interesting temple of the four Dhams
Review: This temple depicts the four Dhams - Puri, Rameswaram, Dwarka, Badrinath. Nice place to visit. The outside of the temple can be kept a little clean.This temple is located about 100 m from Harsiddhi temple.

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: A nice place to visit
Review: This temple is located close to Harsidhhi temple and symbolically holds the deities of all four dhaams as enshrined in Hindu texts . Good ambience

Name: niya27
Title: Near Vikram Teela
Review: There are many important temples in Ujjain. This temple is one of them. After Harsiddhi temple visit, you can go to this temple. Garden outside is nice. If you are with children, must go there.

Name: parmanand06
Title: char dham
Review: Mandir is near to mahakal temple.It is a temple and Ashram where Vedas are being taught to students.you can see murti of Chardham ie Badrinath, Dwarka, Rameshwar and Jagannathji.Calm place with a soothing environment. Nice to be around.

Name: Prat C
Title: Good!
Review: Worth a visit! The setup and arrangement is good.You can see little pandas in the making here,being taught the traditional culture of ujjain! Its a good sight to calm yourself but not in the rush hours.You wont wanna go then.Its made for peace,calmness and serenity!

Name: Kawaljeet Singh
Title: Hindu Worship Temple in Ujjain
Review: one of the famous temple in ujjain. this temple is main attraction for hindus. located near Mahakal mandir.

Name: RamGanesan
Title: Well Kept modern Mandir
Review: This mandir is around a kilometer from the Mahakal temple.  We chose to walk, but there are autos and share autos that can take you back and forth from the center of town. A well kept temple and we visited it at around 8.30 PM in the evening and there was literally no crowd. It is based on  the famous Char Dham temples. The temple is constructed in a layered fashion where one can see deities of the four Dhams one by one in each level.  The main attraction at this temple is the thematic Vaishnavo devi temple constructed at the sides.  There is a fee of INR 5 to enter this thematic place and can get the feeling of climbing inside a mountain akin to Vaishnovo Devi.  Kids will definitely like the place and it is more existing that a temple in that sense for them,  Photography inside this place is not allowed.  A must visit place when in Ujjain.

Name: ChennaiFocus
Title: Temple next to Harsiddhi Mandir
Review: It is a temple and Ashram where Vedas are being taught to students. You can see different forms of Krishna and also a simulation of Vaishno Devi Mandir. Different experience.

Name: Jagadish S
Title: very nice recreation
Review: a very nice temple near the Mahakala temple. the dieties of all the main 4 dhams - Puri, dwaraka, rameshwaram and badrinath - is depicted in 4 small temples. worth a visit

Name: Manish B
Title: Beautiful Temple
Review: Recent addition to the city the temple was build in 1967 and approx 4 kms from Ujjain railways station. Very good place to visit and spend some time in worship and meditation.

Name: Shubham06
Title: Calm soothing place
Review: As the name suggests it is known for Char Dhams. Calm place with a soothing environment. Nice to be around.

Name: guptaashok_0511
Title: Relegious Place
Review: This is a Relegious place with murti so far Chardham ie Badrinath, Dwarka, Rameshwar and Jagannathji. It is has a show of Electric jhankis, not to be missed.

Name: williamsamaddar
Title: Feeling patriotic and devoted  üôè
Review: Located within the compound of Shri Mahakal Bhakta Nivas, this is without doubt the most beautiful temple dedicated to Mother India.‡§ú‡§Ø ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤     üôè‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡§æ ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§Ø  üôè

Name: Ankit Kapoor
Title: Nice Temple
Review: This temple is dedicated to the Bharat Mata and is located near Mahakaleshwar Temple. It is connected to Mahakal Lok and can be visited from there.

Name: AnshumanMaini
Title: Good one
Review: Its inside Shri Mahakaal Bhakt niwas premises. We were staying there and visited during night. Good short visit and selfie/photo point. They allow to click as many photos. Might take less than 5 minutes.

Name: Shashi
Title: Cleanliness was not good
Review: Staff behavior was not right, Second day I asked for cleaning, then he ignored it even after listening.  The floor of the room was very dirty. We stayed there for two days but they did not even give water to the room.  TV Proper was not working

Name: vinay760
Title: Ujjain Darshan
Review: This is newly build first Bharat Mata temple behind Mahakaleshwar temple , nice place . This is close to guest house and parking place.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Place dedicated to patriotism
Review: Bharat mata its a idol for indian patriotism , such type of places are trying to create a feeling of patriotism in every indian citizen , there is no glamour or any special reason but every indian citizen is feeling proud to be part of it.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Bharat Mata Mandir
Review: Bharat Mata Mandir, this temple is unique than others. there is a map of undivided india. must see place in ujjain city.

Name: Yogesh L
Title: Unique Temple
Review: This is truly a unique temple as it is temple for the nation. Something different dedicated to nation and is a must visit.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Not sure
Review: This is a temple dedicated to bharat mata, just like the one in kasi, and is very near to the famous mahakaleswar temple.

Name: meenakshimuthusamy
Title: Place is very nice to visit
Review: The place is nice and good to visit.The templae is very neat and clean.It is well maintained.It is called bharat mata mandir.

Name: arunbvkumar
Title: Bharat Mandir
Review: It is Largest kind of temple for Bharat Mata. It enthuses patriotism and there is a 3D Map of India and all the jyotirlingas and important religious sites.

Name: Gdj
Title: Kalidas academy ujjain
Review: Most famous cultural place in ujjain city. Varrious types of cultural and literature activities conducted at there.

Name: mohammadnur
Title: Kalidas academy
Review: recently visited it in Ujjain, a beautiful city in MP, India. I loved it. You can recall Great poet Kalidas looking at  this academy. The building is nice, clean and attractive. he surroundings are clean. Roads are good. From here Krishna's academy is near.

Name: Gdj
Title: Kalidas academy
Review: Now a days kalidas academy is center of cultural activities in ujjsin.all types of cultural activity and exhibition organised there.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: A perfect blend of Art and culture
Review: Its a cultural place where there are 2 auditoriums and several spiritual , cultural and other exhibitions taken place throughout the year , if you are lucky than you might attend any of the event if entry is free to all. and most of the events are free to all.very beautifully constructed surrounded with full of greenery

Name: Gdj
Title: Kalidas academy ujjain
Review: Kalidas academy is well esblished organisation in ujjain. Maintained by sanskrati vibhag mp government. There is well description about mahakavi kalidas. Evvery yera organised kalidas festival.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Kalidasa Academy
Review: Kalidasa Academy is a well maintained and clean place. this place is constructed in a big area. this is the place where any one can learn sanskrit language.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Kalidasa special
Review: Every corner of the property speaks about the famous poet kalidas and the language sanskrit.want to know more about these then this is the best place in india for the same.

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Big Academy
Review: I went to Kalidasa Academy. Spanning over a whopping 3374 hectares, the Kalidasa Academy in Ujjain has helped hundreds of students get in touch with the world's first language - Sanskrit. It is great place to go.

Name: nik_0107
Title: Cultural Shows
Review: The Kalidasa Academy is a amphitheatre which host cultural shows. It is not a tourist attraction though and can be skipped.

Name: Nish0901
Title: Not a tourist place
Review: This is not a tourist place, so you can skip if not interested. It you want to learn work of Kalidasa, go there. A library is there where you can read ancient Hindu literature.

Name: Phb0414
Title: Place for cultural programs
Review: This place is located on Kothi road in front of Taran taal of Ujjain. Its a beautiful place and offers a good oppurtunity to conduct cultural events organised in Ujjain. Every year in Navratre Garba is organised by some groups as well as after diwali hasth shilp mela is conducted

Name: Gary M
Title: Kalidasa Akademi on University Road, Ujjain, is home to the Indian arts.
Review: One of the more interesting places to visit in the Ujjain is the Kalidasa Academy on University Road, which was established by the Madhya Pradesh government in 1978 to honour the memory and works of Mahakavi Kalidasa, a great Indian poet and dramatist in the 4th Century B.C. Often described as the ‚ÄúShakespeare of India‚Äù, a recent discovery of an inscription in 1964 is said to establish that he was born in Ujjain (then Ujjayini) around the time of the famous King Chandragupta Vikramaditya. Although, Sanskrit scholar Lakshmi Dhar Kalla (1891-1953) concluded that Kalidasa was born in Kashmir. But don‚Äôt try telling that to anyone from Ujjain. Mahakavi Kalidasa‚Äôs famous quotes include:‚ÄúPlease subdue the anguish of your soul. Nobody is destined only to happiness or to pain. The wheel of life takes one up and down by turn.‚Äù‚ÄúToday well-lived makes every yesterday a dream of happiness.‚ÄùAccording to one popular story, Kalidasa was an uneducated man who, through good fortune, married a princess. Challenged by his wife to better himself, he took up the study of poetry and went on to become one of India‚Äôs legendary poets. Another story relates that, in the latter part of his life, he visited the king of Sri Lanka and, because of some treachery there, was murdered. Their website informs us that Kalidasa Academy was established with the following objectives:1)	Study and exploration of Kalidasa‚Äôs literature from both a literary and an academic point of view, and also from the interdisciplinary angles in terms of its total impact on the various forms;2)	Translation, preparation, publication and documentation of Kalidasa‚Äôs and other Sanskrit works in various world languages, with particular accent on preparing stage versions of Sanskrit plays in Hindi and other Indian languages;3)	Establishment of a model Sanskrit theatre (Natyamandap) as per the norms of Bharata‚Äôs Natya Shastra, with a view to attempt authentic reconstruction of the ancient style and to facilitate regular production of Kalidasa‚Äôs and other Sanskrit plays by eminent classical theatre personalities from all over the country as well as abroad.4)	Collection and analysis of all available material relating to Sanskrit theatre and those forms which are living remnants of the classical style;5)	Establishment of a museum of Sanskrit theatrical arts and a library of traditional music, theatre and dance costumes etc. and their documentation through tapes, films and other media, including production of books of Sanskrit plays and the like;6)	Facilities for imparting training in classical theatre and for undertaking research in related areas. The Academy complex consists of an indoor theatre, a museum, a library, a mini-stage for rehearsals, lecture and seminary halls, research facilities for scholars, and a large open-air theatre.I have visited Kalidasa Academy on many occasions to attend plays, art exhibitions, vocal and music recitals, classical dance performances and conferring ceremonies. On many of these occasions my wife, Sarita McHarg, has been performing either as the main artist or in a supporting role. Enquiries at the office will inform you of upcoming events so you can ascertain which programs best suit your interests.

Name: Manish B
Title: Interesting place for literature lovers
Review: The kalidas academy was establish keeping in mind that for coming generations there will be need to teach the work done by kalidas. Very unique and different place to visit.

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: Interesting & Art Lovers
Review: 1st time i saw this type place. Totally interesting place for every age group persons and arts lovers.

Name: Sarayu Kamat
Title: Interesting Place for those interested in ancient literary works
Review: If you are planning to visit The Kalidasa Academy, plan so you are there during the Kalidasa Samaroha. This is held in winter and the dates are available on the website. The Academy has a great library with many interesting books. Some of them are in English and the library is open to public. The staff is very helpful

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Must for art and culture lovers
Review: Established in the year 1978, the academy is dedicated to the life and works of great poet Kalidas. The Academy got its own buildings in 1983 designed by architect Hema Sankalia. A new building NAVAMSHA was constructed in 1995. The academy organizes the annual Kalidas festival. Kalash yarta and Nandi festival are some of the significant programs of this festival. In 2010 a l lotus pond was developed behind the complex with a well shaded pathway .The pond is visited by a number of avian species. A number of sign posts have been erected around the bond with information on these birds. Beautiful paintings on the boundary wall of the pond depict scenes from Kalidas‚Äôs works such as Meghadutam, Raghuvansham and Ritusanharam. In 2016 on occasion of Simhastha a mini garden was developed and 66 plant species mentioned in Kalidas‚Äôs works were planted in the garden.

Name: Apoorv Joshi
Title: art lovers
Review: kalidas acadamy is good place to visit.it is very nice and also there were cultural events here.it could have been better maintained.

Name: perplexed_soul
Title: This place can do better
Review: Although the ambiance is good but didn't live up to mark for a great poet Kalidasa. This place can be turned into a good artistic-work mongers.

Name: sumit100051781
Title: Disappointment all the way
Review: We went with big expectations, hoping that this institute would do justice to the importance of Poet Kalidasa in our literary history. Thoroughly disappointed, by the pedestrian kind of design, the lackadaisical maintenance, and even indifference towards the rare and stray visitors like us. We were told that we cannot visit the library ( which was our prime target ) because the person in charge has gone back home, and, in fact, we were told that we should have rung up and informed before coming. This venue had huge potential, but sadly unrealised.

Name: Pallavi_Raj
Title: Art centre of Ujjain
Review: This is the centre of arts in Ujjain. It is located near university area. It's beauty lies in its interior, a natural pond inside d campus n open areas to have stage shows n cultural events. Best time to visit is during kalidas samaroh, which is every year scheduled in early November.  It is the host of the annual national Kalidas festival known as "Kalidas Samara" which is a one week grand celebration of cultureal amalgamation n various arts of India. Kalidas festival is known for stellar participation by artists and scholars of music, theater, painting, dance, and poetry.Also in December to January, it hosts hastshilpa melamine - handicraft exhibition. It's a wonderful treat for impulse buyers n people who love to buy great interior artifacts for their houses or athenic wears. During navratri it organizational dandiya festival.It is a must visit place if you are an art lover as throughout year it exhibits different artists creations too.

Name: VivekRastogi
Title: Center for Artists
Review: As name suggested this academy is named on kalidasa. Kalidasa is one of the greatest sanskrit poet and he was from Ujjain. Here with the help of Government of MP, Kalidasa academy organizing every year Kalidasa Samaroh. Kalidasa Samaroh generally organized for 7 days and there are many plays staged. There are many Melas organised and a Gallery is also available so many painting exhibition is also arranged on this place.

Name: riteshsingh2k
Title: It's good place
Review: It's nice place , specially at the time of Navaratri , you can enjoy garba during navaratri .time to time some events are happening there.

Name: Achal
Title: Kalidas Still Present...
Review: This academy is dedicated to the work of Great Kalidas, every year there is kalidas national festival  - plays are performed by various cultural groups across India, classical dances, painting exhibition held during this period, do visit if you love to have glimpses of cultural heritage and vibrant soul of Malwa

Name: Shaileshbharal
Title: Institute working hard to make alive indian culture
Review: This institute totally devoted to keep old values and indian culture alive.The famous Kalidas Samaroh organised by this institute give chance to know learn views of many famous dignitaries who becomes guest for this samaroh

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Very ancient water found attached to lord Kirshna
Review: Gomti Kund is not separate attraction, it is part of Sandipani Ashram. I was checking with all localities to find out this attraction and finally I came to know that this is inside Ashram.This is not separate one but very old one around 3000 years old and has reference to the Puranas and Vedas. It is said that Lord Krishna bade the holy rivers from all over pilgrimage centers for his aged Guru to carryout his rituals easily. Since last 3000 years this Gomti Kund remain water source for ashram and till today it is the main water resource for Ashram. It is also believed that taking a dip in the sacred water of the tank can help to cure the problems of devotees who come here to pray. But now when I visited this place. it was barricaded from all the four sides and we cannot enter into the same.

Name: Gdj
Title: Gomti kund
Review: Famous place in ujjain.there is spiritual water tank. Near sandipani ashram. Lord krishna studies there.

Name: Gdj
Title: Ankapata kund
Review: This kund is situated at sandipani ashram campus. Local people said that lord krishna wash his slat on this kund . Nice place to visit.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Historic water pond
Review: its a spiritual historic water pond where several spiritual rituals are taken place and one can visit at ones very close to sandipani ashram.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Just a area with small pound
Review: Ankapata is a place where there is  small pound and some temples are situated nearby location . nothing much to explore

Name: Gdj
Title: Gomti kund ujjain
Review: This kund near to sandipai ashram,where lord shree krisha washed his slat after studies.the details and importance of this kund described in purans and ancient hindu sahitya.

Name: trivediar
Title: Ancient and Pious
Review: This is the kund where Lord Krishna used to clean his slate after attaining vidhya from his Guru Sandipani Rishi.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Ankapata
Review: Ankapata is not a big place and it need some maintenance. this place is located near sandeepani ashram.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Gomti Kund
Review: Gomti Kund is a steep pond that holds a blend of all holy waters of the world. They say Lord Krishna summoned all the holy waters and created the Gomti Kund so that his guru, Sandipani, wouldn't have to travel to them. Till date, this is the single source of water supply for the entire ashram.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Must see place
Review: The place is one of the must visit place in the city and has some historical significance near the famous santhiran ashram,the place where lord krishna took his schooling.

Name: Vishnu Pendyala
Title: Significant because of its location inside Lord Krishna's school
Review: Like with most religious places, read the legend about it before visiting to appreciate it better and make the best out of your time.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Nice place
Review: This is a nice place to visit but can be well maintained, still can visit if time permits. otherwise not a big deal

Name: Dilip123
Title: Holy water but lacks maintenance
Review: It makes me feel bad to give an average rating to this holy pond the waters of which were used by the Lord Himself.The pond is situated inside sandipini ashram. So not sure why this was added as a separate attraction. Travelers need not consider this as an extra place to visit since its included as part of your visit to sandipini ashram.The pond badly needs maintenance. It would be good to clean the pond and facilitate a holy bath. The current state doesn't allow to do so.

Name: Payal G
Title: Part of the Sandipani Ashram
Review: This place is a tank with a stepwell within the Sandipani Ashram. As per the legend Lord Krishna summoned the holy waters from across India to this place so that his old teacher didn't have to travel far to the other holy places.Currently it's in a very dirty condition and people are not allowed inside (good decision because of the way people have littered). The new gallery for the 64 arts is built along its perimeter. Renovation and maintenance of the tank should be taken up next on priority basis.

Name: arunbvkumar
Title: Accumulation of all the Holy waters of the World
Review: This is a place inside the Sandipani Ashram. It is believed that Lord Krishna commanded  the water of all the holy rivers to assemble in this kund for his Guru Sandipani. At This Place all the 64 types of subjects was learnt by Lord Krishna in 64 days.

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Beautiful
Review: I went to Gomti Kund. Resting amidst the peaceful environs of Sandipani Ashram, the Gomti Kund is a steep pond that holds a blend of all holy waters of the world. It is great place to go.

Name: Viral Arya
Title: Gomti Kund, a historical place
Review: This place is a part of Sandipani Ashram. Gomti Kund is a Indian ancient style water tank wit stairs. As per legend at this place God Shri Krishna summoned all the holy waters from various centres, so that his Guru Sandipani Muni would not have to travel other holy places.

Name: Viral Arya
Title: Place used by God Krishna to wash his writing tablets
Review: This place is the part of Sandeepani Ashram. Popularly, it is a belief that this Place used by God Shri Krishna to wash his writing tablets.

Name: UmaBG
Title: Gomti kund
Review: It's a small kund(pond) near Gomti river just beside sandipani ashram. Very little water in the kund and can't be bathed here. Good and peaceful place to visit.

Name: Vidhi_sharmah
Title: gomti kund
Review: a small waterbody known as gomti kund is one of the attractions near sandipani ashram , can be maitained in a better way

Name: Nish0901
Title: Place near Ujjain
Review: Ankapata is a place where Sandeepani Ashram is located. Krishna, Sudama & Balram Ji studied here. You will find there idols at multiple places there. No entry ticket. At some places there, photography is prohibited.

Name: Maneesh12345
Title: study place of bhagwan krishna and sudama
Review: It is believed that Ankapata or the slate which Lord Krishna used is still there in Sandipani ashram. But when enquired in Ashram nobody knew the existence of such Ankapata, it may be a Mythological statement.

Name: parmanand06
Title: kund
Review: Gomti kund is located at the outskirts of ujjain,near to sandipani ashramIts a good sight to calm yourself but not in the rush hours.You wont wanna go then.Its made for peace,calmness and serenity!

Name: Sunil K
Title: Gomti Kund at Sandeepni Ashram
Review: The Kund is quite deep and it was closed for entry in it. and very top It was filled with raining water which look very nice and greenery in area.

Name: vinsach
Title: Gomti Kund
Review: nice place to visit with friends and family. place is full of monkeys. good for photography during rains and winters.

Name: vinsach
Title: Ankapata
Review: must visit place during the rainy season with family or friends. place is near to the city centrer freegang belltower

Name: ChennaiFocus
Title: Gomti Kund - Sandipani Ashram
Review: Krishna, Balarama and Sudhama did their gurukulam here under the aegis of Maharishi Sandipani. We can also get a unique prasad (powder) which is the favorite of Sri Krishna. There is a 6000 year old Shivalingam and the kund can challenge any wonder of the world. Very less water during our visit but they say it fills in July/August. Must visit place in Ujjain.

Name: Abhishek Shrivastav
Title: Historical Place
Review: Gomti kund is located at the outskirts of ujjain.Its a holy place and it is believed that you actually feel stress free when you visit this place.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Krishna studied here
Review: According to Bhagwat Purana Krishna, Balram and Sudama were taught by Kalaguru Sandipani at his ashram here. After Krishna killed his evil uncle Kasna, his parents Vasudev and Devaki sent him and his brother Balram to Guru Sandipani for their studies. Even today parents do patti puja here in which the writing tablet is worshipped before child starts going to school. The Kundeshwar Mahadev temple nearby is the only temple in India to have standing bull Nandi. The Nandi dates back to the Sunga period. Guru Sandipani is believed to have meditated at the Sarweshwar Mahadev temple nearby.

Name: Apoorv Joshi
Title: ankapata
Review: this place is not much famous in tourist but local people have beliefe that starting education from here is good thing because lord krishna was using this place during their gurukul time.

Name: Apoorv Joshi
Title: gomti kund
Review: gomti kund is holy kund along side with sandipani aashram.water is there but not much clean.however it is very old and still maintained.

Name: npn2000
Title: Ankapata
Review: Ankapata is another destination near sandipani aashram ,this palce is also known for Dhashara festival

Name: npn2000
Title: Gomti Kund
Review: Gomti Kund ,visit this during visit to sandipani aashram and Mangalanath  temple visit ,place where Lord krishna studied

Name: perplexed_soul
Title: Historically significant place lost with time
Review: Lord Krishna used this tank during his time in Gurukul. It is a land lost in time and the administration has turned a blind eye towards it.

Name: rahulkumar1411
Title: gomti kund
Review: gomti kund is near to sandipani ashram.every morning many people come to take bath in this holy kund.but it is not maintained so water is not so clean

Name: padmaja111
Title: Belief is the basis for miracles !
Review: This is a part of Sandipani Ashram.Now it appears to be a dry tank, but it is believed that Lord Krishna used to wash his slate at this place, while studying in this gurukul.So local  people believe that it  is auspicious to start their children's education, from here after doing puja here.If any child has any problem with his studies, his parents bring him here as a remedial measure, so that he will improve by Lord Krishna's blessings !!

Name: padmaja111
Title: Well ,maintained since olden days !
Review: Gomathi kund is the source of water body /tank ,seen in the premises of  Sandipani  Ashram. It still contain water, which can be reached  by climbing down a series of steps built on four sides.It has been  used as  a source of water for the Ashram since ancient times !

Name: Pallavi_Raj
Title: A Serene place to start your Education
Review: This place is known as the primary learning days place of Lord Krishna. At this place Lord Krishna took his early education. there is a water pond here, where Lord Krishna used to wash his writing board, and then there is a park inside and 2-3 temples. Still peopple come with their toddlers to start their education training here. they do a puja and then they enroll kids to other city schools.

Name: Gdj
Title: Ram mandir ujjain
Review: Lord ram mata seeta lakshma and hanuman murties at there. Near to harsiddhi temple.peaceful place. Not more crowded.

Name: Sivakumar V
Title: A peaceful serene temple
Review: Amidst the better known Mahakaleshwar & Harsiddhi  is this beautiful temple dedicated Lord Ram. He give Dharshan with Janaki ( Sita ) & Lakshman with Hanuman seeated at their feet bowing down. There are shrines for Shiva and Kali also here. Situated on the banks of the river Shirpa, it is said to have the oldest of Ghats. Harthi to river is said to be performed everyday.A very calm and peaceful atmosphere prevailed when we visited this place. Reasonably kept well.

Name: Gdj
Title: Ram mandir ujjain
Review: This mandir is near to harsiddhi temple. Situated on bank of shipra river ramghay.large space temple.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Small temple dedicated to Lord Rama
Review: Its a very small temple dedicated to lord Ram. only few peoples visited this place not very famous but situated at cool place.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Ram Mandir
Review: Ram Mandir as the name suggests is dedicated to Lord Rama who is seen here with his wife Sita on one side and his brother Laxman on another. the architecture of this temple is marvellous.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: One more temple in the city
Review: The temple is one of several temples along the gusta dedicated to lord ram and since it's not that much crowded can have a quick visit.

Name: meenakshimuthusamy
Title: Ram temple
Review: The temple has got a famous in the city.The place is nice to visit.The place has got a good feel after the visit.

Name: ARUN
Title: BEAUTIFUL AND PEACEFUL HISTORICAL TEMPLE
Review: If u are planning to visit ujjain you must visit this temple. Such a nice and beautiful place with nearby lake "vishnu sagar" where u can enjoy boating. two temples of lord ram(statues are in walking posture) and lord vishnu is there. no so many stairs. Dont miss if ju are in ujjain...............

Name: akankshacoolgirl
Title: Religious Place
Review: Ram Mandir is a famous ram temple in the city of temples ujjain.The temple has a lot of stairs so plan accordingly.

Name: Bimal0401
Title: Jai Shri Ram
Review: The temple of Lord Rama and Janaki is very neat and clean. The atmosphere is very peaceful and pious. It is recommended to visit this temple when at Ujjain, a city of temples.

Name: parmanand06
Title: ram mandir
Review: Ujjain is the city of temple, This temple is for lord ram.Both the-Ram Janki temple and Vishnu Janardan temples in Ram Janardan temple.This is very old temple .Beautiful paintings,art.

Name: vinsach
Title: Ram Mandir
Review: nice religious place, must visit with anyone ,family, friends. very peaceful and calming place. one must definitely go.

Name: yogindery
Title: Ram Mandir
Review: ujjain city is very holy and 'historical' city in india. if called temple nagari no doubt.Ram Mandir is one of them near to shipra river ram ghat also a sightseeing place in ujjain.

Name: perplexed_soul
Title: Small and calm temple
Review: Idols of Lord Rama, Sita and Laksmana are there in this small temple. Need to climb lot of stairs to reach to the top. One of the many good places to visit in Ujjain.

Name: rahulkumar1411
Title: ram mandir
Review: one of the beautiful temple surrounded by few more small shrine nearby.i found this place good for meditation.

Name: law_madhulika
Title: Ujjain is the city of Temple
Review: Ujjain is the city of temple. Its a holy place. this is a temple on Ram sita and Lakshman. you will also get to worship hanuman here as one of the bhakt of shri ram.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Ram Janardan temple
Review: Both the-Ram Janki temple and Vishnu Janardan temples in Ram Janardan temple complex were built by Mirza Raja Jai Singh in the 17th century. What makes the idol of Ram unique is the fact that Ram is shown with a beard. The boundary wall and the tank nearby were added by the Marathas in the 18th century. Beautiful paintings from the Maratha period depicting scenes from Ramayana can be seen in the garbha griha. The sculpture of Sheshasayi Vishnu installed between the assembly hall and the garbha griha of Ram Janki temple belongs to the 10th century while that of Bramha, Vishnu and Mahesh belongs to the 12th century AD.

Name: JAGDISH RAVAL
Title: A small Temple
Review: Ram Mandir is at Ram mandir Ghat at bank of River Shipra. Here is temple of Lord Rama. There are idols of Ram,Laxman & Jnaki along with Hanumanaji. A small temple.

Name: Anshuman A
Title: Temples
Review: Seoni is located between Jabalpur and Nagpur.  In the middle of crossing various small villages with unknown names, you will suddenly find Seoni with great religious activities.   The city has Jain Temples of Shwetambar and Digambar sects, Hanuman Temple besides the Ram Temple which is very famous.    There is also a lake by the name of Dal Sagar Lake in the town. The place is famous for Peda of a special type.

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Ram Temple
Review: This is a hundred year old temple which was reconstructed in the year 1974.This temple has number of steps to climb.This is a temple where idol Lord Ram,Sita and Laxman is been worshiped.

Name: skdel2016
Title: One of the place of worship at Ujjain
Review: It,s Devi sthan near mahakaal parking at mahakaal pahari area. The temple has 24 pillers so known as 24 Khambha. It has ancient architecture. People go their for offering Pooja as well as tantra jaap. Jai maa kaali.

Name: Gdj
Title: Mata temple in ujjain
Review: Most famous mata temple in ujjain. Very old temple. On every navratri local govt administration do pooja there.

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: Beautiful Goddess temple
Review: This is a very beautiful Devi temple just near Sri Mahakaleshwar temple . Very nice ambience and good devotion on display

Name: Gdj
Title: Hindu mata temple
Review: Hindu mata temple near to mahakal temple.two devi murtis at there.there are 24 pillers on that temple.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: A small but unique temple with 24 pillers
Review: As per name Chaubis (24)  Khamba ( mean pillers ) its a temple where 2 small temples located at entrance of the temple ( Mata temple ) and the whole premises stands on 24 pillers

Name: Yogesh P
Title: Religious place
Review: This was good but small temple. This was come in oldest temple of Ujjain. Chaubis khambha means twenty four pillars. Situated in centre of city.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: One of the guardians
Review: The temple houses the gods, goddesses and the guardians of the city of ujjjain which has a extordinary froNt arch with artistic carvings.

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Immense Tranquility
Review: I went to Chaubis Khamba Temple. The entrance showcases the images of guardian goddesses of the Temple - Mahalaya and Mahamaya with their names inscribed on the footsteps of the temple. This place is a must visit for the immense tranquility that it has to offer. It is great place to go.

Name: niya27
Title: In ujjain city
Review: This temple is near to Shri Mahakaleshwar temple. This temple is dedicated to two goddess - Shri Mahamaya and Shri Mahalaya.

Name: Maneesh12345
Title: 1000 year old temple with 24 pillars
Review: this is one of the oldest temple in ujjain with 24 pillars dedicated to choti mata and badi mataNear the Northern side of the entrance are two small temples dedicated to Mahalaya and Mahamaya goddess.

Name: Jagadish S
Title: nothing much to see
Review: there are the ancient 24 pillars and a banyan tree. the temple has been created in the front which looks not a part of the pillars at all. on a busy street not far from the Mahakala temple

Name: yogindery
Title: Chaubis Khamba Temple
Review: Chaubis Khamba Temple situated in heart of ujjain. temple dedicated to 'chotti mata' and 'badi mata', we some friends blessing morning aarti Chaubis Khamba Temple.Chaubis Khamba Temple between some pillars.

Name: Bhupendra
Title: Good sculpture but not the best
Review: You can find it at the enterance of the ram ghatThere are two temples at the outside while inside ones the original place is left without maintenance.

Name: perplexed_soul
Title: Soothing place
Review: It is a very old temple, dating back to the 9th or 10th century AD. As the name suggests this place is well known for 24 pillars. Worth a visit.

Name: rahulkumar1411
Title: chaubis khamba temple
Review: the speciality of this temple is that it made in 24 pillars with separate tomb.i like this holy place for peace of my mind.

Name: law_madhulika
Title: Chaubis Khamba Temple
Review: Chaubis Khamba Temple is a captivating historical wonder dated back to the 9th or 10th century. The entrance showcases the images of guardian goddesses of the Temple - Mahalaya and Mahamaya with their names inscribed on the footsteps of the temple

Name: ankan146
Title: rarest architecture 24pillar temple in the world.
Review: very rare temple  , deities(mother) placed on either side of passage,, evening arti is a  devotees delight.. temple has 24 pillars..rarest. architecture.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Entrance to the Mahakalavana
Review: In olden times, Makakaleshwar temple was located in closed enclosure called Mahakalavana.. Chaubis Khamba was one of the four main entrance gates to this Mahakalavana. This two storied entrance supported by carved pillars on both sides was built during the Paramara period (11-12 CE) when the capital was shifted from Malwa to Ujjain. Remains of the old boundary wall can be seen nearby. Near the Northern side of the entrance are two small temples dedicated to Mahalaya and Mahamaya goddess.

Name: VivekRastogi
Title: Chaubis Khamba Temple on Chaubis Khamba actually
Review: Chaubis Khamba Temple is Actually on Chaubis Khamba. This is one of the very good and old architecture of Ujjain. If one is interested to see the old Architecture they must visit this temple.

Name: Gdj
Title: Vikram university ujjain
Review: Most famous university in malwa area of mp.varrious departments on university campus.unvivesity covers ujjain ratlam agar malwa,mandsour,neemuch districts colleges.

Name: Gdj
Title: Vikram university
Review: This is most famous and single government university in mp malwa region.this university covers ujjain,mandaour,neemuch,r atlam,shajapur,agar malwa districts colleges.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Ujjain's own university.
Review: Its a govt university named with maharaja of ujjain ( vikramaditya )situated with large lush green campus several collages , staff quarteres and hostels are situated inside the university campus

Name: rathod2017
Title: Vikram University
Review: The University, located on Dewas Road, was established in the year 1957. It plays a major role in promoting the literary and cultural activities of the city. This university has a nearby park, called Vikram Vatika and is a beautiful place to sit back and relax.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Not a tourist place
Review: The place is a study place named after the famous king vikramadhithyan Nothing to do for tourists we were told.

Name: akankshacoolgirl
Title: Very Old university
Review: Vikram University dedicated to King Vikramaditya is a very old university and offers a wide ranges of graduation courses.

Name: BafnaShashank
Title: A very old University with 89 streams
Review: This is a graded as "A" by NAAC, India. I just went there to explore the courses & have a campus visit. I was amazed by the rich history associated with it & how vast & multiple streams are available with it.

Name: Yogeshsukhwal
Title: Feel good to be here again.
Review: I had my graduation from here, several years ago. During my visit to ujjain, I decided to have a chance to meet my old faculties here. My experience was to good. I heartily welcomed. University has developed in many terms.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Peaceful and quite environment
Review: One of the first university to have been established after independence in 1957, the university offers courses in wide range of subjects including archaeology.

Name: perplexed_soul
Title: Trendsetter
Review: This university offers renowned and a wide variety of courses in its curriculum. This university could etch a name for itself if it goes in the right direction. Great place to learn and good faculty members too.

Name: Khatrisunil2013
Title: Seat of knowledge
Review: One among oldest universities of india which is regaining its reputation and offers variety of versatile courses with support of qualified faculty. I am proud of being alumni of this university .

Name: girishanjhim
Title: A great Knowledge centre
Review: Many of my friends and colleagues are still into education line. I also did my PGDHRM from this University

Name: VivekRastogi
Title: Named on King Vikramaditya
Review: One of the great and old university of Middle India, Named on King Vikramaditya. Once headed by the great poet Shivmangal Singh Suman. University offered many courses.

Name: vasundhara_12
Title: A nice drive to and around!
Review: If you are in the city of Ujjain, make sure you drive around the universities areas.The university circle, is great to walk around in at any time of the day (beware of the midday heat though!). The adjacent Kothi road is perfect to drive on, especially on a warm sunny evening or a cool night and grab some roasted peanuts or pani puri to wrap up a perfect evening!

Name: Ameet_Pathare
Title: 3000 year old university of Ujjayini...
Review: One of the oldest ancient learning seat of India,Ujjayini rose to promience when Guru Sandipan moved here from Kashi.The university is named after Gupta king Vikramaditya.

Name: Gdj
Title: Vikram kirti mandir
Review: Well maintained small museum.established by govt of mp.varrious types of ancient murties there.nice place to visit.

Name: Gdj
Title: Vikram kirti mandir
Review: Located on kothi road maintained by government of mp. A lot of cultural and social activities organised there.shown information about king vikramadiya.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Small museum but good ambiance
Review: Its a very small museum located at vikram kirti mandir ( its a govt auditorium where lots of cultural events and activities has been organized ) there are heritage stones and historic monuments are placed inside the museum.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Vikram Kirti Mandir Museum
Review: Built in commemoration of the beloved king Vikramaditya. you have to pay to visit this place. well maintained place and nice collection of things.

Name: Dipen Shah
Title: Nice Creation of temple cum monument
Review: Worth to visit when u are visiting ujjain.Just close to main jyotirling temple. Nice creature of king vikramaditya and 32 putli

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: One more museum
Review: museum is maintained by the government having nice collection of carvings collected from various excavated sites.

Name: vishalsomvanshi
Title: Museum moved to Triveni Museum.
Review: The place belongs to Vikram University and we were told that most of the artifacts have been moved to Triveni Museum. So if you are looking to visit the museum, please go to Triveni museum which will definitely positively surprise you.

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Historical
Review: I went to Vikram Kirti Mandir Museum. Built in 1965, this museum houses everything right from ancient manuscripts and coins to copper plates and fossils discovered in the Narmada Valley. You can pay your respects at the Vikram Kirti Mandir where the museum is situated. It is great place to go.

Name: Maneesh12345
Title: Small meusem in old temple
Review: This meusem is situated in vikramaditya temple. here they keep doing competition from time to time for children

Name: RamGanesan
Title: Not a great place
Review: This place has tons of things to see of Vikramaditya dynasty and local culture but could have been maintained better.  Place can be skipped if one does not find time in Ujjain

Name: Manish B
Title: Good Place
Review: Vikram Kirti Mandir Museum was established in the year of 1965. The place is hosting artifacts found at the Narmada valley. Excellent place to visit. But the place needs maintenance and improvements.

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: Excellent Place with some require maintain
Review: Great museum with the story of history. But there is need of maintain of museum. Must be visit by everyone.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Excellent museum but badly maintained.
Review: It was established in 1965 on the occasion of the second millennium of the Vikram era. The archaeological museum here exhibits a variety of pottery, copper utensils and fossils that have been discovered from Narmada valley. The Vishnu gallery has the finest collection of Vishnu sculptures in the country. The museum also has an impressive collection of sculptures from the Parmar and Partihar period.

Name: Avdhesh K
Title: Niclely located Museum
Review: Great leader vikram aditya's stuff are all here, place for history lovers, thrill seekers and it is very nicely located, must visit in ujjain, this is the real place there is another place too with Vikram aditya statue.

Name: Apoorv Joshi
Title: can be better
Review: vikram kirti mandir museum tells about the history of the ujjain.it is good museum but goverment need to maintain this place.

Name: npn2000
Title: Vikram Kirti Mandir Museum
Review: Vikram Kirti Mandir Museum ujjain is on dewas raod and is place for cultural activity and well known place

Name: rahulkumar1411
Title: vikram kirti museum
Review: this museum talk about the history of ujjain.its has many evidence of mauryan dynasty.like coins,utensils n all.if you are history lover then you would love this place

Name: VivekRastogi
Title: Not Great like other museum
Review: Vikram Kirti Mandir Museum is not great like other museum of India, where we can find our culture and Historical evidences. Govt. should keep it clean and should have more information about available articles.

Name: Rebekka N
Title: Disgrace
Review: We had a hard time finding this museum and its not hard to understand why..............it's in damp building ,overgrown with mildew and surrounded by weeds. The collection of stone sculptures have not seen the hands of a curator. It contents are honot remarkable as compared to the state museum at Bhopal.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: A special temple to clear debts
Review: As name suggested Ranmukteshwar ( Ran or Rin in English we call it debt ) so people visited this place and conduct pooja to get free from liabilities and debts.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Ranmukteshwar Temple
Review: Ranmukteshwar Temple, it is a small temple of lord shiva near to bank of Shipra river. this is not a big temple like others.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Shiva temple
Review: This is a small temple on the banks of shipra river dedicated to lord shiva worshipped in lingam form.

Name: akankshacoolgirl
Title: Famous
Review: Ranmukteshwar Temple is a famous temple in Ujjain and is very conveniently located along the banks of a small lake

Name: Sunil K
Title: Ranmukteshwar temple on Bharatrihari caves and bank of Kshipra
Review: The temple is very nice and below of Big Banayan Tree and on the bank of River Kshipra , also there is one Gaushala where you can feed the grass to cows there. Very very calm and spiritual place to sit watch the river and greenery.

Name: garhwaliya
Title: Huge temple
Review: This temple is very huge. This is very much peaceful. Many families come here. Many people with friends also come here.

Name: Abhishek Shrivastav
Title: Great Experience
Review: Ranmukteshwar Temple is located very near from the main ujjain city and it's easily accessible.Made up in a really nice historical structure.Must visit

Name: cavesStar
Title: holy place
