Review: very calm place and you will feel the holiness. we stayed there for sometime, it is under banyan tree, there is a lot of shade, kids enjoyed very well. shiv ling is marvellous, within the trunk of tree.

Name: npn2000
Title: Ranmukteshwar Temple
Review: Ranmukteshwar Temple must vist place during temple tour at ujjain ,one of the unique temple of its kind

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Place where Harischchandra was relieved of his debts
Review: Situated on the banks of Shipra, the temple is built under a banyan tree, more than hundred years old. The garbha griha enshrines Shiv ling within the trunk of the tree. Outside the temple is the idol of Virbhadra. It is said that King Harsihchandra was freed from his debt to Rishi Vishwamitra after he prayed to Shiv under this tree.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Temple of lord bhairav
Review: There are various forms of lord bhairav , vikrant bhairav is one of the form , its a small temple , you can find few visitors at this place

Name: rathod2017
Title: Vikrant Bhairav Shrine
Review: Vikrant Bhairav Shrine, this temple is also dedicated to lord Kaal Bhairav. there is a huge idol of the lord.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: One of the nine bhairavars
Review: There are nine temples exclusively dedicated to nine forms of bhairavars in the city of ujjain like kasi and this is one form of bhairavar

Name: akankshacoolgirl
Title: Huge Idol
Review: Vikrant Bhairav Shrine is dedicated to Lord Vikramaditya and has a huge idol of the Lord.This is a very famous temple

Name: Bimal0401
Title: Temple of the KING
Review: The temple of King Vikramadatya of Ujjain. Very huge idol of king is established in the temple. It is recommended to visit at Ujjain

Name: Hiten_Rathod
Title: Rewind your childhood stories - Vikram & Vaital,
Review: During my first visit to Ujjain made it a point to visit this place as heard and read many stories of famous Vikram and Vaital specially being a Gujarati.Visit to this place refreshed and rewound all those memoirs and felt alive.Though a small place but whoever has heard of Vikram and Vaital would definitely visit this place once if in Ujjain specially to familiarise our young generation of our legacy.Share the story of a shephard who used to sit on a sand mound and deliver judgements which used to be so perfect that people used to wonder how such a small boy could perform such acts? On digging the mound a maginificent throne with 32 dolls/fairies was unearthed............you have to take this forward friends.Enjoy.

Name: authorneelesh
Title: in a smashan
Review: this is a smashan bhairav temple.we went to it because we were told it is very good but can be avoided since there is nothing great about it and it is too off the normal track

Name: uday s
Title: The temple has a history
Review: This shrine was partially open when we visited it. Though it is quite famous, our guide could not explain it's history in detail.

Name: Phb0414
Title: must visit for me in ujjain
Review: i am born and brought up in ujjain... since my childhood days we have been visiting this temple every sunday... though many changes have taken plce since then... its one of the oldest temple in ujjain in bhairavgarh near kal bhairav temple....

Name: Jitesh A
Title: Vikrant bhairav mandir
Review: situated at the bank of kshipra river and near to kal bhairav mandir. Very calm and spiritual place. known for tantri kriyas and all.

Name: perplexed_soul
Title: A temple for Vikramaditya
Review: A good place dedicated to great Ujjaini king Vikramaditya and also his courtesans. It is well decorated during most festivals. Nice place to go out with family.

Name: rahulkumar1411
Title: vikrant bhairav temple
Review: i been there during durga poja and decoration was awsum.durin navratri their bhairav asthmi celebrated,people visit this place during makar sankranti raksha bandhan also

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Relatively new temple dedicated to king Vikramaditya
Review: Located near the Harsiddhi Mata temple it is a relatively new temple dedicated to king Vikramaditya and the nine gems of his court- Kalidas, Amaranth, Shapanak,  Dhanvantri, Varruchi, Varahmihir, Ghatakpar, Shanku and Vetalbhadra.

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Jai Bhukhi Mata
Review: Bhukhi mata temple is situated on the banks of river shipra close to Datta Akhara Ghat which was built by king Vikramaditya. Inside main temple two goddesses are seated on main stage. Two are believed to be sisters, one of them known as Bhukhi maa and other is known as Dhumavati. This temple is also called as Bhuvaneshwari Bhukhi mata mandir.  There are two lamp pillars in the temple, which are lit during Navaratri's. Every year on the eighth day of Navaratri, on the Occasion of Nagar puja and on the occasion of Simhashta (Which helds once in twelve years)  special worship is done by offering liquor to the mother.

Name: Sunnilbgautam
Title: Temple on bank of River Shipra
Review: This beautiful small temple located on the bank of river shipra on one side and road on another. This temple is very famous among locales.There always some feast (bhandara) aur Anushthaan happening almost every day.Must visit this temple for history and serene.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Mata temple near shipra river
Review: Its one of the temple of goddess Mataji , in indian mythology there are multiple name for the same god and way of worship is different at different place.

Name: rathod2017
Title: Bhukhi Mata Temple
Review: Bhukhi Mata Temple is located at bank of shipra river. this temple is dedicated to bhukhi mata. such  a peaceful place.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Mata temple
Review: This is one of the several temples along the banks of river shipra dedicated to mata and was mostly famous among the locals.

Name: akankshacoolgirl
Title: Nice Soothing experience
Review: Our visit to Bhukhi Mata temple gave a very soothing experience as the place is very peaceful and you can have a nice bath at the ghat

Name: Veer2468
Title: Temple!
Review: Bhukhi Mata Temple is one of the best temples in Ujjain city. Very nice place to visit in the city. Very calm.

Name: Maneesh12345
Title: situted on bank of river
Review: very nice place to visit in the morning and in the night time to avoid rush to get the feel of the calm nature.This is temple of goddess dhumAvati and chhinnamastagood place for pictures

Name: Prat C
Title: Tales,tales,tales!Lies,Lies,everywhere! Sincerest advice:"Read the scriptures"! And find the truth yourself!
Review: All the info is manipulated regarding many places in ujjain,The govt.of Madhya Pradesh themself have remodulated and modified many temples in ancient style to make people beleive that this is the "True Glorious Past of The Pradesh"! Well the truth is bitter,it is not so!

Name: yogindery
Title: Bhukhi Mata Temple
Review: Bhukhi Mata Temple is also best attraction of religious perone sight seeing place in ujjain.this is also a famous place for travelers coise.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Assocaited with Vikramaditya
Review: According to a popular belief associated with this temple, the goddesses of Ujjain demanded that a youth be sacrificed to them daily. The citizens were in great agony but they were helpless. Finally, one mother approached king Vikramaditya and demanded that he save her son. The king told the mother that he would appeal to the goddesses and if they did not agree he would sacrifice himself that day. Before night set in, the king arranged a huge feast. The flavours of different delicious dishes scented the air so much so that the appetites of the goddesses were appeased. They came to enjoy the food while the king hid himself below the table. On top of this table he had placed the replica of a man made of sweets. As the goddesses enjoyed the hearty meal and were about to leave, one of them happened to glance at the replica. She ate the replica and wondered aloud as to who could have kept it there. At that moment, Vikramaditya showed himself. The goddess asked him to express a wish. Vikramaditya requested that she should never cross to this side of the river. Pleased by his courage, she agreed. The goddess was Bhukhi Mata and the king made a temple in her honour on the other side of the river. Since then, she never came to trouble the people of Ujjain and no more young men were sacrificed.

Name: Saurabh K
Title: temple of bhookhi mata with some history
Review: this is a good temple situated at the bank of kshipra river. many historical story is related to this temple and king of ujjain (raja vikrmaditya.). this is a small temple. but it is crowded and during sinhastha and not clean. but rest of the year it is not much crowded and also clean. you wil get a view of kshipra river as well, which is a holy river according to Hindu religion.

Name: vipin360
Title: Too crowded on Simhastha occassion
Review: The temple is located on the banks of river Shipra. One can get an excellent view of the newly constructed Narsimha Ghat where one can get a holi dip.

Name: guptaashok_0511
Title: Relegious Place
Review: This is a very popular place among locals. The temple is across the Ramghat. A very simple temple. It has 2 deities.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Its a Iskon temple
Review: ISKON is international organisation and having many temples across the world. Radha manmohan temple is one of them dedicated to lord krishna

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: One of the iskcon temples
Review: This is one of the branches of the famous jakson temple maintained by the international society of the followers of lord krishna here in Ujjain that is well maintained,clean and organize d as usual.

Name: akankshacoolgirl
Title: Peaceful
Review: Radha Madan Mohan Temple is a peaceful temple in the Bharatpuri area dedicated to Lord Krishna and Radha

Name: Veer2468
Title: Very nice place
Review: This is another place which you must visit when you are in Ujjain city. Very lovely place to visit in city

Name: garhwaliya
Title: Lovely place
Review: This place is very much lovely and beautiful.Lots of people come here and sit ideally and practice meditation.

Name: Abhishek Shrivastav
Title: Calm and Serene
Review: Radha Madan Mohan temple is so beautiful that you won't feel like returning back home.Its calm,serene and beautiful.

Name: npn2000
Title: Sri Sri Radha Madan Mohan Temple
Review: Sri Sri Radha Madan Mohan Temple is another temple at ujjian on dewas road , beautiful architecture .

Name: rahulkumar1411
Title: krishna temple
Review: devotee of krishna muse.i love going to this place whenever go to see this temple.its beautiful temple with nice architectecture.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Madan Mohan temple
Review: You will not find any reference to this temple on the internet. The references are more for the more advertised ISCKON temple. This temple situated right on the Ram Ghat is hardly visited. Built by Bayaji bai the temple houses the idol of Madan Mohan. The wooden beams and doors are intricately carved. It is a nice peaceful temple away from the hustle and bustle of the otherwise crowded temples of Ujjain

Name: Sunnilbgautam
Title: Could be best monument for tourist in Malwa
Review: The palace and its surroundings are so beautiful. You imagine the grandeur of this place. If maintain well by ASI or government funding. This place can be the best tourist attraction for Ujjain, Malwa. This place got all the box tick for tourist attraction, like grandeur, greenery and history.

Name: aliasgarkb
Title: Dilapidated and neglected
Review: This is a beautiful monsoon gateaway of Ujjain town. With spectacular water bodies and a rich history it is worth a visit. But due to vandalism by local visitors and administration's apathy this is in bad shape. Garbage is littered all around the river and palace premises. Locals use it for secret datings, drinking and gambling. The watchmen and on-duty policemen too join them. Only the Sun temple is open for visitors while other chambers and halls are inaccessible. The administration is unable to guard and preseve it so they find an easy solution of locking it.

Name: OnAir57972109282
Title: Visit to Kalideh palace
Review: There is a sun temple in a small part of the palace and rest of the palace is shabby and not accessible. looks like there is no administration in this palace which is situated in the banks of shipra river.  We saw that lot of people settled in the corridors of palace and it is not maintained well. However, the river view was fine.

Name: Gdj
Title: KD PALACE UJJAIN
Review: This is one of most favourite picnic destination in ujjain for rainy season at the shipra river.economoc and convenient placr for middle class people.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Heritage marvel of ujjain
Review: Its of the heritage marvel of ujjain , althoughd dont expect much cause the main building is damaged but if you are visiting this place in monsoon than ambiance is really cool. there are 52 small kund in front of palace which is a main attraction during monsoon

Name: rathod2017
Title: Kalideh Palace
Review: Situated on an island based in the Shipra River. well maintained place. yoh have to pay first to visit this place.

Name: RanjithKumarPrabhu
Title: Palace maintained by ASI
Review: Located in the banks of Kshipra. This palace is in ruins and entry is denied inside due to its damaged condition. Seems ASI is reluctant in maintaining it. Built during the era of Muhammed Khilji, the boards show that Akbar and Jehangir also visited here. The palace was later in the hands of Scindia dynasty. There is also a surya mandir inside.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Maintained  by the asi.
Review: The palace is maintained by asi of india and has a entry fees for a visit, and views From the place were extremely nice.

Name: akankshacoolgirl
Title: Needs Maintenance
Review: Kalideh Palace is a very old palace and is centuries old. However, the place needs maintenance and improvement

Name: Richs V
Title: Disappointing
Review: I went for this place specially but totally wastage of time.There are 52 kunds in which there is no water and palace is nothing but a ruined palace.

Name: Masayoshi
Title: Good for me
Review: I'm visiting lots of forts in the world.From that perspective, this is a unique fort to me.Looks intentionally built the structure along the rivers to protect themselves from enemies.Imagined the life of the days when prosperity was here.Enjoyed the view.

Name: blacksteallion
Title: Ruined yet Beautiful
Review: This is one of the famous attraction for tourists coming to Ujjain. This is located right on the bank of Shipra River and has good photography spots. Though this is a ruined palace it is sparkling and attractive.

Name: R_Saksena
Title: An old Palace on the bank of river Shipra
Review: It is an old palace, may be more than 500 years old of Muslim era, was also renovated by Scindias. It is away form the main city of Ujjain, located in a serene place. It has a main structure with beautiful carvings, domes and gates, a nice architectural marvel. There is a pond surrounded by small structures with domes and gates. It has an ancient Sun Temple within. The building upkeep is not up-to-the-mark, if properly developed it has a potential for becoming the best picnic spot in the vicinity of Ujjain.

Name: Manish B
Title: Ancient Structure
Review: Kalideh Palace is situated at the bannk of river kshripa and its one of the most visited place in the list of MP tourism. It was build around 1458 A.D and since than it was restored many times.

Name: perplexed_soul
Title: Historical and nice outing spot
Review: one more place in Ujjain with historical significance. Lately, it has turned out into a good picnic spot as well. It is generally a good family outing place during spring or autumn.

Name: road2parin
Title: Aarti at the ghats
Review: When in Ujjain, visit this Shipra river ghat in the evening around 6 or 7pm and it will remind you of the famous aarti we see in Haridwar.. There are pandits who pray with lights on the both the banks of the river and it is a beautiful sight.

Name: shailesh j
Title: good to visit in rainy season only
Review: the palace is not well maintained and it is very old. there are not well maintained roads to reach there, one have to ask villagers to reach the place. back-side of the palace there is river shipra. when I visited the flow was decent and people use to njoy there. apart from that their is nothing near Palace

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: A stunning piece of rich heritage
Review: The Kaliadeh Palace is located on the banks of the River Shipra .The Avanti-mahatmya of Skanda Purana has recorded a description of the Sun temple and two tanks here- Surya Kunda and Brahma Kunda. A fragmented inscription recovered from this place records building of the palace in 1458 AD, by Sultan of Malwa, Mahmud Khilji. The palace is built over a mound and gives a beautiful view of the surrounding area. The central dome of the palace is a beautiful example of Persian architecture. There are several underground chambers some of which once served as royal kitchen.  Colonel Stewart records in his book ‚ÄúHistory of Central India‚Äù that later Sultan Naseeruddin Khilji diverted the flow of Shipra River through 52 tanks so that water cooled down considerably. Addicted to mercury, the Sultan used to lie down intoxicated in the tanks. He is later believed to have drowned in one of these tanks while lying down intoxicated. Two Persian inscriptions found in one of the long corridors of the palace record the visits of Emperor Akbar and Jahangir to this palace According to Abul Fazal‚Äôs Akbarnama, Mughal emperor Akbar rested at this the palace on 25 Jan, 1599 during his Deccan military campaign. Later in 1616, Jahangir stayed with Sir Thomas Roe in this palace. During his stay here, Jahangir used to visit regularly saint Jadrup who had his hut in the jungles nearby. He used to travel by boat to listen to holy discourses.The palace was destroyed in the time of the Pindaris. In 1886 Sir Michale Filose partially restored the palace and used it as his residence. After his death the palace again fell into ruins. It was then restored by Madhav Rao Scindia in 1920. He added many buildings such as the court, guest house and other state offices. The Sun Temple was also restored by the family.

Name: Sonia Sandhu
Title: Not sure if its worth a visit!
Review: I visited this palace with a great expectation of a heritage site and it was a huge disappointment. The palace is not maintained at all. Its terrible to see such a negligence to the heritage property. All garbage around. Sadly i wont recommend anyone to visit this place.

Name: mayaKasaragod
Title: Requires lot of attention.
Review: This is the only place in MP tourist area appeared very dirty and neglected. This property belongs to Scindia family. There is a Raja mahal and Rani Mahal and near the bridge the water storage area is there. But Palace in ruins Where MP tourism started maintaining. The Water body requires cleaning, which will be  very dirty during winter and Summer when water level goes down. The Rani Mahal can be converted into either a beautiful resort or a school.Difficult locate easily, because very few will be knowing about this place.Should ask about Bhavan kund, to locate this.

Name: VivekRastogi
Title: The place of Kalia Naag and Surya Temple
Review: Kalideh palace is also called KD palace. It is well known as Sindhia's palace, earlier Sindhia dynasty was staying at KD palace as and when they pay visit to ujjain. As Mahakal is the only one Maharaja of Ujjain. At the back of KD Palace Kshipra River front is very attractive.. Its very good picnic spot.

Name: electron2014
Title: Terrible place, Nothing is there
Review: I went to Kalideh Palace and found very hard to search this place. There were no signboards marking this and I could find the signboard 500 mtrs just before the place. When I reached there in evening, I was surprise by its condition -- the walls are broken and ceiling is falling. Building is unstable and I would recommend not to go inside and be safe. Disklikes* No signboards* As marketed on Incredible India portal, you won't find it like that. Its waste of time. * Place is not safe, building might fall anytime. * Place is not maintained

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Palace in bad shape !
Review: Situated on the banks of the Shipra, the island-like site immediately conjures up the natural beauty of ancient Ujjain which poets down the ages have waxed lyrical. The glorious landscape of the flowing river on both sides of the palace and the man-made tanks and channels, with water gurgling through them, provide a spectacular backdrop to the imposing building.The central dome of the palace is a beautiful example of Persian architecture. Two Persian inscriptions found in one of the long corridors of the palace record the visits of Emperor Akbar and Jehangir to this palace.The palace was broken down in the time of the Pindaris and was restored by Madhav Rao Scindia in 1920 to its present glory. The Sun Temple was also restored by the family.Present MP government should take initiative to restore the glory.

Name: Rebekka N
Title: Kalideh Palace ,Ujjain
Review: Ujjain is a temple town. If you are not a pilgrim then dont go there , its messy and ugly except for one magical place : the Kalideh Palace on the Shipra river , just outside Ujjain. It's a large Muslim era haveli , out of red sandstone with minarets and jharokas , absolutely beautiful and spectacularly located directly on an island on the Shipra .It is approached by a arched causeway over the now polluted Shipra. The building is practically derelict , all the entrances are boarded up except for one which has been opened to create a Ram mandir. The guide book says that there is an inscription inside the building to  record the visits of Emperors Akbar and Jehangir. It's a tragedy that the state has allowed it to go to ruin,

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: small temple near shipra river
Review: its a small temple near shipra river where you can find extreme peace and silence. a nice place to visit for occassional visits.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Founder of nath followers
Review: The place is a shrine of pir matsyendranath,who was the founder of nath form of worship of shivam, that's located on a hill top on the bank's of river shipra close to kale temple and the famous caves.

Name: Ajay KMehta
Title: Very Peaceful
Review: Simple un appointed place of one of the great yogis  and teachers of Yoga.He was the physical teacher of Sri Gorakhnath ji who is considered an incarnation of Shiva.Hopefuly devotees will take better care of this place.

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Famous Attraction
Review: I went to Pir Matsyendranath. It was constructed in remembrance of the greatest leaders of the Natha sect of Saivism-Matsyendranath, very much like all the other monuments. This is a famous attraction on the banks of River Shipra. It is great place to go.

Name: niya27
Title: Little far away
Review: This place is approximately 8-10 kilometers from ujjain. This place is worshipped by both Hindu and Muslim Religion people. None was there when I visited this place.

Name: Maneesh12345
Title: Samadi of Pir Matsyendranath
Review: If you wish to skip this place you can do that.Many people here visit in black dress who are  disciple of Guru Matsyendranath. I was sitting here for long and it was a other type of experience of my life. Really if you need an experience of paranormal then you must visit here.

Name: samsamal
Title: Samadhi of Matsyendranath
Review: Matsyendranath, the founder of Nath cult  and Guru of Gorakshnath took samadhi at this place on the outskirts of Ujjain.The samadhi is decorated with flowers.A must visit for mythology, legends lovers and also who believe in beliefs / faith and look forward to positives, life has to offer.Its believed that he mastered 84 mahasiddhis (supernatural powers).Very serene and calm place, hardly a visitor except a couple of Nath yogis who stay nearby. Muslims also revere the saint and hence also known as Pir Matsyendranath. It's on the same tour circuit as Bhatrihari caves and Garhkalika mandir.Parking space and a toilet is available.

Name: Manish B
Title: Tomb of Matsyendra Nath
Review: This Tomb of Matsyendra Nath who follow Nath sect. Near to Brathari caves and gar kalika temple at the bank of river Shipra. Matsyendranath ji was the master of Guru Gorakshnath who started Hath Yoga. One good place to visit.

Name: Shubham06
Title: Fine place if you have time
Review: People can go out for a stroll if you haven't visited. one of loads of religious places in the city of Ujjain.

Name: Apoorv Joshi
Title: samadhi
Review: this place will come between if you take tour of ujjain with any tour operator.if you are short in time then you can skip it otherwise good place to visit.

Name: npn2000
Title: Pir Matsyendranath
Review: Pir Matsyendranath is at outer part of ujjian and is worth to visit during Bhartihari caves and other temple on the way

Name: JAGDISH RAVAL
Title: Average Place
Review: One can skipp this from tourist list. The place is dedicated to Matsyendranath. He was first Nath of Nine Nath. Hindu and muslim both comes here for offering prayer so called Pir Matsyendranath.

Name: VivekRastogi
Title: Master of Guru Goraksnath
Review: This is the samadhi place of Pir Matsyendranth, Pir Matsyendranth mastered 84 mahasiddhies and he was the master of Guru Goraksnath. He has written and develop Hath Yoga. and started a school with Guru Goraksnath.Here I am getting peace of mind and getting some Paranormal experience. Here one can find sometimes many person wearing black cloths. They are the disciple of Guru Matsyendranath. I was sitting here for long and it was a other type of experience of my life. Really if you need an experience of paranormal then you must visit here. Few tips - 1. Don't drink and go.2. Pregnant ladies should avoid the place to visit.

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Samadhi
Review: Matsyendranatha or Machindranath was one of the eighty-four Mahasiddhas. He was the guru of Gorakshanath, with whom he founded the school of Hatha yoga.This place is very small but very serene place.Holy shrine.

Name: loki_knows
Title: small but nice
Review: This is a small temple situated near Bartruhari caves and Gadkalika temple. It is built in memory of Matsyendranath, the temple is flocked by both hindus and muslims.he Hindus and the Muslims of Ujjain equally revere at this attractive shrine on the banks of the Shipra, Pir Matsyendranath. When Excavations were conductedat this site some antiques, dating back to the 6th and 7th century BC were found. Though this shrine is not a marvel in terms of architecture, its simple white structure with a dome flanked by small minarets on four sides provides a serene appeal to the surroundings.Visit when you are near ujjain.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: One of the famous mata temple of ujjain
Review: it situated at heart of the city , as per name Nagarkot ( means godess mataji is the caretaker of every citizen of the city and she take care them ) you can find hugh crowd there during the navratri festival

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Queen of the city temple
Review: The temple has a significant importance both arciologically and traditionally due to its association with the famous king of the region ,the vikram adithya,and ,the nath followers.its considered as the protected deity of the city.

Name: akankshacoolgirl
Title: Best to visit during Navratri
Review: We visited Nagarkot ki Rani Temple during Navratri & the temple was very beautifully decorated with flowers and fruits

Name: Veer2468
Title: Nice temple
Review: Its a good temple to visit in Ujjain city. Beautifully decorated. Peaceful and calm. It is one of the ancient temple.

Name: Manish B
Title: Ancient Temple
Review: Another very good temple and ancient temple to visit and worship the goddess. During navratri the temple is beautifully decorated and lots of people visit the temple.

Name: Shubham06
Title: Nice during Navaratri
Review: it is a good sight during the period of navaratri when everything is glittering and shining and filled with people.

Name: npn2000
Title: Nagarkot ki Rani Temple
Review: Nagarkot ki Rani Temple is another landmark temple and ponds around, special lighting in navratri festival

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Ancient temple established by Vikramaditya
Review: Nagarkot Ki Rani is the guardian deity of the south-west corner of the city. The temple is believed to have been established by Vikramaditya. Behind the temple is Govardhan sagar, one of the seven sacred lakes of Ujjain.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: simple temple.
Review: its a simple temple situated at center of the city , if you are spiritual lover than you can visit and experience it

Name: Gdj
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: Nice place to visit. Most famous lord chitragupta temple in ujjain.a lot of devotee visit there in regular basis.

Name: ashish saxena
Title: CHitragupta mandir is very informative mandir
Review: This temple is a little away from city center, but if you ara really interested in Hindu mythology then you must visit this temple. This is one of oldest temple of God CHITRAGUPT along with God YAAMDEV . you will find Arati of God Chitragupt over here.This temple must be renovated, either MP govt., PURATTAV Deptt. or some BHAMASHAH must adopt this temple for renovation.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: One of the four temples
Review: This is one of the must visit temple in the city of ujjain dedicated to chitrgupta who has temples dedicated to him in some four cities in india and he is considered to be the assistant of yaman,

Name: akankshacoolgirl
Title: One of a Kind
Review: Shree Chitragupta Dham is dedicated to Lord Chitragupta and is not a very frequently visited temple amongst the locals

Name: Vidhi_sharmah
Title: good one
Review: not many temples are dedicated to lord chitragupta and so this is one of its kind temple and a must visit place

Name: Veer2468
Title: Nice place!
Review: This place is really huge. It is also a holy place. Good place to visit with family. Peaceful and divine

Name: garhwaliya
Title: Big worship place
Review: The infrastructure of this place is very very huge. This is really peaceful place. Many people come here and do the worship here.

Name: Abhishek Shrivastav
Title: Holy Place
Review: Shree chitgragupta maharaj is the lord of kayastha and I belong to the community.Its always special to be in his holy temple.

Name: Amit jain
Title: NATURE SAFARI
Review: Excellent place for bird watch, photography, nature movie making, environmental education , Initiative by Forest Department Ujjain. NATURE INTERPRETATION CENTRE BUILDING needs to be decorated by wild life pics , wildlife n nature movie should be shown. Night safari and camping arrangement needed.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: A good initiative to promote eco tourism
Review: its a initiative by municipal corporation and govt where they are trying to establish a place where people can visit and understand the importance of nature.

Name: Kapil S
Title: Worst experience
Review: There is nothing in this park. I would not even call it a park. We paid 100 rupees for car and 10 rupees entry fee for each person. Don't waste your time and money. Stay away.

Name: prem M
Title: Nature safsri
Review: Ecotourism park created at NAULAKHI , maxi road ujjain at a 15 year old a man-made Forest (named Naulkhi bead). Initially only grass grew there but due to repeated plantation various years it transformed into a Forest . An Ecotourism Park development with the help of MPEDB, BHOPAL with an objective to provide environmental spa to people near city.One can visit this area for mental calm, digital detox, calory burning, and many more fun activities with a fresh food cafeteria to enjoy the moments.

Name: Cruiser331903
Title: When i visit there i got a lot of joy.
Review: To know the environment ,bird,nature & wild life.you may visit there with your family without any fear . but com with some sneaks ,drinking water also bcz u need in this tour.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Small temple at kartik chawk
Review: Its a small temple for the worship of lord jagdish one of the form of lord krishna. idols of Radha and krishna is there.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Famous among the locals
Review: The place is famous among locals can be seen around more then the tourists in this mandhir located in kartik chowk in ujjain.

Name: Veer2468
Title: Divine!
Review: This is one of the oldest temple in Ujjain city. Very peaceful and calm. This place also has an amazing view.

Name: vinsach
Title: Jagdish Mandir
Review: Nice temple near kartik chowk very peaceful and calming place .conveyance to this place is a bit difficult.

Name: Shubham06
Title: Good vicinity
Review: It is an amazing place mostly due to the surroundings. Standing near the river Shipra with an amazing view.

Name: npn2000
Title: Shree Jagdish Mandir
Review: Shree Jagdish Mandir is one of the old temple near river kshipra on the road ,not too far .visit and enjoy ujjain temple trip

Name: Amit_holiday
Title: Beautiful garden..
Review: Anubhuti Garden was a nice clean beautiful garden. Its a small but very well maintained. Located in Ujain.

Title: small clean garden
Review: its a small garden located close to kothi palace in ujjain , where you find accupressure pathway and other excercise instruments , its well maintained and clean
